Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: KarynB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a roadshow in September 2011 for a weekend. Hotel's location was perfect, close enough to the train station by a short taxi ride and a quick walk from the centre of the canals and restaurant hub of Amsterdam. Rooms were large and very well appointed. Beds very comfortable. The welcome sweets were also a nice touch. Staff were all very friendly breakfast could get very busy so was best to go early or order room service, especially if tour groups are in house. Conference rooms were located in an adjacent building but very accessible. Bar staff were amazing - espeically when we were still hungry and the kitchen had closed, the cheese and mustard was amazing, am now addicted. A great hotel to stay in for both business and leisure trips. Hope to stay again whenever I am next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: travelmaster
Reviews.Content: Chose it from here on the recommendation of location and we were not disappointed. At first we were given a room with a window overlooking the atrium, so we asked for a change and moved to room 616 which we were more than happy with and thought it better then the business class room we could have upgraded to. It only had roof top views but was lovely and quiet and we were able to sleep with the aircon off and windows open. Really comfortable beds, we asked for extra pillows and duvet and they arrived within minutes. Very happy with the staff atttitude. We didn't eat in the hotel but I am sure it was ok. You can walk almost anywhere in the city from the hotel and I would certainly return here on our next time in Amsterdam (which we loved).

Reviews.Title: “Very Central Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giuzeppe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very centrally located in a quiet area, just off all the hustle and bustle and yet within easy reach. Spent 2 nights over a weekend and stayed in a Superior room which was very spacious, tidy and well equipped with modern furniture. Clean and neat bathroom. Very good breakfast and even better it was included in price of room. Booked a double room and only realised that it was twin-bedded instead of a double bed when we went to sleep on the first night, so did not bother to complain as each bed was big enough and comfortable. We were given a room on the front of hotel as requested at time of booking. No street noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent on a stay at the Radisson Blu!”
Reviews.Author: K3215
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a business class room for 3 nights. The room had been recently renovated and done to a high standard. Lovely large windows, loved the underfloor heating in the bathroom. We drank in the bar a few times, bottle of wine is 24 euros, in line with Amsterdam prices. We had the breakfast buffet, and also ordered room service a few times, lovely food! Friendly, helpful staff. Great location, would reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGyneco
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel from start to finish. not the cheapest but great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business and leisure!”
Reviews.Author: Kjell H
Reviews.Content: This Radisson Blu Hotel has a nice and quiet location, situated just a short and charming stroll away from the Dam Square, Rembrandtplein and the Red Light District. The hotel offers more or less all you need, i.e. a fitness center. The breakfast has a wide variety of food, warm and cold. Fresh orange juice is always present and you can order the type of coffee you want, in addition to eggs prepared your way. The staff is friendly and very serviceminded! This is sort of an expensive hotel option but for me this was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and neat!”
Reviews.Author: Edelvisr
Reviews.Content: My husband spent hours trying to choose the best hotels for our trip.... And the Radisson Blu was very good! Near to everything, clean, good breakfast, good service! I will certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: elisabethperth
Reviews.Content: A well appointed hotel in central ideal location to explore Amsterdam . It was on the expensive side but for for new year below that asked by comparable hotels. Our business class room was not spacious but comfortable for two. We were thankful to be close to but yet way from the New Year crowd that congregated around Dam Square. Front desk were helpful and free wifi worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Basecamp for sightseeing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen999
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu is a comfortable modern hotel situated very conveniently in the heart of Old Amsterdam, just far enough away from the red light / coffee shop district to be safe and quiet without becoming sterile; but close enough to the main shops, restaurants, and art galleries that you can easily walk. There are two buildings: the picturesque one with views of the canals is used in the advertising; and another across the road with an American-style inner courtyard/lobby where all room windows look inwards into the interior of the hotel. We stayed in the later which had a wonderful old bar and a very good restaurant - which meant we didn't need to wander far after a long days walking round the city in the cold of winter. I would recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: vladislavs999
Reviews.Content: The location, rooms, service and food are great. Couldn't find any drawback at all. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem. A bit expensive but great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MiriamPablo
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to Amsterdam ~5 times and everytime I make sure to book at the Radisson Blu. Although it's a bit expensive, you get your money's worth. Hotel in the center of the city, but on a surprisingly quite and secluded street. Not noisy at all even though the Red Light District is around the corner. Good breakfast w/ many options (hot and cold foods). Very friendly staff. Free Wi-fi. Heated bathroom floor (great for those that might doze off near the toilet after a night of partying-LOL) A bit expensive, but great price for the location. Walking distance to everything a vacationing tourist could want.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Dejunkdiva
Reviews.Content: lovely room - friendly staff - central location - good breakfast - quick check out. Would recommend - and return when in Amsterdam [:

Reviews.Title: “Disrespectful to its Chain Name”
Reviews.Author: adamakosa
Reviews.Content: Leisure trip, lots of positive reviews for various hotels of the Radisson Chain. I was actually looking forward to visiting this centrally located hotel. Although its lobby is fascinating, i cannot state the same for the rooms. Ours was on the top floor, interesting view, spacious but the windows didn't close firmly, so cold and noise were our other two roommates. In my opinion, the hotel needs a renovation. The buffet breakfast was quite good. In a nutshell, old, a bit dingy, spacious room, breakfast quite good and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in very good locaton”
Reviews.Author: MiamiHappy_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Radisson Blu Â  Â  Â This hotel offer great service at a reasonable price. Â Check in and out was quick and efficient. Â Linda, the front desk clerk handled check-in and check-out quickly and efficiently. Â Although I arrived three hours before the official check-in time of 3PM, She gave me the room with no hesitation. Â She did the same at check-out, extending my ckeck-out time by 3 hours. Â I'm sure that the current occupation at those times made it possible, and there was no hesitation on her part and it was much appreciated as was the upgrade. My room was modern and beautiful. Â The Free expresso, tea and hot chocolate machine was a great bonus. The entire front desk staff was very helpful at all times. Â  I thought the very extensive buffet breakfast was too expensive for the normally small meal I take. Â  The close proximity to the Nieumarket area(5 minutes), Â with it's great number and variety of restaurants,Â Solved the problem of where to have breakfast and other meals. Â  Â  Didn't get a chance to use the gym aÂ but I was pleased that it was available . The close proximity to the Red Light district and Dam square made it easy to visit manyÂ  Popular Attractions. Â  Â I would not stay anywhere else when I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Super helpful staff and central location!”
Reviews.Author: section
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business and then the weekend for sightseeing. Close to many restaurants and excellent staff available to help you out. Lunch and breakfast were very good the times I ate there. Charming area close enough to the train station though some streets would be tough to mange with rolling luggage. There are actually 2 towers across the street from each other which are connected underground. It can be a pain to get back and forth to the lobby if you end up on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: catlin h
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 5 nights and spend them in Radisson Blu Hotel. It is very good postitioned,in centar of the old town, walking distance from all major places in Amsterdam. The bar in hotel is really nice and food is great! The room was clean and comfortable. This is not the first Radisson Hotel we are staying in and for sure not the last one!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: YinxFed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quiet, calm and stylish. We were delighted with our deluxe room which had a truly enormous bed! Hotel staff were friendly and efficient and seemed genuinely interested in our well-being. We're regular visitors to Amsterdam because I have family in the city, but this was our first time at this particular hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean. Very good position, from there you can walk everywhere”
Reviews.Author: R4ff4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean with a very nice staff. The room was nice, it was a superior one.it was nice and comfortable with a nespresso machine available.....it's soooooo cool to have a coffee when you are just awake!!! The bathroom is not the kind of bathroom you aspected to find in an hotel of such category: it was small and a little bit of old-looking. Anyway.....the floor was heated!!!!! :) The breakfast is too much expensive if not included with the room price. We had it inclused and was nice! The staff at the de palmboom, the restaurant of the hotel in which the breakfast is served, is kind and gives you all the attention. The breakfast is a buffet style breakfast and offers every kind of food. Muffin, yogurt, croissant, little bread but also sausages, potatoes, scrambled eggs and a lot of juices and many other things. I enjoyed it :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay--friendly, comfortable, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Amy_MP26
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect 4-night stay at the Radisson Blu, Amsterdam. We were celebrating our birthdays as well as being newlyweds and the hotel made it extra special for us. We were upgraded to their Business Class room which was very clean & comfortable with plenty of amenities. Arranged by family as a surprise to us, a delicious cake was delivered to our room moments after arrival. All of the employees we met even once then remembered us by name throughout the stay, and were very helpful whenever we had a question. We had breakfast included which included a nice selection of options from fruits, cereals, eggs, meats, breads, cheeses and beverages. The location was very convenient to walk to many attractions, and less than a mile from the train station. We felt very welcomed and relaxed throughout our stay and would definitely choose this hotel again if returning.

Reviews.Title: “Bad management attitude!”
Reviews.Author: 691Angela
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain about the location of this hotel as it is really central. Rooms are nicely decorated although they have no view which is disappointing. The one thing that spoiled our experience at this hotel was the attitude and manner of the assistant hotel manager at the check in desk. I have never met anyone so rude who works in the hospitality trade! After complaining to the hotel manager we still are waiting for an apology. All the other hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Good manners keeps customers returning! We wont be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room when upgraded”
Reviews.Author: rosumalmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my husband celebrating our 2nd anniversary. Got upgraded upon arrival to a business room in the newly renovated parts of the hotel - really liked it. WhatÂ´s also very nice about the hotel is that wifi is for free - huge plus. A minus was that the hotel seemed to be over booked. There was a long line just to get in to their breakfast rest. Since I was 7 months pregnant that made me furious not to mention sick from not getting breakfast when I needed it. I almost fainted off in the lobby and my husband had to lead me to the bar area to get some water and juice, we were both very mad since that ruined almost a whole day. They gave us a body for our at that time unborn as an apology - which was quite thoughtful. But still, not ok to have to wait like an hour for breakfast just because Radisson canÂ´t plan their bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: LadBroke8
Reviews.Content: The main reason why I booked this hotel is its great location... right in the heart of Amsterdam Centrum (within walking distance to Oude Kerk and Dam Square). We had a toddler with us and I didn't want to risk booking at a non-chain hotel. Having said that, I didn't feel any special treatment that a hotel of this type should be able to accord its guests. The standard room is quite roomy, but it seems all of them face inwards towards the hotel's atrium. So it can feel quite boxed in as you need your curtains shut the whole time. I asked for a room with a street or canal view but apparently, these are only available to higher tier rooms/suites. In my opinion, breakfast should be included as a standard across all of the hotel's packages. It's way too costly at EUR25 pppn. Fortunately, the hotel is close to restaurants and cafes. Our room was decorated in a Carnival theme: orange walls, bright yellow accents, orange curtains, high wattage lights, etc. Way too bright everywhere! Plus, there's quite a huge photo of a smiling woman in a Carnival headdress that was pretty disarming. Would have preferred a more toned-down, calmer feel to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as expected”
Reviews.Author: 00kiksu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet street but still very close to all the "action" in the city. 10min walk from Dam Square or Rembrandtplein. Also atleast 3 coffeeshops in 2min walking distance for all the hippies out there :) Delicious breakfast as usual in Radisson Hotels, our room was clean and cozy but it hadnt been renovated for a while. Staff was helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my anniversary. This was my first trip to Amsterdam and picked this hotel due to its central location. The hotel has a great atrium with room either facing in the atrium or outside. The room was nicely furnished with a comfortable bed and good facilities hair dryer, truser press iron etc. I also ate in thier resturant and had a great meal that was very reasonably priced. All in all a great time that made this anniversary one to remember. Thanks Radisson Blu Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfie h
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this place... lovely hotel (which is what you would expect of a radisson chain. )

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Kieronm44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend with my wife for a short break. Hotel was excellent. From check-in to check -out everything was really good. Staff very attentive and helpful. The hotel itself was very clean and modern. The room was very good with everything you need from iron to kettle for making tea/coffee ( my only little qualm was that when we made a cuppa there was no milk in the room) to mini-bar. Bed was massive and so comfortable. Wifi available in hotel free. Location was great. 5 mins walk to everything. Drink in the bar is a bit pricy but that comes with the territory I suppose. I will definitely stay here when I visit Amsterdam again and i would highly recommend this hotel for your stay if you are willing to pay that little bit extra. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation needed, but still very good”
Reviews.Author: Marchelo2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the center. Legally it is the same district with Red Light District (De Wallen). But it is in the quite street. You can reach virtually any attraction walking. Tram stop is not far. Location is excelent. Room are a bit outdated and renovation needed. On the other hand I would like to say that hotel tries to keep them in ideal condition. Everything is clean. I felt cofortable in this room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very good. You can ask chief to cook omlette especially for you. This is free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a nice location - Enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: doscal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few months ago while on a weekend trip to Amsterdam. I know Amsterdam quite well as I worked here a fair bit over the years. The hotels can all be much the same (relatively) poorish standard in this city, so its important to inform of a gem whence one is found :-). I woudl definitely recommend this hotel. Its close to the centre, its clean, the staff are nice, its close to the shopping precinct and generally I had no problems. (Even got an upgrade). If you are thinking of visiting this city, I would seriously consider this hotel - its quite good value and has everything you need to enjoy your visit. Everything interesting is within walking distance (more or less). Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: virtualewit
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend break in Amsterdam. We wanted a nice hotel with a central location and this was perfect. We received a very warm and professional welcome on arrival and I must say that all the staff were very friendly and helpful - from the room staff to the bar to reception. Our room (221) overlooked a small street behind the hotel. It was a good size and very clean. The bathroom was fine (nice underfloor heating) - just watch out for the step into the bathroom - we both stubbed our toes on it and ouch! Still, we learned quickly! Bed a little on the soft side for our tastes but actually a comfy sleep. The continental breakfast was very nice - that was the only meal we took in the hotel as there are lots of great places to eat in Amsterdam and you want to explore. We did visit the Pastorie Bar both evenings before going out - lovely atmosphere and excellent service again. Would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel lovely rooms fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: c1ss
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Blu for four nights with my girlfriend at the end of janurary. The hotel is ideally located within short walking distance of all central attractions in the city including dam square and central statiom yet still very quiet and relaxing. The hotel and its rooms are beautiful with good amenities and are well maintained. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. We opted to pay the little extra to avail of the breakfast buffet that was on offer every morning and were not disappointed. The breakfast room itself had a very nice appearance and was very efficiently run by the staff. The selection of both hot and cold food on offer was vast and all very tasty. A fantastic hotel well worthy of its 5star ***** rating!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location @ the Blu”
Reviews.Author: rrwatkins
Reviews.Content: Before going on a river cruise, we spent 3 extra days in Amsterdam at the Radisson Blu. If you like American style hotels, this one is for you. The rooms are quite large, very clean, & the usual amenities that one would expect from the Radisson chain. The location is in the inner ring of canals that circle the old part of the city & therefore a quick walk to the city center. The hotel has a very nice bar as well as a restaurant (but somewhat expensive). One word of caution! the hotel is located on both sides of the street. However, there is only one lobby. In order for us to get to our room we had to take an elevator down to the basement. Then we had to walk thru a tunnel that went under the street & take another elevator up to our room. Because of security, there was no way else for us to leave the building but by this route. If you decide to stay here, I suggest that you ask to be roomed on the side of the hotel that has the lobby so you won't waste so much time getting in & out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsGNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for a nice weekend. The hotel is in a great location in the centre of Amsterdam and is within easy walking distance of the main attractions and central station if you want to use the train to the airport. The rooms are well furnished and have all of the usual facilities needed. Considering the hotel is in central Amsterdam we were not disturbed by any noise over the weekend. The Pastorie bar within the hotel is a great place for a night cap and the barman is great - he managed to remember our names and room number! The Palmboom restaurant is very good, had a fantastic steak - the menu is quite limited but good quality and I think reasonably priced compared to other city centre restaurants. All staff were very helpful and pleasant. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Third time, same hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biavati
Reviews.Content: We use to be in this hotel each time we need to be in Amsterdam (such as for tourism, or waiting for a Schijpol Airport connection to Netherland Antilles, etc.). The location near Red district, well deep in the very heart of Amsterdam is unique. Radisson made a refurbish work really remarcable, adding new wings to the 1600 buildings on Rusland, and adding a lot of confort to the upper floor rooms. Penthouse crystal roof suites are so beautiful. Go for confort and excellent breakfast, professional staff and really good privacy. An international city hotel, but classy.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the pops in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Tomitronic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business January 2012. The hotel is in the middle of Amsterdam, yet up a quiet street (Rusland), so there's no noise, even at night. A canal is straight down the road from the Hotel, only 1 minuttes walking. Hotel includes a bar, and some rooms which overlook the reception and bar area. Cool. 5-10 minutes walk to the Red Light District (which, by the way, is no way what it used to be). Rooms have all the business class trimmings you'd expect, and plenty of space for everything. Breakfast great, but be sure it's included at your booking, otherwise it's very expensive to pay for upfront. Staff were very efficient and sometimes over-eager. Overall, this is a very nice, romantic, well designed first-class hotel in a good location. Trams and metro are nearby. Downside is that rates are high, even for Europeans, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: 13Traveller13_11
Reviews.Content: I have been in Amsterdam several times. Still this hotel the is best choice to explore Amsterdam. Location near center but quiet surrounding. Red lights are close but still away. Service and hotel are both excellent. Room is spacious, enough everything in room: iron and desk for ironing, coffee, tea and hot chocolate, free wi-fi. Bathroom is big enough. Shampoo, conditioner etc. are with very good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Friendly & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Darren M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend, check in was quick and simple. Rooms were nice, warm and had a good home feeling about them - the design of the hotel was new to me as the balcony looked over onto the reception lobby but was pretty nice. A quiet hotel, possibly due to the period I stayed during but was still fine for a group of friends. Breakfast served from 6:30am and was pretty decent. Location wise is perfect, right in the heart of Central Amsterdam. Without a doubt would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Amsterdam Centre”
Reviews.Author: cafc1962
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated less than ten minutes from Dam Square in a quiet side street. Service at the hotel is excellent with efficient check in. Breakfast was included in the price of the stay, consists of standard buffet style with a good choice of cereals, breads, hot and cold foods, fruit juices etc. Rooms are cleaned and tidied each morning. All in all a good base for business or leisure. This is a spotless hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can not fault nothing with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angel69kent
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, staff are so cheerful & helpful can not fault nothing with this Hotel. They upgraded us to Business class and we did not even ask so it was a lovely surprise when we got to our room it was so beautiful especially when you pay for a standard room. I did forget I said when booking on line in the box its my fiances Birthday and on arrival they mentioned to him oh its your Birthday tomorrow, you can not get a better welcome then that. On the day of his Birthday they left a card & gift. Breakfast was lovely so much to choose from. Hotel is just a few minutes walk to town and its a nice walk so much to see & do.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in exciting city”
Reviews.Author: A17ACR
Reviews.Content: Hotel close to all sites very helpful staff great room on the top floor with great views. Breakfast was lovely and plenty of choice would not hesitate in coming back here every time

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler04
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel directly prior to a two week cruise. The hotel was clean, quiet, nicely decorated and well-located. We also found the staff to be helpful but not intrusive. The included breakfast buffet was good, but had the same items on it each day. While I'd easily recommend this property to anyone visiting the area, it is important to note that the rooms (or ours, at least), while nicely decorated in a modern style, are exceptionally small. It was challenging for us to find places for our bags, and we ended up having to place a few items on the only chair/table in the room. It was downright impossible to unload our bags. The room had 6 hangers and a few little 'cubbies' near the floor which appeared to be the size for shoes. The lack of storage made our stay very uncomfortable...having to move bags to get around the room and to rifle through bags to find items that were unable to be unpacked. The other strange thing was that the TV kept turning itself on--which wouldn't be such a big deal, but it did so while we were sleeping on several occasions, until we unplugged it. The last inconveninece was the fact that there was no alarm clock--or any way to tell time save the read out on the phone. Despite all of that, I'd definitely return for a shorter trip and with fewer bags, if only for the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag ... good and bad”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller089
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is superb. The rooms are very clean and tidy and the bar is a real treat. I also found the staff on-the-whole are lovely. Though, when questioned about what was going on on New Year's Eve the concierge lacked the insightful knowledge and had distinct disinterest in helping. Also, I found the cleaner knocking on my door at 7:30 a.m. to clean which was simply not good enough. The restaurant is expensive, and apart from New Year's Eve when it was full it did seem remarjkably quiet. I think the reason for this was that the hotel is located right in the heart of the city centre and guests prefer to eat out. I know I found it saved money to eat at one of the restaurants off Dam Square. However, the bar is such a surprise: the bar staff were polite, friendly and welcoming. The style of the hotel is unusual but stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelJaclyn
Reviews.Content: Near everything but on a quiet street, so you're not bogged down by tourists. Clean, nice rooms. Beautiful bar with good food. I will stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: cymrobangor
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in the Radisson Blu. The staff are the key to this excellent hotel; they cannot do enough for you. Rooms were very comfortable and the complementary toileteries were lovely. We asked for three rooms together in a quite area (322/323/324) and that is exaclty what we had. The bar was lovely and we had some lovely cocktail (expensive! but worth it) The only criticism we had was - the hot food (scramble egg, bacon etc) at breakfast was only warm - but I'm sure the staff would have made you a fresh batch if you had asked. The rest of the breakfast menu was excellent. Thanks very much - we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in an excellent location close to the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Nugent58
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well-located within easy walking distance of key attractions and points of interest in Amsterdam, but far enough away from Dam Square and other areas where tourists gather to avoid excessive noise. In terms of features, the rooms are modern, well-sized and well-appointed. The staff have always been most helpful, and the in-house restaurant serves a wide range of good quality food, priced to suit the business traveller or tourist. For a taxi arranged by the hotel, the fare to Schipol Airport is fixed at â‚¬43, and takes about 20 to 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anniec16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a very balmy November. As mentioned in other reviews the hotel was only a 15 minute walk from Central Station and in a very good location for Dam Square and the Red Light District. Many attractions are easy to walk to but the rest are just a short tram ride away. We were given a room overlooking the canal but after reading other reviews about the noise at night I asked if we could be moved to a top floor room which overlooked the city - this was done with no problem and was extremely peaceful. We had a superior room which was beautifuland very large and we have never had a better breakfast anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mclaren1Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Radisson Blu in August for business. The hotel is in a great location, there are plenty of places to eat nearby & is only 15 mins from Schipol airport & a 5 minute walk to Dam Square. The rooms are well presented, very clean & offer all you need for a buisness trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Ballinora4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in December 2011. Location is perfect, right in the centre of town close to restaurants, etc. My only complaint was in regard to the level of cleaning in the room. In particular I noticed hairs on the edge of the bath and on the sink countertop just after I had entered the room and given it a once-over. Breakfast at â‚¬24 was not cheap, and was relatively uninspired. Staff were friendly and helpful. We also used the meeting room facilities and this worked out very well indeed.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the amsterdam radisson blu”
Reviews.Author: robert s
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with excellent service and a great location on one off the canals.

Reviews.Title: “My longest Trip Advisor review and it's not a happy tale...”
Reviews.Author: Fruity_kiwi
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for the poor management of our bad dining experience in the restaurant, I would have rated this hotel highly. They advertise Special Grills menu - barbecue styled food etc, and I ordered the suckling pig. When it came out (in a record 15-20 minutes) it was uncooked - so much so that it was difficult to carve in to, even with a steak knife. We called a waitress over and I said I wanted something else instead but she picked up my plate saying she'd get it "re-cooked". Five minutes later someone else brings back my plate. They microwaved it. I didn't eat it and decided not to say anything and eat the side order of chips my partner ordered instead. When the waitress came to take away the plates she said nothing (i.e. how was your dinner?) or asked why I hadn't touched the meat but I didn't press any further. She made us feel like we were annoyances. When the bill came, neither of us were surprised to be billed but we were feeling miffed at this point, paid and feeling bitter, went straight to our room. In the room, we were greeted with a placard on the desk of the smiling CEO of the Radisson Hotels with his 100% satisfaction guarantee. This set my partner off. He marched back downstairs to complain to the reception staff. A waitress immediately came over to him and said the restaurant manager had been looking for him. My partner told her that it he mustn't have been looking very hard because, in plain view of the restaurant we went straight to the lifts that took us to our room. When the restaurant manager joined them at reception, my partner explained that the meat wasn't cooked and microwaving it just made it dry. He had the cheek to tell my partner that it is how suckling pig is cooked in Amsterdam. The waitress also tried to say that she asked me if I wanted to order something different which was a blatant lie! The outcome was a refund but it seemed to be a fight to get one. We had the fabulous experience of seeing the restaurant manager the next morning during breakfast and he was, needless to say, delighted to see us also and offered us winning looks and smiles. [Read: Sarcasm] Breakfast was fine though. Buffet. Smile. We won't be back because the way the restaurant experience was managed. Despite the experience, I would recommend this hotel to stay in to others because of the standard of the rooms and location but would strongly recommend you DO NOT have dinner in the restaurant! Or order the suckling pig...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam. It is close to everything. It consists of several buildings on the street Rusland, only the facades are preserved. The hotel is currently ongoing a refurbishment process. It is about time, since the decoration of the old rooms must be almost 20 years old. The street part of the restaurant, the elevators and the gym have already been refurbished. Also the business rooms located on the other side of the reception building have been refurbished. We stayed on the reception side, got a very nice executive room on the top floor. Housekeeping has a very high standard. The reception staff is very friendly and efficient. The breakfast is excellent, so is the staf. The gym is small but has new equipment. The sauna is too small and unisex. There is also a solarium. No pool or jacuzzi though. The hotel bar is quite cosy. All in all, a very nice hotel. It is not cheap, but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel by the Red Light District and Central Station”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely tucked away in the city centre. You can easily walk to Amsterdam Central or the Red Light District within 10-15 minutes. If you don't want to walk from the train station a taxi costs 15 euros. The airport is about 30 minutes away and a taxi costs 43 euros. The front desk will arrange a private taxi for you. There are tram and bus stops near the hotel but you must walk towards the train station to reach them. The transportation system for the trams, buses, etc is called GVS and you can buy a daily unlimited pass for 11 euros. There is a GVS office at the train station. There are plenty of bars and restaurants around the hotel. Most of the restaurants sell Asian cuisine. I highly recommend the "Wok to Walk" near the district. It has great stirfry options. There are also burger, fries, and pizza places around. We did a lot of walking by the hotel and felt completely safe. The hotel was clean and is completely non-smoking. If you smoke they charge a fee of 200 euros to your card. I liked the fresh smoke free smell of the hotel. They also offer a superior breakfast for 25 euros per person at their restaurant and they have a nice bar in the lobby. I did not use either service but glad it was available. The gift shop attached to the hotel sells converters, souvenirs, and items you may have left at home for a reasonable price. Overall I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “if anything, hindered by paying for a better room”
Reviews.Author: J0hn_and_Sally
Reviews.Content: i booked an "Executive Room" for a long weekend in Amsterdam. The room itself was large, airy, and nicely appointed. Unfortunately the layout of the hotel meant these larger rooms were all on the front of the hotel (view is nice of the old buildings opposite - but i think it is slightly naughty to always show the conferencing part of the hotel on the website pictures as this has a lovely aspect out onto the canal, whereas the hotel itself is on the side street). But the rooms suffer badly from noise from the street outside. They are obviously aware of this as they have screwed extra plastic panes onto the window, but this doesnt stop the noise from drunken/high groups of lads running up and down the street from around 3am to 5am shouting to each other. This wouldnt just be this hotels problem and if i were to return to Amsterdam, i would probably stay a little further out of the city, pay A LOT less for the room, but then have the expenses of taxis back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: trafdlo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a weekend for a three day stay when there was a soccer game on the Saturday night. Normally Amersterdam is New York City on drugs but this weekend was extra special. The normally pscho bicyclists seem even more intent on mowing down another tourist. So the Rad was a beacon of serenity and civilization. At first glance, the hotel seems to be four different buildings, one of which has a distinct lean to it. But this is a facade and inside is a very modern and elegant hotel. The construction must have been very complicated to incorporate the old with the new. The bar is actually another building inside the main structure. It was the Rector's residence and now serves as the bar and reception area was his garden. Superior service is given from the curb to your room with and very good reception. Our room faced the street but there are rooms that face onto the atrium. Flat screen tv (which we rarely used), very expensive mini-bar (never used), coffee, safe, iron and ironing board and desk. There is more storage in this room than any hotel or cruise ship we have ever been on. An extremely well-lit bathroom has a heated floor but there is a raised lip when you enter the bathroom on which you could stub your toe. The restaurant had one of the better breakfasts we had in Europe. Good staff and although it is mostly self-serve, the coffee and follow-up service is very good. This has all of the flavours of a boutique hotel rather than a large chain. We appreciated being on a side street away from the zoo on the more popular thoughfares and somewhat removed by the kamakzi bicyclists. This would be our choice if we ever get back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: BigTA
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location. Very nice rooms, great breakfast. Perfect if you have business in the area. The price is high enough for me to look for other options if I'm paying for it myself.

Reviews.Title: “We would happily stay here again...!”
Reviews.Author: kimmermc
Reviews.Content: Well-located in wonderful Old Amsterdam, this first-class hotel offered all the best components- comfortable room and bath, helpful, friendly staff and a location that was unbeatable. You really can walk almost everywhere from here!

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: KathyCr
Reviews.Content: On a recent cruise down the Rhine, we spent 3 days in Amsterdam, staying at the Radisson Blu, arrangements courtesy of Viking Cruise Line. All employees were very courteous and helpful in making our stay quite wonderful. They had an excellent on-premises restaurant with great selections for lunch and dinner plus an outstanding and huge breakfast buffet with everything you could think of as a choice for breakfast food. Rooms and service were also quite satisfactory. We would stay here in a heartbeat again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pbeaaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at an excellent location. The rooms are clean and tidy, the staff really nice and helpful. Breakfast is great although expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend away”
Reviews.Author: SopranosMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights get away without the children. Hotel room was lovely, spacious and very clean ( I am very picky) . Breakfast was great, superb choice and airy breakfast room. Staff were very helpful. Location was perfect, a short stroll to Dam square. Would definitely recommend go others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: europeeveryyear
Reviews.Content: Great location, Service, Rooms and value with free Mini Bar and Breakfast. The Bed was really comfortable. Nothing to complain about for 2 very tired travellers. Great Staff, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rincon413
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights October 6th; it's the hotel that Viking River Cruises uses for the extentions that they offer. The room was more than adequate and had the King sized bed that we asked for. the staff was very helpful and friendly. It is an easy walk to most of the sights. * The hotel also has several bikes for rent, which isn't publicized but the concierge provided to us when we asked about nearby rental shops. The included breakfast is fabulous; the staff accomodated our requests for omelets and offered espresso and cappucino. We ate at the restaurant our first night and were very happy with the meal, price and staff. The bar area was a relaxing place to have a night cap and meet fellow travelers even though the bartender was a bit of a grump. She did warm up to us after the first night. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel In a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: woofit1
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel after a short tram ride and walk from central station. Hotel is in a great location near to Dam square and the red light district. We were given an upgrade on arrival to a business class room, recently re-furbished rooms with lovely contemporary interiors and large walk-in shower. Nespresso machine in room which was a lovely touch and full access to Sky premiere channels. Only downside was that they are carrying out work on scaffold outside rooms and we heard people outside working at 8 am Monday morning. The windows could be better insulated for noise as well as you can hear any traffic noise or people on the street below. Breakfast was very good and there was a fantastic selection of cooked and continental items. we liked the freshly squeezed orange juice and the option of bucks fizz if you pleased. We booked two taxis during our trip the first where we had to visit the local hospital which was 20 minutes away which cost 10 euros. As it was raining on our last day we booked a taxi through the concierge for a 5 minute journey to central station. Driver would not drop us off outside the station and charged us 15 Euros, be careful even if you book a taxi through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CeliaGaetaen
Reviews.Content: We had a superior room overlooking the canel. We were able to watch the world of boats past us by, only a short stroll into Dam Square. The Restaurant in house was delicious as was their breakfast selection. Would definitely recommend this hotel, the room was generous and even had a Nespresso machine - a lovely bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lizzybusy3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and we enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean and comfortable with and interesting decor.The beds and pillows were super comfortable. They also have an excellent breakfast. Location was great, walking distance to all the landmarks. We would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “nothing blu about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nasher110
Reviews.Content: stayed at the rad for a long weekend myself and my wife to sum it up in one word brilliant, the hotel has a light and airy feeling to it as it has a large atrium and the reception and staff are very cool ,rooms were well kept, close to all the places you want to go to , just remember to turn left when you come out of main doors as this takes you straight to dam square ,we found this out on the last day of our stay , you defo get what you pay for when you stay here ,never went to the restaurant as we were on a beer diet try the bar though very classy,would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Andreas H
Reviews.Content: The best located hotel in Amsterdam in my opinion. This hotel is great for the both the turist and business guy, although be prepared that it is very booked and the priceing is high, but can varey. I stayed here mon-wen this week and it was very good. Have you read my other reviews i can be quite picky. The only remark is tha the breakfast has lost the smothies! and the downstairs part needs to have a carpet clean, it smells bad. Which shouldnt be the case when you pay 25 euro for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - good service, but bit dated”
Reviews.Author: AusBusinessTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed briefly in Amsterdam at this hotel. Reception was good - lots of staff to check in guests, which is a plus when you arrive late. The room was very large, but unusual in that there were stairs from the bathroom to the bed area. The decor was quite dated, but everything was clean and worked ok. The ironing board was one of those hopeless set-ups with a small board jutting out from the entertainment unit that supported the television. I can't understand hotels who persist with these stupidly small and awkward set-ups. I could open the window, which I like, and heard the bells chiming from some nearby church in the morning. The breakfast was good - one of my colleagues is married to a Dutch woman and noted some Dutch specialty breakfast items that he said his in-laws loved. I didn't get a chance to walk around the meeting as had an early meeting, but got the impression that the hotel was conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Dank Je Wel !”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMattman
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are amazing. KLM lost my luggage and for two days the hotel staff kept in touch with KLM reps to locate the lost luggage. It was delivered to the hotel. The staff gave me a temporary tooth brush kit and a map of the shopping areas of Amsterdam to best find replacement clothing if my luggage was not found. I thanked them personally when I checked out and complimented them by name on their corporate web site. The fact that this beautiful hotel is so centrally located made it easy to navigate the entire city. My room was large and comfortable. The view from my window was of the building next door but I did not much care since I spent most of the time exploring every nook of this amazing city. The hotel guest booklet also has a very good history of the collection of buildings - from a 17th century beer brewery to the De Star church that was built in 1848 - that would become the current hotel. When I return to Amsterdam I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break with friends”
Reviews.Author: Oxford_Bags
Reviews.Content: This was a lovley hotel enjoyed by 6 friends on a long weekend city break. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was excellent, rooms were very comfortable with cable TV and the location was perfect, central and easy to reach most attractions by foot. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Pam T
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the small side, but it did have heated tile floor in the bathroom.....go figure!! We were facing the inside, looking down into the artrium lobby. Wasn't bad. Bkft was included and it was okay......no eggs cooked while u waited. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a Great location”
Reviews.Author: UtahMan87
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a couple of nights before taking a Baltic sea cruise. It was a great hotel clean and comfortable and we were easily able to walk anywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hotelwanderer
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel a couple of times and never had a bad experience. The service is great, the rooms excellent and the food is fine. The location of this hotel is brilliant and easily allows you to explore Amsterdam at your own pace. Would return without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst so-called 5 start hotel I have ever seen... actually, not probably, definitely.”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIreland
Reviews.Content: The only reason this hotel gets 1 star is that its location is superb, and the rooms are nice - that, and I can't give no stars. The rest of our stay here was a abject travesty. When we arrived at the hotel, after a long trip from Frankfurt, the staff at the desk refused to give us the two rooms we had paid for in full, and in advance, unless we provided a deposit of â‚¬200 per room - apparently in case we stole the mini bar or something ridiculous like that. As we were travelling without credit card (hence the reason we paid in advance) we had no means of providing this deposit, nor did we collectively have â‚¬400 in cash as a deposit for this room. We offered to pay for any extras in cash at the time of checkout, but this was unacceptable for some odd reason â€“ why, I have no idea - and then we were dismissed from the check in desk until we had a solution. I was gob smacked. We ended up having to make an long and expensive roaming call to a family member family at home to provide a credit card over the phone so we could get the rooms we paid for. Apart from this being an utterly ridiculous policy, the staff were insulting and rude, and the whole experience was deeply embarrassing. Another example of the indifference and rudeness of staff at this hotel was made clear at a later point in our stay, we asked one of your staff members at the desk to find a letter that was sent to us by email. He barely made any effort in looking for this delivery, and was incredibly dismissive of us, amazingly even going to the trouble of taking another phone call during our conversation and dealing with another guest! Later when I went back to a different member of staff two hours later, I was told they had the letter all morning - it was in a draw under the check in desk. I can only assume the first member of staff didnâ€™t really care too much to be bothered to look in the draw under this desk? Probably not, looking in a draw would just upset him, it seems. Even down to the breakfast fiasco in the morning, we had to wait 20 minutes EVERY day, as the breakfast room was full. What hotel canâ€™t accommodate its guests for breakfast? To describe the breakfast as chaos would be an understatement. Even the room cleaning wasnâ€™t great, with dirty cups left by the sink. To be blunt, this hotel is more akin to a 2 star with attitude problems and guests are just a hindrance to its daily operations. They have the audacity to put a sign in the room indicating â€œ100% Guest Satisfaction Guaranteeâ€�, which I assume is clearly meant to amuse, but in a tragic way. Probably the worst so-called 5 star hotel I have ever stayed in, and never, ever, again will I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: srtxtraveler
Reviews.Content: We would stay here again. The staff is excellent. They really work at trying to help you find your way around Amsterdam. My husband and I thought is was a very difficult city to find your way around. There are no sidewalks and streets are full of taxis and bikes that I think try to run over you ! The hotel breakfast is wonderful, gets you started on a great day. We had a great room that over-looked the street. It was very quiet and sleeping wasn't difficult. We booked several excrusions through the hotel and all were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: michie011
Reviews.Content: My husband was arriving 2 days before my son and myself, so had booked a standard room for the first 2 days, and then we had booked an executive room for the next 3 days. On his arrival the hotel informed him that they would just give him the executive room from day 1! The rooms were spacious, clean and tidy. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The hotel is very centrally located, so it was a great base for seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Clean, Staff Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Moorlander1969
Reviews.Content: Visited mid August 2011, stayed on the first floor (was worried we might hear noise from the busy reception, as our room was above/behind, and overlooking a raised seating area but had no problems) I believe the Hotel has more "modern" rooms on the other side of the street, however, room was clean, staff excellent & breakfast was v good, plently of choice but it was a bit hectic! location is very good, 5min walk to Dam, 2min to red light district! recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Better is difficult.”
Reviews.Author: Biscas
Reviews.Content: I decided to reserve this hotel due to its good tripadvisor rating. I was NOT disappointed. Well, the truth is that I reserved the hotel for my daughter and grandparents and they could not say nicer things about their 4 night stay at Radisson Blu in Amsterdam. It is about a 10m walk to Dam Square which means that is is quite central. They stayed in an Executive room with great amenities. Hotel staff was always VERY helpful and even when unfortunately a doctor was needed, the hotel mediated this process very well! Great breakfast and fitness area also added to the enjoyable stay. From what my daughter has told me... it is difficult for your stay to go wrong at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Aviv666
Reviews.Content: I went with my son last week and stayed at this hotel for 5 days. The hotel staff was very pleasant and always willing to help us. The room was very good, large enough, bathroom fairly large. My son called their breakfast "super breakfast" and indeed it was a very good one. And of course the location of the hotel is everything you can wish for. The hotel is within minutes from Dum Square and close to every attraction in the Center. There is New York Pizza near by which is very good. Not too far from it there is also a small bakery place where we used to stop everyday. In summary, I recommend this hotel very much for those of you who are looking for an excellent hotel and great location

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: TheQuokka
Reviews.Content: Deluxe room was fairly good, nothing special. View of the courtyard was pretty shabby. Bathroom adequate if slightly small. Heated floor was nice, but kind of un-necessary. The bar was very expensive, I advise looking elsewhere for drinks. Breakfast was REALLY busy. Lots of choice of hot and cold food. TIP: If you want eggs cooked specially, do not ask the guy behind the counter. He is so busy re-filling things, and I dont actually think its his job. I asked the people clearing the plates away, and they were more than happy to bring me fresh friend eggs. Area is on fringe of Red-Light district. It's safe, and to be honest, you're going to have a look around that area anyway aren't you! I saw a family taking their 8 year old son round looking in the windows!! All-in-all, very clean, safe location, decent staff and good breakfast. If you can get a decent rate for the hotel then it is to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a central position”
Reviews.Author: Merciaman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a conference delegate. The rooms were great, the conference facilites were good, the food was good, the staff were helpful and the place had a relly nice feel to it. It was a little expensive, but was worth it. I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location friendly concierge”
Reviews.Author: maxwellkg
Reviews.Content: We ended a trip at the Radisson Blu in Amsterdam. The hotel is outside the noisy part of the city but close enough to walk to any point. The staff was friendly and accomodating and the Concierge desk was very helpful in finding places to go and providing museum tickets at no extra cost. This turned out to be a great advantage as it put us at the front of the line when visiting any of the museums. The Rijkmuseum had a line about 1/4 mile that we would have had to stand in if we did not have the tickets. The room was very comfortable and spacious. We would definitely stay here again if we were to ever return to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: lilbiscuit
Reviews.Content: Radisson Blu was a great hotel. Close to everything yet on a very quiet street. A nice room with a really comfortable bed. The staff was helpful and friendy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ascott10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and had a fantastic weekend. The hotel is very well located- close enough to walk to all the central attractions but set in a quiet side street. The room was excellent- air conditioned, clean and well equipped with flat screen tv, mini bar, comfortable beds. The bathroom had a heated floor and was also well equipped. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was amazing- the best selection of food I have ever seen for a breakfast. Overall an excellent hotel and I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rcman
Reviews.Content: In town Radisson Blu hotel is very good. Close to the Dam square on a quiet street the hotel is very quiet and very comfortable. The room and beds were freat and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Good choice. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plus comfort equals Radisson Blu!”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireGal
Reviews.Content: We're just home from a wonderful cruise on the Rhine River ending with two nights on our own in Amsterdam at the Radisson Blu. If you're looking for a convenient location -- close enough to walk to many attractions or hop on and off a tram for the others that are farther away, this is it The rooms at the Radisson are comfortable (although the decor -- dark brown and navy -- is a bit dark for my taste) and the bathrooms are wonderful (large and modern with heated floors, good lighting and mirrors). We found the staff friendly and eager to please. The breakfast buffet is amazing -- although we've traveled extensively, this was far and above the normal fare. We were disappointed that we had to leave early to get to the airport on our second day (and would miss the breakfast) but the staff provided us with a beautiful "to go" breakfast box. There are many hotels in Amsterdam, but the Radisson Blu is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: HenryNotts47
Reviews.Content: We had a certain expectation booking at a Radisson brand hotel as we've stayed with the hotel chain before, but we were truly impressed with the stand out service that we received at Raidsson Blu in Amsterdam! The hotel staff was particularly friendly and polite, and made us feel like they really cared. We had a particularly difficult time with our flight delays, baggage troubles, etc. and were quite exhausted by the time we reached the hotel, and were very pleased to have a quick check-in procedure! Rooms were a bit small, but I guess this is to be expected in a city centre hotel. Overall I'd highly recommend. Great, central location NEAR the bustling attractions, but not in it so you can get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Sound, well placed, good value option in a city of costly and disappointing hotels”
Reviews.Author: skyjockey99
Reviews.Content: Slightly funky modern building conversion in a central location. Service was very good and the room was everything you'd want at a reasonable price. It'll be my choice next time I stay in central Amsterdam. Lots of nice touches, very good bar, superb restaurant, fixed price taxi to the airport to make life easy, helpful concierge, and 10 mins walk from Dam Square

Reviews.Title: “QUIET, smart and central with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel15
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. My mum and I are very light sleepers but it was really QUIET, even though itâ€™s right in the middle of the city on a very safe, very smart side street. Staff really looked after us. There was often a queue for breakfast but when we explained that my mum was taking medication they always went out of their way to make sure we either had a table or could sit in the other bar to eat. All the staff seemed to really take pride in their work, and were very approachable. BREAKFASTS are fantastic, by the way and a marble bathroom and a chocolate on the pillow every night, what more can you ask? By the way, don't believe the rubbish in the brochure about the indoor garden, there isn't one really. Further note. We took the shuttle from the hotel to the airport and it was great. Took 20 mins and was only 15 euro 50 each. Driver helped us with our luggage and dropped us at the airport exactly in front of the right check in for our airline!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bronco09
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for a family of four and the room was very spacious. Service was good and room was clean. The best thing about the hotel is location. Tucked away on a side street but walking distance to most places. The restaurant is a bit pricey, but there are so many options to eat out in Amsterdam that it really didn't matter!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: jajasa
Reviews.Content: First time in Amsterdam and this hotel was great. Our room was spacious and clean. Hotel was walking distance to red light district - a must see for first time visitors, shopping, museums and restaurants. Just be careful of bicycles they are everywhere. Not only do you need to look out for cars and trams but also bikes. Found Amsterdam more expensive than London and Italy. Museums are a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: flygirl_7
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at the hotel. We didn't want to pay for the parking and were fortunate to find a place on the street across from the hotel. The reception staff was friendly and welcoming. Our room was a nice size, vey colorful! Red! We were satisfied with the cleanliness and comfort of our room. The hotel is a bit of a distance from the heart of the city but we walked it without effort.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: drlau99
Reviews.Content: Very central location. Close to everything yet set on a very quiet street. Free wifi is ok too. Fast enough for Skype calls. I have no complain.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but clean”
Reviews.Author: Vistaro
Reviews.Content: Great check in experience by Gregory. Rooms very dark and dated, well worn but clean rooms. No safe in the room. Comfortable reception area, no real issues. In my mind there are better choices in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: pair_11
Reviews.Content: great location, near dam squre but in a very quiet street. near the beautiful canals. excelant breakfast with all kind of goodies. we got room with a view to the street. the room is not big but the celing is high and the room enjoyes natural light. the bath is not fancy but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Staff who goes extra mile”
Reviews.Author: csh68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with my family of 4, got an executive room which was newly renovated. What impressed me was constant effort of counter, f&b staff willingness to go extra mile. Wifi access in hotel can be better, spotty at times.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? It's worse than a Motel! Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: sidzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel or rather motel is probably the worst I have ever stayed in. From the moment we queued up to check in till the time we checked out, we faced problems one after another. Check in time is marked as 3pm. We had requested for early check in, since we were getting there by 1pm. We had booked 3 rooms and got 2 of them by 3pm. We were told that check in time is 3pm and that there is nothing they can do about it, which was fair. But, we had to wait until 4:30pm to get our third room which we were supposed to get by 3pm despite being promised that all 3 rooms would be available by 3pm. This was really frustrating because they made a big fuss about not giving us rooms before the standard check in time and now we were asked to wait even more despite having travelled by air and train before getting to Amsterdam that day. And anyways, we were waiting from 1pm at the hotel for our rooms. Anyhow, after we got our rooms, my brother realised his room has a slanted wooden pillar jutting out of the wall right across his bed. This was not only inconvenient, but also a safety hazard since waking up from the bed in the morning, he could very easily bang his head against the wooden pillar and hurt himself. He spoke to the reception and had to explain that his room needs to get changed since its not safe. After convincing the reception he finally got transferred to a normal room. My room was fine until I came back in the evening after dinner on the first day, only to find water all over the floor below the Air Conditioner and on my suitcase and in my shoes/slippers placed next to my suitcase. It was shocking to come back to a water logged room just before you get to bed after a long and tiring day. We informed the reception and told them that the Air Conditioner has water leaking from it and that they need to either fix it or change our room. Someone came up after about 5 minutes and couldn't get it to stop. He informed the reception and we too were shifted to another room with some of our stuff totally drenched. Shifting rooms wasn't our preference since we were exhausted by this time and were just about to hit the bed. Apart from our annoying and inconvenient incidents, the hotel was quite shabby in terms of looks. Our rooms were extremely mediocre to say the least. I've stayed in motels in the United States that have better rooms. The linen and curtains were dirty. There were some small rips on the curtains. The entire hotel lobby, corridors and rooms gave a very dingy and cold feeling. After the menace during the checking in process, we were also not able to check out late. We had requested for a late checkout, instead of the standard time of 12 noon we wanted an extra hour for our 3 rooms. We were refused right away. After having spoken at the reception that she should atleast give us 1 room until 1pm since we also got our room later than the standard check in time, they just weren't willing to accommodate. Instead, we were told that there would be a charge if we didn't check out by 12 noon. This really left things in very bad taste. They just weren't willing to listen. Ultimately we had to leave at 12 noon and were extremely disgusted with the hotel and its' staff. While the positives were: the hotel concierge, which was quite helpful; the wifi service, which worked great; and the breakfast, which had a good spread. The hotel is just not good enough for anyone to stay in expecting some decent hotel service. It is just a shabby motel with pathetic staff and dingy rooms that desperately need a makeover. I cannot think of a worse hotel that I have ever stayed in. I highly suggest to look around because this is not the only hotel in the vicinity around Dam Square. I'm sure there are a lot of better options around to look at. Stay Away from this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in middle of town,”
Reviews.Author: Rsflady
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 2 5/7 year old daughters. Easy walking around town and easy with kids. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: pikpik_tm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The service was very nice as well. Easy access to EVERYTHING. walking distance to museums, red light & etc. Concierge was very helpful. Check in & check out was fast and friendly. We loved the breakfast! The best breakfast we've ever had! We went in the morning once & kept on going every morning ever since. Good value for money, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Amits
Reviews.Content: This one has a nice location less than five min walk to dam square and under 10 min walk to the central station and most attractions. The hotel has reasonable size rooms (in context of average europe) and these are appointed averagely. The staff is very nice and friendly (with the exception of the chef at breakfast - his job was to make eggs to order but always seemed too busy to acknowlege you or gave an impression that he's doing everyone a favour). Being vegitarians there were limited eating options so we ate out most of the time. Breakfast was good and limited food we ate was nice. Overall nice hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “My regular hotel of choice”
Reviews.Author: Ozy78
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Kind, friendly and helpful reception staff. I have been staying regularly at this hotel for the past 6 months. The decor is pretty dated, 60s' I'd say, but there is nothing else you can find to complain about. Breakfast and free wi-fi is standard and rooms are always exceptionally clean. Location is not bad, but it's a 10 min walk to Amsterdam Central station. Shops and restraunts are less than 2 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Close to sights, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieInternational
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Blu hotel in Amsterdam for just over three days. The hotel reception was extremely friendly and welcoming. The room we stayed in was very nice and clean. The room was located at the front of the hotel. However I would say that there was a 'big must' with sorting out the plugs in the room. The Manager seemed to be knocking on the doors of the rooms and we told him about the situation. He gave us extension lead, which helped. The plug connections on the desk seemed like 'fake connections' and didn't work. There was only one plug connection on the wall, which we could find. The bathroom was clean, but the grey marble was a little old fashioned and could do with being updated. There was also a nasty, unnecessary step into the bathroom, which I seemed to keep tripping up. The breakfast, which was on the tariff I picked was excellent. A lot of hot/cold combinations and lots to choose from. Overall I would recommend the hotel, as it is very close to the sights. It doesn't at all feel like you are close to the 'red light' district. It was quiet, but you could venture out, if you fancied going out to the bars etc. The bars in the 'red light' district are very expensive and would just go slightly away to get cheaper beers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: gasman
Reviews.Content: This would be a three to four star hotel by most people's standards, depending on what kind of room you choose. In terms of facilities - the restaurant is excellent, and pretty good value, as is the warmly ambient hotel bar; the gym is okay without being great; and unfortunately the free "high speed' internet is awful - it clearly struggles if more than a few people are logged on at any one time. For a business hotel this is a significant flaw which needs to be remedied. As most people have said, the location is excellent in terms of proximitiy to everywhere - it is, however, right adjacent to the red light district. This could end up being an annoyance in ways you didn't quite imagine - in that when you walk the immediate vicinity you will be surrounded by hordes of English yobbos, who will leave you wondering how these guys ever had an Empire. Compared to them, the behaviour of the prostitutes is dignified and mature. So this hotel doesn't quite give you that peaceful, canalside Amsterdam vibe when you walk out the door - but if you're prepared to forgo this, as well as totally reliable internet, you should give this hotel some serious thought.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: kulls
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, but too expensive in relation to the quality of accommodation and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free wifi, terrible beds and bedding, hit and miss service”
Reviews.Author: Airbound13
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings on this hotel and am unsure if I would stay here again. Pros -- Great location. It is a few blocks from the craziness of the red light district but tucked away in a quaint, quiet area. We were able to walk to every major location with no problem. The food in the hotel restaurant was fantastic and the wine selection was great. WiFi in the room was free. Cons -- The beds were so uncomfortable and the bedding was so cheap it was difficult to sleep. After 4 nights I was exhausted and ready to go to another hotel. There is a small piece of wood raised up around 4 inches leading into the bathroom in every room in the hotel. It is hard to notice so we continued to bang our toe on it which was really frustrating not to mention painful. The concierge was hit and miss. One would give us terrible recommendations, another didn't know basic answers like how to get tickets to museums or where things were located and then a third was fantastic. It was so close to the red light district we had to walk through insanity most nights to get back to our room. While I enjoyed the location I couldn't help but walk past hotels like Hotel Pulitzer and think I would much rather be in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, helpful, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Kite
Reviews.Content: Comfortable stay, using points from previous Radisson visits. Our room was well presented, comfortable and clean. The only strange thing was using the master switch about the bed to turn off the lights at night - when my wife went to use the bathroom in the night she had to make the trip in the dark as pressing the master switch would have put EVERYTHING back on again. Not the best design. Concierge and check in/out staff friendly and helpful with maps and storing our bags. Go down into the basement where the corridor runs under the road to the other rooms and there is an interesting model of how the hotel was built to incorporate some existing buildings. As such it is much bigger than it might appear. Clever Excellent for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: NEILPATEL1978
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the heart of the city, and next to Neumarke station. The restaurant is one of my favourite restaurants in Amsterdam. Its next to the Redlight District and easy access to airport and also the business center

Reviews.Title: “keep looking - with the poor attitude you may not be able to sleep and they won't care”
Reviews.Author: IggyThePassenger
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at the Radisson Blu and everything was ok until night 6, when there was screaming and crying and throwing of furniture going on in the room above me in the wee hours of the morning. I called down to the front desk thinking someone was being murdered and they were very relaxed about it. "Yes, we've had a few other calls. Someone will check on it in a bit." So eventually someone went up there and knocked on the door to speak to Sid & Nancy. However this only reduced the noise level to screaming and crying, for the next hour. I called the front desk again to ask if they could so something. I was told, "oh it's a lovers quarrel and just bad luck for you". I asked if they could move them "no, the hotel is full", could they speak to them again "well, we already went up there". Yes and that was not very successful, so could they try again? "huff, huff. Fine" Eventually I called the room myself and mentioned it was 3 in the morning and some people were in Amsterdam on business and not to relive the Sex Pistols saga. The next morning I asked to speak to someone about the incident and they listened and offered a cursory apology, but not much else besides trying to offer me a complimentary breakfast (which was already included in my business rate, and I didn't have time for given I only got 2 hours of sleep with all the commotion, not to mention the time it took to retell the story of the incident to 3 different people with no results). Because pancakes and sleep are essentially interchangeable hotel qualities (?) I'm a business traveller for a large Consulting firm with 170,000+ employees worldwide, if there is a type of client to keep happy, you'd think that would be it, but apparently the front line staff are not very concerned. It seems like there is an issue with standards here and they don't care much about if guests are actually able to rest, or if they even want to come back. Perhaps if everything goes perfectly (or if you can sleep through domestic violence noise), then it would be ok. Reqeusts for things beyond room service and taxis will fall on deaf ears.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Ashaari
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, with exellent location, near to top attractions of amsterdam. Rooms were good, old TV, not enough cabinetts to put your cloths in if your staying for a long time. Air condintioning was too bad, it was too hot in the night but we did not complain about it because the weather was cold when we wre there. Staff were very much helpfull and cooperative. I recommend this hotel for its location and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: AndreeaHerzog
Reviews.Content: accomodation: - very nice big and clean room restaurant : - very cozy nice and quick service, and very good food

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Naughty taxi Driver.”
Reviews.Author: eurocrawler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights, Was offered upgrade to king bed as queen bed was in room allocated. Didn't take the offer as the Queen bed was sufficent.
