Desk in room a range of tv channels clean room and bathroom. Ice machines which make no noise, some people will appreciate this. All staff we dealt with were very accomodating and friendly. Though did get a taxi to the Centraal Station he charged us 10 Euros and dropped us off just before the taxi rank at the station and out of the way of the taxi warden, I did notice he didn't have the meter on but was nearly there when I noticed it. The Hotel called the taxi for us, No complaint about that, they didn't pick the driver. But I would say to the reception about the usual price of short journeys like this one, just in case your driver 'forgets' about the meter. From what I can gather it should have been â‚¬7.50 and he charged us â‚¬10 its a minor annoyance for what was a good trip all round, but it could make a diffrence for some.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Experience”
Reviews.Author: TOTHEALEX
Reviews.Content: My wife was there on a business trip and I joined her and we loved the experince of staying at the hotel. Later on relocated to Ibis, which was quite a downgrade. I enjoyed the fitness centre there - good machines and free weight combination.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good central location - but take a taxi!”
Reviews.Author: weemanal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in early April, having booked the hotel on the strength of the good comments on Tripadvisor and its good central location. The "good central location" was great once we were in the hotel and settled, but we took the train from Schipol to Central Station. We were advised there not to take a taxi but to take a tram to Spui(sp?) which was the nearest stop, but I then had to lug cases over canal bridges and cobbled streets for what seemed quite a distance before we got to the hotel all for a few Euros less than the cost of a taxi......why? However, check in was efficient and like others, we were offered an upgrade, but we had already booked a superior room and presumed we would be getting a fairly decent room anyway and we had prepaid for breakfast. The room was nice, spacious and reasonably well equipped, but did show some some signs of wear and tear. It was on the top floor, as we had asked for an elevated room, but alas the canal view that we also asked for was a fairly small window looking across the street to the other part of the hotel....oh, and with a rooflight also. Breakfasts were excellent as were the staff and we ate a few evenings in the Parsonage bar, which we particularly liked and again the staff were superb, which I would have to say was the main feature for us on our stay. We particularly enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam, having not been there for almost thirty years. We found not only the hotel fairly pricey, but most other things also, but that's probably to do with the very poor exchange rate with the GBP. Oh - and for our return trip to Schipol, we booked the shuttle bus, but getting a private car to ourselves as we were the only booking on that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best location - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tplus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few steps from town center but still absolutely protected from the "pub-crawl" action there. We had the "Business class" room with a nice window overlooking the neighbourhood. I would recommend paying the surcharge over the standard rooms which seem to have the window to the patio. The beds were very comfortable the bathroom well equipped with : A thermostate-controled shower (you know how important that is)! Everything was perfectly clean. Breakfast was good, staff attentive. Parking is not cheap, I always use the Amsterdam P+R system which is cheaper and faster. Absolutely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel located in center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sender7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last leg of our Paris-Brussels-Amsterdam holiday. The Radisson Blu is located very centrally in Amsterdam but down a quiet side street so you can get a good night's sleep. We stayed 2 nights and had a superior room. (complimentary upgrade at the front desk). The room was updated with 2 twin beds, very clean and perfect for what we needed. You can walk basically anywhere you have to go and the trams are a short walk away if you want to use them. Amsterdam is a very lively city and it was nice to come back after hours of walking around to our quiet hotel. We arrived from Central station and walked to the hotel which I don't advise if you have a lot of luggage and aren't familiar with the city. Narrow cobblestone streets and confusing maps made it difficult for us. (By the second day we knew the city well enough to walk or jump on trams.) Take a taxi to hotel or one of the trams.( we didn't get good info at central station and were advised to walk). If you take a tram you still need a 5 minute walk to hotel as hotel isn't directly on a tram route. Very good breakfast which was included in our rate and the staff all spoke English and were very accommodating. If you don't have breakfast at the hotel there are amazing pancake restaurants nearby. Also free wi-fi which we didn't have at any other hotel we stayed at! We would absolutely stay here again and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “QUIET, CONVENIENT, COMFORTABLE!”
Reviews.Author: tripfriend92
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at "BLUs" in other cities, I was prepared for a good experience in Amsterdam. I was not disappointed. If you are not familiar with a city, it is difficult to select a hotel from the internet and judge the surrounding noise. As I discovered when touring the city, several of the other hotels I had considered are in very noisy, very busy locations in Amsterdam. The Radisson sits on a quiet side street, but only 10 minutes by foot to Central Station, and a fifteen minute walk to the museum area. The hotel is exceptionally clean, modern in appointments, and I NEVER heard a single peep from other guest rooms. A miracle! Staff were helpful, friendly, and the restaurant above par. My stay was a full week and I congratulated myself every day on my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best feature for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gezinha
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems better on the pictures on the website, even though it was not disappointing at all. On the other hand, the location of the hotel is convenient because it is a walk distance from main attractions and for those who doesnÂ´t like to walk, the tram is available some blocks behind it. The staff is helpful and the cleaning and amenities follows Radisson Blu standards. A good value for money. Amsterdan is amazing, it is a city for lovers with its canals, architeture and bikes. DonÂ´t miss to live live as a local and find out by yourself the best places in the city. It is too small, it is impossible get lost. 3-4 days is a good period to see everything.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Room, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DNLs_mum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Radisson Blu recently prior to our river cruise. Radisson Blu happens to be one of my company's corporate hotel, and I managed to get a room for EUR180 including breakfast. We arrived early in the morning around 8am. I had emailed the hotel early to request for early check-in if available. During check in, the hotel offered us immediate check-in into a King size room (apparrently ours is queen size) including breakfast for an additional EUR50. We declined. Frankly, our package at EUR180 already included breakfast and the additional EUR50 would only make sense for those who originally got their room without breakfast. For us it was really not worth it. If I had wanted to pay EUR230, I could have checked myself into the Marriott which I could get at that price on the corporate programmme, and Marriott is a better class hotel. We just left our bags at the hotel and took a walk to Anne Frank House which opened at 9am. That worked out perfectly as the wait at Anne Frank was only 15 mins since we were early. Our room was ready by the time we returned around 12noon. We were given a room on the top floor. The ceiling was slanted because of the roof. The room was really dated and old, and in real need of an upgrade. We did not bother to ask for another room since we are only staying the night. Anyway, we figured that they probably wanted to give us a real crappy room to "punish" us for not taking the upgrade offer. Room came with free wifi which is a plus. We had dinner at the hotel that night. Food was ok. Price was expensive. Breakfast the next morning was of decent quality. It has a good spread of hot and cold food. Will I stay here again? Probably not. If I need to pay more for a decent quality room, I'll go to a better class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: wandering_bob231
Reviews.Content: When I am in Amsterdam again I will definitely stay at Radisson Blu. It is perfectly located in the city so that it is easy to walk everywhere. The food in the restaurant was excellent. All service was excellent. It is not the cheapest bed in town, but it was well worth what they charged. Good place. I recommend it highly. My only issue was getting to the hotel--which is not easy to find. It took well over an hour from the airport on the hotel shuttle which stopped everywhere before getting to the Radisson. If you want a better option, take the train (15 minutes from the airport) and walk about 10-15 minutes to the hotel. Make sure you have a map as Amsterdam's streets are a bit confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Itâ€™s all about location”
Reviews.Author: AName
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in April and our overall experience was very positive. Firstly the locationâ€¦ this is really good compromise between business and tourism, as itâ€™s easily accessible from Centraal Station â€“ 10/15 minutesâ€™ walk â€“ and 5/10 minutesâ€™ walk to popular places such as the RLD, Nieuwmarkt or Rembrandtplein. As the hotel is on a quiet side street, you donâ€™t suffer the usual Amsterdam noise problems â€“ even with windows open at night. Check-in was easy and staff very friendly. But be aware, they really push room upgrades on you. We declined the upgraded room at 85 euro per night and I am glad we did. Our room was reasonably spacious by Amsterdam standards and came equipped with a proper working desk, in-room safe, AC and all the usual stuff. WiFi is free in rooms and communal areas and was good quality access at all times. The restaurant is very very expensive for breakfast, so we â€“ like the majority of guests I suspect â€“ opted to eat elsewhere. Front desk staff were very helpful and had good advice. One of them recommended an Indonesian restaurant â€œIndrapuraâ€� on Rembrandtplein which was specular.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrBob-cs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in mid-March 2011. We have stayed in many european hotels, and this is now our favorite: large rooms, very quiet and clean, and very friendly staff. The continental breakfast was all we could hope for: good, high quality food, large selection. We arrived early, yet we were given one room immediately, and a second room a few hours later. We were within easy walking distance of shopping and restaurants, and a short trolly ride to the main museums. Free internet, desk big enough for some work. Modern furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class”
Reviews.Author: bhuk
Reviews.Content: Best bussiness class hotel in Amsterdam. Very convienent to airport and meeting rooms are best in class. I found all the front desk staff and banquet staff to be very friendly and helpful. In fact, most of them went the extra mile. Some of the highlights of the visit were the clean toilets, good food for breakfast, the beautiful lighting in the banquet hall, and lovely chair covers and decor in the hall. In total hotel rooms were spacious and very clean. We recommend this hotel to anyone who is having a offcial meeting or just needs a very nice economical place to stay. I was very impressed and will be staying there the next time

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend for family with kid”
Reviews.Author: Uahero
Reviews.Content: We have had wonderful weekend in Amsterdam not without help of Radisson. It is located in two blocks from Red Lights district in the heart of Amsterdam. Despite of its central location it is very quiet and peaceful place to stay - small street between channels, several coffeeshops are in 50 steps away. We've been upgraded to newly renovated (last Nov) Business Class room with Nespresso machine and breakfasts included for 70EUR per nite which was apparently a good deal because the room we had was really stylish, comfortable and large enough for family with 14 month kid. Breakfast buffet is very good especially in terms of bakery. Restaurant is OK - very good food but not so much excited by it. Be careful with minibars - they are connected on-line to hotel billing system, so when our junior has opened fridge to play with cans and bottles we've got all them stated in the bill on check-out. But it was not a problem to remove those expenses from the list as hotel personnel is very friendly. And the best thing we had is free late check-out which helped us a lot on Sunday afternoon before going to airport to get 8pm flight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: goofy75
Reviews.Content: We were staying in this hotel for the third time and it was always great. First, the location is the best you can dream of, among all the picturesque canals, very easy to get virtually anywhere. Second, the hotel itself is very stylish, we got a newly renovated room this time (see photos), which was just lovely, but even the old rooms, where we stayed before, were very nice. Third, the breakfast was always enjoyable, simply five-star service and five-star food. All in all, we highly recommend this hotel and am sure we will be staying there again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Well worth upgrading the room”
Reviews.Author: jennyq7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful & we felt special from the minute we arrived. We upgraded the room to an executive room (suite) & this included everything in the minibar. We stayed for 2 nights & the bar was fully replenished free again for the second night. Bed was very big & comfortable. Also had free moves on the 2 tv's in the spacious room. One afternoon when we returned to the room some of the sockets were not working. One phone call & these were checked and fixed in minutes. Very clean with well stocked toiletries. The bathroom was looking tired but functioned fine. We had breakfast included both days. This was a very wide choice of great quality buffet style hot & cold food (including chilled Prosecco) We ate there one eveing. The food was excellently presented & tasted good. We only had the burger & a chicken ceasar salad but there were more expensive choices available. We found it hard to find other restaurants in the city that served high quality food. Most catered for fast food or cheap pizza & pasta. Again service was very good. TIP. there are fortune cookies in baskets on reception. we each had one & they each contained a voucher giving a free glass of wine with our meal. I would definately stay in a Radisson Blu hotel again, but one trkip to Amsterdam is enough. It caters for groups of people rather than couples & once you've seen it you don't need to go back. The canal boat trip was lovely, but the shops were repetitve & down market. Full of tourist rubbish.The city is quite run down, tacky & dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary upgrades always give a good impression”
Reviews.Author: Grant_UK
Reviews.Content: Firstly I never get upgraded so the fact that I did here was extremely satisfying and may put a rose coloured tint on my review! Rooms are clean and our's was quite spacious. It's on a quiet street set pretty much mid way between the red-light district and the Amstel river, though you wouldn't know it was near the former. We didn't eat there, for breakfast try turning left out of the hotel, turn right and then go over the iron bridge on the left, there are a couple of cafes down there. No real niggles apart from the cost of room service which was extortionate

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is gorgeous!! Definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: pammyk1
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam, we went from Friday to Tuesday. After arriving at the airport we got a train to Central station. We got a taxi to our hotel which was 10 euro/ It was a short journey to the hotel and the taxi driver was very good at pointing out different things to see. We arrived at the hotel and checked in. The reception is absaloutly gorgeous and very unusual it has all the rooms facing onto it with different seating areas and waterfall and hotel bar. we got the lift up to our room and were very pleased with it. It was nice and spacious with a huge bed, seat, desk, minibar. tv etc. The bathroom was good size too with a power shower and bath. the room was exceptionally clean and was cleaned every day during our stay. The room also had a safe which was at no additional charge. This was excellent as you could keep all your valuables in there and not worry. We didnt eat in the hotel as it was not part of the booking and we wanted to eat out. The bar was lovely and reasonably priced except for the cocktails which were about 14euro!! Hotel staff were very helpful and recommending places to visit. The hotel was situated in Rusland and was on a quiet road there was therfore no noise at night. It was in walking distance of everything, although there are trams, buses & water taxis if you want to use them. We walked everywhere as it was nice to see the city and nothing was too far away. The dam square is 5mins walk, Rembrandt square also 5-10mins walk. Leidsplein was about 15-20mins, red light district is 10mins walk.. We walked to Anne Frank Museum which was really good and a must see if you havent been before. We didnnt do a lot of tourist things went to bars & coffee shops. Sex museum was good:-) Would reccommend the Rockery Coffee shop & Bulldog pub & Amstel 54 bar. All in fantastic long weekend, hotel was lovely couldnt have asked for any more. Will go back to this hotel for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jtung74
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with excellent location. From outside it looks like a small scale of 4* hotel but it is huge inside with an airy atrium. The room itself is old and need some refurbishment. Bathroom is good, with heating floor. But again it needs a face lift. If you can get a good price this hotel is not a bad choice, however I won't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: shiftman
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels we have stayed in on our travels. The hotel is spotless and the staff cannot do enough for you. We stayed in the deluxe rooms which as standard have an iron and ironing board,tea and coffee and slippers. There are robes which can be requested. The bathrooms had an added touch of underfloor heating and came with all the extras you would expect these days. The beds were very comfortable with extra pillows if required. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the food. This hotel is ideal for someone wanting a few nights away in Amsterdam. It is ideally located and in reasonable walking distance from all the major attractions, Dam Square being approximatly 600 metres from the hotel. They will even loan you umbrellas if the weather turns bad. We only stayed one night but would definately use this hotel again and next time stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “The best for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: currieinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Radisson Blu Amsterdam early January . As my wife's family is from Holland - all the time we've come over we have never stayed in Amstredam. I chose the hotel for the price and location and both were fantastic. You can't be more central . The hotel is in the best location for any tourist and has everything you need. The rooms are a good size and well appointed. We had an inter-connecting room and both were very large , we were on Level 6 and had rooftop windows so we got a great view of Amsterdam from both rooms. The beds were comfortable , the housekeeping was prompt and fast and both rooms cleaned and restocked well, the bar has a great atmosphere , we only ate breakfast in the hotel and they had a 2 for 1 deal and it was great.. many choices and a typical Dutch breakfast .It's very close to the Dam Square for shopping , very close to Centraal Station and if you have the need to walk the Red Light District , very close to that too . I'd have no hesitations in sending anyone to the Radisson Blu and will now always stay here when I'm in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: sandiUKLondon
Reviews.Content: I am quite surprised by the ratings this hotel has received, I was not impressed with it at all. We had a weekend stay in Amsterdam and I wanted to stay at a radisson to earn points for a promotion they had going. This hotel was SO expensive, but in a good area and I like Radisson hotels in europe so I decided to stay. The place was terrible. The hallways and rooms were so outdated and in need of repair, it looked like it was from the '70's, Our room was small, like most european hotels, but much smaller than the other Radissons i've recently stayed in (So don't use previous stays as a gauge for this one). And, on top of it all, I had pre-planned our itinerary and knew how we were going to get around, but I decided to ask the concierge just in case I missed anything, seeing that the maps get quite confusing with all of the canals. They didn't know anything about the city, so thank god I had pre-mapped everything out! One thing I didn't know was where to pick up the daily rental bikes - and they didn't even know that! Ridiculous, this is definitely not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only Radisson I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: While I would never even think of staying in a Radisson anywhere in North America, I gave this one a shot since it is one of the hotel chains that appears to have a better reputation overseas. I was very happy, and I would stay here again. The hotel is located in a very good location in downtown Amsterdam. You can walk just about anywhere in the city in 15 minutes. It is about 3 blocks from the red light district, 4 blocks from the flower market, and about 4 blocks to Dam Square. The rooms are very European (read: very small), but it was fine. There is also free wireless internet in the rooms. While the hotel was perfectly fine, and I would stay there again, I would not call it 5-star. My only real comment is that I set up a taxi back to the airport through the hotel. The hotel told me it would be 41 euros. The taxi drvier, however, tried to charge me 45 euros. Only when I questioned the driver did he back down. While the taxi driver didn't work for the hotel, I typically go through the hotel for this type of thing becuase the drivers are usually trustworthy becuase they get a lot of business from the hotel. It was a bit surprising to see that the driver (in my estimation) was trying to scam me out of a few extra euro.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: felipef71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gorgeous. From the heated white marble tile floors to the handsome hotel bar outfitted like a gentlemen's lounge, I loved my stay here. I definitely recommend getting breakfast included in your stay. The hotel's hot breakfast buffet was unbelievably delicious. Perfectly crisp bacon and even prosecco for mimosa creation. Amazing! We were able to walk to every attraction and end each night in the hotel bar for an incredible house wine from Spain - a tempranillo. I've never seen a house wine as fierce as that! Thank you, Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MortenBN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice and we got a free upgrade to a business class room. The location of the hotel is right in the center of Amsterdam. The staff were very friendly eventough they guided us to take to a tram to a place we wanted to visit. But they told us the wrong tram number so we had to walk a long distance to get to the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Gyllenbock
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in November 2010. I really liked this hotel. The location was central in a quiet street, close to everything. Takes about 20 minutes to walk to Central Station. The room was rather large, clean and contained everything that one would expect. Breakfast was very good, also nice with the free Internet. (included in the rate) Would love to stay at the hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: bashdxb
Reviews.Content: rooms are spacious and airy. location is within a short walking distance to basically everything. the only down side is the hotel staff be it at the reception or diners. quit rough edged in dealings with visitors. overall this is a very good hotel and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: torex
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m an experienced Canadian traveller. The Radisson Blu Hotel, Amsterdam @ Rusland 17 is a wonderful hotel. It is located in a perfect location, very central to the downtown core which made getting anywhere a breeze. It was very refreshing to experience the high level of customer service that I received during my entire week stay. Whatever questions or issues I had were attended to promptly whether it was checking in/out, an order for an electrical adapter, reservations for the airport shuttle, messages, maps or just plain directions the friendly staff at the front desk were always eager to assist me. I stayed in one of the newer rooms and it was really 1st class, modern, gorgeous and everything worked. There was a safe which I always like for my passport and other valuables. See if you can get one of those newer rooms! After such a wonderful first day I felt really comfortable and confident. I appreciated the free wifi. I appreciated the chocolates that were left on my pillow every evening. I felt spoiled. The housekeeping staff were excellent. A very professionally run hotel. If that isnâ€™t enough, I even received a phone call from the hotel on day 1 or day 2 asking me if everything was ok, â€œvery considerateâ€� I thought to myself. I was at the hotel bar on two occasions and I liked the bar and the bar staff. I never dined in the restaurant so I canâ€™t comment on it. There are so many dining options in downtown Amsterdam, and I was continuously out and about doing things that I didnâ€™t have the chance to try out the Radisson restaurant. Amsterdam is a very unique and charming city and the people there are refreshingly very friendly and liberal. I highly recommend taking a boat tour for a unique perspective of the canals and the architecture and also a visit to the Amsterdam historical museum is great as well which is only a 10 -12 minute walk from the hotel. A visit to the giant upscale department store, the De Bijenkorf, is a must and there is a great restaurant/cafÃ©â€™ on the 5th floor. I hope to return to the Netherlands again soon because I enjoyed it so much and if I stay again in Amsterdam I will definitely stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing new refurbished suits”
Reviews.Author: Rahayel
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to be the first one to sleep in their new suits. A double decker room, al in white, on the roof of the bldg, with windows on the 4 sides and even over the bed for a sky view. It has 2 salons, a theatrical music system, a play station 3, 2 TVs and a balcony. It was an over expected great experience. The hotel's location is the best you can get, 30 seconds from the centre and the red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: Good comfortable hotel with pleasant quiet rooms enabling a good nights sleep. Free in room wifi. Good location for business and pleasure. Pricey but you get what you pay for and for me it's the only decent business hotel I've found so far in Amsterdam. Breakfast is pleasant enough, minibar is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location, Very good service”
Reviews.Author: syncopation
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location on a quiet street adjacent to the university but a stones throw from all the action. I stayed in a room facing the street on the 4th floor which was spacious (said Deluxe on the outside plaque) and quiet with excellent beds. The TV could use an upgrade. Wireless internet was spotty but wireline was good - both included in my room price. I did not have the hotel breakfast although I was within 5 mins of excellent bakeries and cafes - which the front desk recommended. They were also very helpful in suggesting places to visit, eat at, shop, nightlife etc. Within walking distance trams (5-10 mins), main station (10-15 mins), major attractions, shopping etc. So you can get your work done in a quiet location when needed and get to the party areas/shopping in less than 15-20 mins either walking or by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: freek11
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the centre of Amsterdam, located in a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgainOslo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Blue for three nights in september in a mixed vusiness/lesire trip. the location is great on a quiet street, really close to everything. Hotel is brand new and quiet, up to Radisson standard. Rooms were nice and well furnished. The big negative side is that the hotel is very expensive but many hotels in Amsterdam are. The breakfast was good though. a little complian on the fact that is seems noise travel easily from room to room as we did hear well our the neighbor above us ... however not to an unbearable point. Staff was ok, just remeber to be careful ordering a taxi in advance or asking for it well in advance as they do take longuer than 5 min to reach the hotel in the morning and may make you miss your train or plane.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent baby friendly hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TonyTravels262
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu for three days with our one year old and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. We ate all of our meals in the hotel as the staff made everything so easy, OK its a tad expensive but it was well worth it, the food quality was excellent and the staff brilliant, couldn't say enough about the how good the staff were. Hotel itself was clean and very comfortble, a step up from quite a few hotels we have stayed at in Amsterdam. Location was excellent also, quite little street, but a few minutes stroll to everywhere you want to go too. Great little coffee shop just over the road also.

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic, otherwise pretty average and not cheap!”
Reviews.Author: ecw73
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as an anniversary treat. The location is absolutely fantastic, really central and from here you can walk to most of the city centre attractions, some pretty canals, the university and coffeshops are a stones throw away - but it's on a relatively quiet side street so not too noisy. The noise we did hear seemed to be from guests running up and down the corridors above us, early in the morning! We tried room service a couple of times, and one morning rang reception 5 times to get some milk for our tea, but in the end we just gave up. They seem to accommodate lots of coach trips and when everyone arrived/checked out at once it brought them to a standstill. The room was OK - just OK. We'd gone for an executive standard room, i.e. one level above standard, and the bed was big but that was the only luxurious thing about it. it was pretty shabby, and rather dated... for the money, I would expect far better. We didn't eat there as we preferred to go out and use a local cafe - and the room service breakfast (which consisted of a bowl of cereal, cup of tea/coffee and juice) was 25 euros! I think they were charging a luxury price without providing luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pperkinsnh
Reviews.Content: This was in a perfect spot for a walking tour. Short taxi from the train station, and 5 min to Dam Square. Coffee shops nearby, but no worries or problems. Quiet nights, the elevator is in a separate room. Close to De Jaren Restaurant, with 2 decks on a nice canal, great food. Booked for free with points so price was not a factor.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcleve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Amsteram (business for me; leisure for her) where we spent four nights at the Radisson Blu Hotel on Rusland Street. The most outstanding feature about this hotel is its excellent location, nestled between canals and only a couple of blocks from the tram. It is also a short walk to the DAM square area and to many shopping and dining areas nearby. We found it to be superbly convenient. Since I was on business, I had booked what the hotel calls an "executive" room. It was very nice in every respect, except one, it faced Rusland Street. We had expected the street to be fairly quiet, but it turned out to be quite noisy with trucks, cars and motor bikes coming by at all hours of the day and night. If I were to stay at the Radisson Blu again, I would request a room that does not face the street. The hotel serves an excellent breakfast (which was included in the price of our room) and serves dinner in the restaurant in the evening. While we did not have dinner there, the menu looked good and there were many people dining each night we were there. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler to Amsterdam (subject to the caveat mentioned above). S

Reviews.Title: “Great service, comfy bed, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: csmart
Reviews.Content: We were a bit reluctant to book this hotel after reading some of the reviews on tripadvisor about the tiredness of some of the rooms. In reality there was nothing to worry about! The hotel is a short 5 minute walk from Dam square so is very handy to several tourist and shopping spots around Amsterdam. Check-in was a pleasant experience and very quick. We were allocated a room on the 6th floor facing the hotel entrance. The room was very quiet and spacious - it had a safe, minibar, coffee/tea making facilities, iron, ironing board, marble bathroom with shower over the bath and a heated floor, separate desk area, free in-room wireless internet, good wardrobe space and probably the best pillows and most comfortable bed I've experienced at any hotel. Being on the top floor of the hotel, there were automatic black-out blinds on the skylights. The buffet breakfast was excellent - a great selection of cereals, yoghurts, pastries, breads, cheeses, cold meats, juices (including freshly squeezed orange juice station!), hot breakfast selection (bacon, eggs, sausages, mushrooms, toast, etc). There is a juice bar, coffee shop (the Amsterdam version), beautician, and small Art shop across the road; and a souvenir shop and a hairdresser next door. Our experience at this hotel would make it an easy choice for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: charming2
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu in Amsterdam was the perfect place for our stay there. Just around the corner from coffee shops, great restaurants and within walking distance of great shopping. Canal tours left from a couple of blocks away. They have the most comfortable beds of any hotel I have ever stayed in. Airport transportation gets you there in 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A central hotel away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: doaknic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last weekend for two nights. It has a very central location however remains quiet due to the fact that it is on a small side street. Our room was big enough for us, nicely decorated and very clean. It came with all mod cons, tv, safe minibar hairdrier, iron , ironing board, kettle etc. Bathroom had heated floor, great shower and some complimentary toiletries. Staff were very helpful and not intrusive. Bar prices were very reasonable too.Our stay included buffet breakfast in the morning which was a wonderful spread of everything you could possibly think of. Only complaint was that the bacon was a bit overdone. If I was to return to Amsterdam , I would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ika013
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in a good location close to many attractions like Dam square, Anne Frank House, Flower Market, Red Light District . The Hotel is clean and staff very friendly and helpfull. Our room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast very good. Surley will go there again

Reviews.Title: “IGet a "cool" room if you can!”
Reviews.Author: celebrationtiger
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with three generations and the location was perfect. We could walk everywhere in ten minutes. We used the canal boatwhich was close by, for the Rijks Musem and the Van Gogh museum.The hotel staff was excellent. Lissane and Walkiiy at the front desk, always smiled and were always helpful. They upgraded one room to a "cool room", of which there are only five. Mine was carved out of an old Dutch house . The room is very contemporary , all white, but also had a loft in the atic which was a perfect place to watch a movie or play a game with a child. It was a wonderful surprise. Ralph Reiners , one of the managers was especially thoughtful and helpful when I was having trouble with my lap top's internet connection. He actually came to my room to try to solve the problem. The internet is free and there is also an internet station in the lobby with computers and also wireless and wired connections. Thus you have a backup, in case your laptop is not working perfectly. The amenities in the room were especially nice. They included the usual, but also handcream in a little jar by Ann Semonin of Paris, in addition to the usual body lotion. The lighting controls in the bedroom were very convenient ,as well as ,the special spot for your own items in the fridge. The other room we had, while not brand new was well maintained and very attractive in nautical colors. Both rooms had an iron as well as a pants press. The street was mainly quiet except for one Saturday night reveler. The hotel is adjacent to Amsterdam University which has an excellent archeological museum. I had dinner in the hotel. The meal was freshly cooked, as the chef cooks in the dining room. I had lobster and it was only 25 euro. It was excellent. There were several other specials all resonably priced. The price of the rooms varies considerably on the internet. Some dates ,even in the same week, appear much cheaper than others ,so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisInMaryland
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine -- confortable beds, good pillows, nice bath/shower, adequate storage -- so I'm pretty sure you'll be confortable here. What makes it really nice is the location -- close to te Red Light District, but not in it. More than that, it was an easy walk in both directions to other interesting parts of town. We did pass many other hotels and think the location of this one was ideal. We had an esy time finding places to eat, even ones recommended on the Internet, and walked to them all. Our room faced the street, which we asked for, and had no problem with noise. We'd stay here again. One thing that you really need to know about this and likely all other hotels in downtown Amsterdam: ask if they have a shuttle from the airport. This one did, but it is not on their website. Also, you will not be able to drag your luggage through town from the train station -- well, you could, but it would not be easy -- so you'll end up paying 20 Euros to get from the train station to the hotel -- and this hotel was relatively close. Adding in the cost of the train ticket for the two of us and the tip to the taxi driver, it cost us 30 euros to get from the hotel to the airport, and took about an hour. Going back to the airport, we took a car (aranged by the hotel) for 40 euros and got there in 20 minutes. This hotel also has a shuttle bus for 15 euros each, which is a great deal. We think this is one of the better hotels we've stayed in when in Europe, so we easily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: EJTH
Reviews.Content: Completely disappointing experience as a business traveller. I do not expect a huge room with a tiny single bed and I don't expect an outdated bathroom with a pathetic stream of water in the shower. The room was on the road with limited double glazing which meant road noise and the sounds of revellers on the street penetrated my sleep. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff. We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: traveller77_10
Reviews.Content: Positives: - This hotel has a good location, everywhere is within walking distance and we felt safe when out at night (2 female travellers). The hotel is a 5 mins walk away (max) from Dam square, Rembrant place and the red light district. The conceige gave us a map on the first day, pointed out the main places and explained how to get there - which was very useful. Rooms are very quite as they face onto a cental atrium - where the check in desks, etc are. So there is no road noise. The majority of staff were really friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable, there were marks on the furtniture from wear and tear. But they were clean and safe. Liked the heated floor in the bathroom. The negatives are: - Rooms have no natural light or fresh air due to patio doors opening onto the atrium. The faux balcony has a gap either side, unsafe for small children. They were refurbing the fitness centre and restaurant - I think we should have been told this BEFORE we arrived at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JoeDBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Raddison. Hotel was very well located and on a relatively quiet street. Staff was very helpful. Make sure to stop for a drink at the bar. It's charming and the bartenders are very friendly. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. If you are a huge fan of airconditioning you may be disappointed. It was explained that the hotel has more of an air exchange system than air conditioning. Evenings in Amsterdam are not very warm though. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Hotel Fine”
Reviews.Author: notherdayanothercity
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine, room was a bit dark, and the place felt a bit old. The breakfast was â‚¬25, which we refused to play (considering you can get an Irish Breakfast for â‚¬5 to â‚¬7 elsewhere). Plus the internet in the place is like â‚¬7 for 15mins which is also a rip off. Saying that, we didnt spend much time in the hotel. But we loved the location. Bout 5 mins to Dam Square and 5 mins to Rembrandt Square which was another good place for food and drink. It was also like five mins from the Red Light District, if thats what your there for!

Reviews.Title: “A little effort and this would be great”
Reviews.Author: Hawkwind1966
Reviews.Content: Hi, This is not my first stay in this hotel and I do generally like it, the facilties and quality of furnishing is very high. The beds are fantastic and give me a great nights sleep. However, I am unable to make this my preferred hotel for Amsterdam because of the check in and out process. This is often long and overly protracted. The staff are well training in what to say, but do not seem to take any notice of queues building up. The open layout of the hotel, does not help, often you see staff talking to each other when there are space for them to be working on the counter, relieving the queue size at checkin. Other hotels manage this much better, so we know it is possible - it just takes some care. As check in and check out are the first and last impressions you get - it would be advisable to make this efficient rather than blaming the number of customers as the reason why it is inefficient. Otherwise, a great hotel, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: b2dac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family for four nights. The location is excellent for accessing tourist Amsterdam: many sights within walking distance. Our rooms (business class) were clean and spacious but,k we felt they had a tired 1980s feel. Free wi-fi is handy. The bathrooms were very, very small and the televisions very dated. Housekeeping were sparing with shower gels: these were only repleted on 2 of the 4 nights. For two nights there was a stale smell from the bathroom drain which the hotel did solve. The bar only opens at 5 p.m. (not ideal on a weekend break). Perhaps the most annoying thing was the grumpy attitude of a few of the staff who, in my opinion, badly let down the friendly ones. The concierge service tried to be helpful but information supplied on the two nights we asked for it about local eateries was annoyingly inaccurate. The first night we asked we spent a lot of time looking for a recommended restaurant that had changed its name some time previously. The second night we were sent on a wild goose chase looking for a restaurant which was, in fact, at a different location to that given to us. These things were all mentioned at checkout and I was promised an email giving me the opportunity to submit comments: that email, to date, has not yet come. Next time I will stay in a different hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Melbsteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights and cannot fault it. The hotel is ideally located near to the red light district, Dam street etc. Check in was easy incredibly laid back and speedy. The room was in the new section a good size and modern with excellant room service and a good selection of TV channels. Facing the atrium was a bit noisy so the hotel happily moved me into the old section the following night which is accessible via an underground walkway, again the room was nice and modern. No issues, this hotel does exactly what is says on the tin...will happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkolodz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! After travelling around Europe and staying at places that were not quite up to par with U.S. standards, this hotel was such a nice treat for the end of our trip. First and foremost the location is excellent. It is centrally located near the Red Light District but set a few streets back and in between the canals so it provides a more quiet and relaxing feel ... lots of cool coffeeshops and breakfast/lunch spots nearby. At night it is quiet and safe. Also, the hotel itself was nice. Did not check out many of the amenities but there was a large lobby, large rooms/nice amenities, pleasant staff... cannot say enough good things. I will never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for business and leisure in all Amsterdam - I tried several hotels in the city and this is the best one”
Reviews.Author: rpanch
Reviews.Content: I lived and worked in Amsterdam for over a year and throughout my trips I tried several hotels all around the city. I had to say that this hotel is the best one for business and leisure in all the city. I was working with several colleagues that stayed in other hotels in the city and I recommended them this hotel. They all loved the Radisson and decided to stay there during the coming months. The hotel is in the heart of Amsterdam, walking distance from everything you can imagine and the quality of the hotel in all aspects is outstanding. Metro is 3-4 minutes from the hotel. Breakfast is very decent and all rooms that I have stayed (tried more than 20 rooms) are quite big and extremely clean (hotel is pretty new). Advise: If you can afford it, for a little bit more of money try to get an upgrade. Rooms are double the space and you get several extras in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: micklfc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb over valentines weekend . Found the hotel to be well located and the public areas very well maintained and spacious. Breakfast was excellent throughout our stay the selection of continental items on the buffet really impressed me . Found the bedrooms a bit old and tired but they served a purpose . Reception staff a bit rude but in summary you cat go wrong here

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, perfect for short trips”
Reviews.Author: CariaTravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is several buildings, all joined together by walkways and an atrium. We were in the "old house" whose rooms looked out onto the Atrium. So there was no chance of opening up the window for some fresh air. I think if I was there any longer than 3 nights I would have wanted an outside view though. However, for the 2 nights we were there, it was great! Comfortable bed, lovely bathroom, and plenty of rooms. We had no problems with any noise from the atrium, and the hotel is in such a position that it's not too hustle and bustle outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & value”
Reviews.Author: Magnum55
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I arrived at the hotel @ 10am from an overseas flight and stayed only one night. We were pleased to find out that our room was ready despite check in time being 3pm. Our room was clean and spacious with all the necessary amenities. The hotel was quite busy due to a big bicycle racing event being held in the city that weekend but it did not affect the hotel services. The front desk was also very helpful with giving maps, directions & itierary suggestions. They also held our luggage after we checked out allowing us to continue touring the city before leaving for the airport to catch an evening flight. Overall our experience was positive and felt this hotel was an excellent value for the money. We recommend + would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room with a view, I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: pepperjelly
Reviews.Content: Viking River Cruises booked our room for the Amsterdam-extension part of our cruise. Our room door had the label "Deluxe, Non-smoking" It was perfect, great night sleep, warm bathroom floor, fluffy towels excellent breakfast--fresh squeezed orange juice, hot coffee, muselli and pastries. (Hot breakfast looked great, but I eat light). Tip: The room instant coffee was good, but go down to the restaurant and they give you a tray with a pot of coffee, cream and sugar to take back to your room!!! Heavenly start to the day! Central location, it was easy to walk anywhere and walk we did!!! Hotel Conceirge was very helpful. Note: A male receptionist without looking up our name, flatly stated that our rooms would not be ready until 3:00 (it was 11:30) A little female receptionist named Sam motioned for us to come over to her, she looked up our names and yes indeed our rooms were ready! Very kind of her and we appreciated her help. with recommendations and reservations to restaurants and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stropaire
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, enjoyable stay. Generally very positive. Two small quibbles, first the bar (closed during the day) is very dark making it impossible to read a book or newspaper there. Secondly, though this is due to Amsterdam city policy, I was charged â‚¬47 per night for car parking. Tip, if coming to Amsterdam, park cheaply at a railway station and take the train.

Reviews.Title: “You had me at heated bathroom floor”
Reviews.Author: mattk23
Reviews.Content: Though we were out and about most of the time we were in Amsterdam, we did enjoy the room quite a bit. Not only was the staff friendly and efficient with check-in and any directions we needed. But the room was of nice size for a European hotel, very comfortable bed, was expecting a little more out of the shower, but the heated bathroom floor tiles made me not be so picky. We are both in our twenties, and enjoyed the location being in the vicinity of a number of fun spots to eat, photograph, and play. Though very close to Dam Square and Red Light District, very quiet in the room and let us really enjoy our sleep. Wish we could have stayed a few more days!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but old room and bad sleeping”
Reviews.Author: sol20
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and incredible staff ready to help us.The breakfast was so good but my room was tired and the bed was old and no confortable. Solange

Reviews.Title: “A Haven From A Good But Different City”
Reviews.Author: DAVID_B_JOHNSON
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Central location - 10 mins walk form Dam Square, 45 mins walk from the Museum Qtr, 25 mins walk from train station, two streets away from red light area and bars which is great for walking around on an evening and the hotel is far enough from the bars to be quiet. Recommend you book the breakfast as part of your deal espcially if you do not want to trek far for as not sure quiet where you'd go near the hotel. Transfer to and from airport by train is cheap and easy but hotel around 25 mins walk from train station. Humphreys and Greetje are great resturants. 9 streets is good for quirky shoping and relaxed feel. Anne Frank Hosue is a must and a boat trip is good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend hotel close to it all”
Reviews.Author: Banko-DK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in their south wing, had a room facing the yard and it was very nice and quiet in the evening. The hotel is extremely nice located, close to it all but still in a quiet side street. Positive: Perfect location for a city break! Friendly staff Nice rooms (slightly outdated, but not old) Negative: In general I do not have much to fault on the hotel, but the breakfast was a bit uninteresting, typical 4 star hotel breakfast with everything (hot and cold) but not something "out of the ordinary". Would definately consider going here again with friends or the like if I could get a good rate (100-150 euro per night per room).

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located - Perfect Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonliLmadam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Blu Hotel 19th - 21st March 2010, booked through Expedia. Though only a short stay it was more than perfect to spend my 21st Birthday. The hotel itself is centrally located, round the corner from Dam Square, the Red Light district etc.. We stayed in a suite, which consisted of twin beds, dressing table area, tv (plus engish channels), mini bar, Plentiful closet space and a relatively good sized bathroom. The hotel itself is set on a quiet road, so you wont have to hear the party in the centre commencing til the early hours, guaranteed to have a perfect sleep. I must add the beds were soooo comfortable. The staff are more than attentive to you needs. The hotel offers Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner with a superb seafood menu, though we did not eat here as it is very steep in price and you can get cheaper elsewhere. On the weekends they do a deal on Breakfast 20 Euros each, but again, if you walk round the corner you can get a full English or whatever suits your taste buds for less than 10 euros! Amsterdam itself is such a small city, so we made the mistake of buying a travel card for 3 days (25 Euro's each), which we did not use once as we walked everywhere. Trams were everywhere you turned, and again we did not use any during our tour adventures as everything was like 2/3 minutes walk away! The only bad thing I would say is, as we opened our windows to get some air into the room, there was a stench of strong weed smell coming from outside; as the cleaner was cleaning our room, he must of reported it to the staff and two minutes later we had security at our door asking if we were smoking inside (lol), they were more than polite and acknowledged that it was in fact the stench from outside and not from us, we even invited them in to check!! All in all this hotel was FABOLOUS, ideal for couples, older people and those who enjoy the finer things in life lol.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to trust in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tommypip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a 2 day trip in Oct 08; we will be staying here aagin should we return to the 'dam. This is a hotel whose name you can trust; safe, comfy rooms, good nights sleep. Beautiful bar just off reception, and in a good area. Room was clean, well maintained, and suitable for a short trip. It was not luxurious, but met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, clean, central with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Georgia_9
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Amsterdam and stay at the wonderful Radisson Blu, I wonder if I stayed at the same hotel as some of the less than flattering previous reviews. My husband and I were given a business room in the part of the hotel which is over the road from the main building. The room was spacious, sparklingly clean, well decorated with an extremely comfortable bed, in a warm shade of peach, it over looked the small quiet road between. I am a light sleeper and I can categorically say the room was NOT NOISY ! The room temperature was perfect (again something I'm fussy about) and the breakfast next morning was very good, with an excellent choice of cereal, preserves, meats, cheeses, breads, juices and of course the traditonal cooked breakfast should you so desire it. I could not fault the service or the quality of the food and certainly could find nothing to complain about. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is extremely central being only 5 minutes walk from the Dam Square, and it is near the Red light district, but you do not have to go there! There are lots of lovely scenic canal walks which do not go anywhere near it! The choice is yours! All in all we had an excellent stay in Amsterdam, the one slight warning is that there is quite alot of building work causing some disruption going on a round the station as a new underground is being built. I would recommend a visit to the Keurkenhof Gardens during April/May, the tulips weren't out for our visit due to a late spring, but it was still worh the visit ,excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: EllensideaTexas
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable and spacious, if a little outdated and too orange for my taste. The beds were sink in and die comfortable with warm comforters. The bathrooms were clean with efficient showers. I had a hot kettle in my room but the kids had a specialty coffee maker in theirs. My room was very quiet, not a sound, but I had a really hideous view from the window of a trashy yard. The kids had a view of the street, but they heard noise all night long. The staff was very welcoming and helpful in every single way. I needed a band-aide but the stores close by were not open yet and the wonderful staff found me one for no charge. They recommended restaurants that were excellent also (from previous experience not all hotels do that). My only complaint was that the breakfast buffet was pretty horrible. I didn't eat anything because it looked so unpalatable and the server was a rather brusque and impatient woman which doesn't start a morning off too well. To her credit, she had a really large group deal with next to us and maybe it was an off day? Finally, the red light district was basically around the corner and down a block from us. Which in my opinion was too darn close. I don't care what you've heard. Unsavory types are all over that area.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Look_Left
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time in Amsterdam on business and have tried quite a few hotels in the city. I stayed in the Radisson Blu on two occasions this month and after my last stay there is no way I would go back! The problem with this hotel (and the reason for the mixed reviews) is that it is made up of two buildings with a underground walkway connecting them. On my first visit this month I stayed in the main building where the reception is located. The room was modern and exactly what I would expect from a Radisson, As a GoldPoints member I was upgraded to a business room which was a nice touch but I was very disappointed to note that there was no complementary water in the room and that small bottles of mineral water are charged at over 5 Euros from the minibar! Despite this I was impressed enough with the hotel and the staff to stay there again two weeks later. What a mistake that was! This time I was given a room in the building across the road from the main hotel lobby, despite this being my second visit in two weeks and despite being a Goldpoints member I was given a grotty little room directly behind the main lift shaft. Not only that, the decor was deplorable and the room absolutely stank of stale sweat. I complained at the front desk, to their credit they apologised and upgraded me to a business room. However, this room was also in the building across the road and whilst it was bigger, less noisy and not smelly, the decor was the same. It is over 20 years out of date and I can't imagine that it was ever tasteful, even back then. There are plenty of good business hotels in Amsterdam and I am surprised that this one is ranked so highly as it is now very close to the bottom of my list of business hotels in the city, if you are considering staying here, don't bother, it's a real gamble, take my advice and stay in the Crowne Plaza instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and thoughtful staff”
Reviews.Author: ami51244
Reviews.Content: My partner and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is right next to the famous red light district and china town, a very centrally located hotel. The staff was really thoughtful; I have some very long hair and after the first night, we used half the bottle of the conditioner. The following day, not only did they replenish the old bottle, they also supplied an extra bottle! How thoughtful and caring is that! The room was always nice and clean when we came back at night, completely faultless. I loved the complimentary internet (I carry my netbook wherever I go). Bathroom was clean and spacious. Fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DevonEddy
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyable stay here. As others have mentioned location is good, central but in a quiet street. My only criticism would be that the rooms are very stuffy. Fortunately our room had a window that opened onto the road so we basically kept it open the entire stay. Also worth knowing is that for a fixed price of 35euros from the hotel you can hire a taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jiinx
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed only one night in this hotel. It was startlingly ugly in decoration and the public spaces were not very clean. There was v little choice at breakfast and both our executive rooms were extremely noisy. However, the staff were entirely charming and could not have been friendlier or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisnAnna
Reviews.Content: Pros: Executive rooms are quite large (Rm472 is double width with large seating area) and come with Nespresso machines. Great location between Dam Square and Leidersplein. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Theres a very nice coffee shop opposite. Cons: TVs are very old fashioned with limited English channels. The hair dryer was woeful and the decor was slightly dated. The bar is closed during the day and there is nowhere to relax with a coffee or sandwich. Top Tip: Make sure you agree a price with the taxi before leaving the airport. Cost should be around E40. The hotel can arrange a taxi for you for E41, we had a lovely Mercedes S Class. Tell the hotel if your stay is for a special occassion as we got an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Toni0329
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in Oct. 2009 for 3 nights, and loved it. The location was excellent - within walking distance to shops, restaurants, red light district, etc. Staff was very friendly and helpful with directions, etc. Rooms were large, very clean, and comfortable. The Hotel bar was a nightly stop for us and very quiet and romantic. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: jacobsterner
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport with shuttle bus, good buffet breakfast and nice room. had an issue with aircon in the room I got when checked in. Staff was very helpful in getting me another room without any questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: outlandos63
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the large atrium with it's designer scaffolding and overhanging window boxes we knew this was going to be a good choice. The check in was faultless. We requested a kingsize bed, room near the top floor and not near the elevator. All of these requests were met with ease. The bed even surpassed our desire as it was a super king ! The room was clean, although there was some staining in the bath and sink, and very spacious considering that Amsterdam is well known for it's small hotel rooms. There was an issue with the duvet being slightly too small for the bed so we requested an extra duvet which was dealt with immediately. There is one complaint that I would have to make and that is that the price of water in the mini bar is exorbetent. Nearly Â£5 for a small bottle. I did address this with the hotel and their only reaction was that this is normal in Amsterdam.............well, sorry but this is a rip off in any part of the world. Apart from that I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: JackieandRoss
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for exploring the city and is close to bars and restaurants. However, it is looking a little tired in some areas - eg main atrium. The walls are rather thin and one night we were we kept awake by the arrival of guests in the next room in the middle of the night and by noise from the street. Overall OK.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless location but a bit over-priced”
Reviews.Author: LondonMarylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of January. The location is perfect, just a short walk from Dam Square and Nieuwmarkt but in a quiet side-street away from the stag and hen party crowds. The room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. An unusual feature of the hotel was the board in the lobby detailing flight departures and arrivals at Schipol - handy if you are on a business trip I would imagine. On the down side, the room was extremely hot, even when the thermostat was turned all the way down. In our room there was also a painfully toe-stubbing step into the bathroom. Breakfast was excellent, though very expensive even though we got a "two for one" deal as it was the weekend. We only took breakfast in the hotel one morning, prefering to find a cafe for the others. Another gripe was the lack of vegetarian options on the dinner menu. (Recommend the Butterfly Thai Cafe just around the corner, though). All in all, a good hotel, although I think more 4-star than 5-star, but somewhat over-priced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, room way too warm”
Reviews.Author: MatkamiesFFT
Reviews.Content: - Convenient location near major tourist attractions - Rooms bit on the smaller side, but not tiny - Service was fine - Our room faced the covered courtyard housing the reception, meaning we could not really get fresh air by opening the window - Heating system in the room did not work properly; it was continuously on even when turned down, causing the room to become very warm

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bus7er
Reviews.Content: in the city center, close to all the attractions, perfect service and a full recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location and really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cat_Ar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and were very happy with it. The location is great - very central but on a quiet road away from bars and the noisier parts. It was a very easy and straightforward walk from the station, which saved on getting a cab. The hotel itself is clean and modern, although as a nice twist, the bar is housed within an original 19th Century building - when the hotel was built, it was incorported into the design rather than demolished. Other nice touch was free use of the business centre to check in to our flight online and print off our boarding passes - most other hotels would have charged for this service. We were allocated a room on the 6th floor, which had nice views over the city and was also very quiet. There was a good bathroom, although if I was splitting hairs, I would say it is a little on the small side. Definitely only room for one person at a time to brush their teeth! One small note about the room - it was split level. When you came in through the door, there was a bathroom and hall area with ample wardrobe space. There was then a small flight of about 6 steps to get up to the bed area. This wasn't a problem for us, but anyone with limited mobility, or someone who doesn't want to have to go up or down any stairs when going to the bathroom in the night might want to check with reception when they book. I think the split-level design is only found in a couple of rooms. The breakfast buffet had a great selection and was served until a very generous 11:30am on the weekends, which was great! As well as the great location, I was also very impressed with the staff. They were all very friendly and helpful, and on hand to answer questions. They can also recommend a number of restaurants very close by. Personally, I would recommend the Butterfly Thai Cafe near the hotel by the Canal. Some of the best Thai food I've had in years!

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: RubberDucky1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time at this hotel, there was a massive thunder storm the weekend we stayed and it was amazing to watch it under the glass roof of the reception. Room was clean and tidy however we were stuck right next to the lift and the noise of the doors opening and closing really got to me after a while and when you pressed a switch you couldn't be sure what light would come on! Very expensive 13 euros for a vodka and coke in the bar, would of actually been cheaper purchasing it from the mini bar in the room. Only ate in the hotel once and again very expensive but was good. Going back in Mar 2010

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: LMCTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at Radisson SAS at the end of December 2009. Overall, the hotel had comfortable rooms with a good location. Pros: 1. Good location, off the Dam Square on a side street. It is an easy walk to most of the attractions, including the Anne Frank house and floating flower market. Since the lines to the Anne Frank house is always long, it is advisable to either order the timed tickets in advance or go about 45 minutes before closing when the lines are much shorter but guests would only have about 30 minutes to view the house since it closes generally around 7pm. The museum area (Van Gogh and Rijks) may take about 30 minutes. The hotel is also about 10-15 minutes walk from Central Station (the main land and water transportation hub). 2. The room is considered large by European standards with a good-sized bathroom. 3. The room was clean and well maintained. 4. Wireless Internet is free in the room. Cons: 1. There is no coffee machine but a pitcher that heats up water. 2. The hotel should be 3.75 stars by American standards instead of 5 stars, as it doesn't appear to have a spa or a well appointed lobby. The hotel lobby and rooms are due for a remodel. 3. The restaurant serves average food but guests can easily walk to the Damrak (one of the busiest streets) and surrounding streets for food. Just off the Damrak on a street leading back to the hotel (street on the right of NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky from Damrak), there is a pizza place to purchase a slice of good pizza for a quick bite. As a trip, for transportation to/from the airport to the hotel, guests can use the Connexion shuttle service for less than $30 Euros roundtrip. Guests can purchase tickets from the Tourist office conveniently located at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, ugly furniture in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RiverRome
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after having read many positive reviews. I stayed here for four days, and honestly I would come back, because the location is really perfect (very close to Dam square), staff is friendly and the rooms very clean. However, we didn't like the furniture in the rooms: definitely not a 5 star standard; it was a little old. Good the free internet wi-fi in the room (if you don't have your laptop, you'll have to pay 5 euros for 15 minutes in the lobbby!) On the third day, at about 3 pm. we decided to take a nap, but suddendly heard some very loud noises coming from the ground floor: they started renovating the kitchen, and it was impossibile to sleep. However, the staff was very nice, and offered us another room, in the nearby building. Choose this hotel if you want to be at walking distance from the station and Dam square, and you want a clean place in which to sleep with no surprises. Prices inside are a little crazy: 25 euros for a breakfast is really crazy, as well as the prices in the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “radisson blu for new year”
Reviews.Author: NONE1
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 31st Dec and spent 3 nights in this Hotel. We were happy with most things- quick check in-great comfy bed, plenty of room, good size room, with everything you would need. Adjustable heating- under floor bathroom heating, which was lovely. Service was good- we did try the breakfast- special offer @ 40e for 2. Was good, but a bit overpriced- had better outside for less- was just covenient for New Years day. The bar area is lovely- again good service. We had room service New Years Eve at about 1am- which was great and did not take too long. All in all was pleased with the hotel- the only downside was for us the location- as the nearest tram stop to go anywhere we wanted was a bit of a walk- was probably more noticeable as the weather was so cold. Would not be an issue in warmer times.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money, excellent location and large/comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: SuperEagle78
Reviews.Content: We spent a very nice weekend in Amsterdam and given the price we paid (good deal through Wikipedia) we were not expecting such luxury and comfort. Cannot comment on any of the restaurants as our package did not include breakfast so we used Amsterdam hotels. I would recommend this hotel for its central location (really near Dam square, red light district and many other attractions), very comfortable beds (i'm 1m95) and overall very nice and quiet rooms on top of a very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful restoration/renovation makes for a fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xamb
Reviews.Content: Once you find it, relatively hidden in Amsterdam's maze of streets and canals, the Radisson is really a delight. The rooms are big and well designed; we got free wireless access, and the breakfast is a bountiful buffet. Getting both in the 'conference price' made the room rates quite reasonable. The neat architectural tricks the designers used to keep the facade and atmosphere of two centuries ago with all the conveniences of a modern hotel made me smile every time I discovered a new part of the facility (which has a tunnel under the street between the two 'wings'). The service personnel were exceptionally friendly, although not particularly experienced. English is the hotel's working language as few of the employees are Dutch. Given this diversity, the hotel appears very well managed and adept at moving customers through the lobby and helping them take advantage of the fantastic city -- all in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel! Could be a 5 stars if rooms were more modern”
Reviews.Author: lefrancais
Reviews.Content: As you can see from all my reviews, I stay in hotels very often. I have become more and more used to it and as a result, I know exactly what I want. My wife and I chose this hotel because of its great location. It's true, it's very well located. We didn't take any public transport once in the whole weekend....how nice! (we only took a train to get back to the airport). The staff is fantastic! They have a great understanding of what service means! The hotel Manger, that we met does a fantastic job! There is a great feel in this hotel. It's lively and warm. I would have given this hotel five stars if I hadn't tried that many hotels in the past). I am only keeping five stars for the "coups de coeurs"...my personal favourites. I recomend this hotel! Go for it, it's very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagBlossom
Reviews.Content: The best part of this comfortable friendly hotel was the beautiful bar area that once was the home of a priest. The staff were very helpful and the bar snacks good value for money. The staff of the hotel were efficient and helpful. The rooms comfortable and very clean, and the hotel is central to all the things you would want to see when visiting Amsterdam. We travelled in a female group of a mother and 3 daughter for the youngests 18th birthday. When we arrived we asked for our rooms to be on the same floor, and this was done without a fuss. There is a pleasant gym area, easliy accessed through an internal under road route, and the hotel is clearly well maintained throughout. The breakfast was good with a full range to suit vegetarians too. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rovingbrits
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Radisson Blu early (due to our flight times) on Saturday morning at around 09:30 and asked to leave our suitacases with the concierge. The hotel Duty Manager (Peter ...) immediately checked our booking, confirmed that a room was available, upgraded us to `Business` and completed all the reservation details in under two minutes. The room (in the block across the road - accessed via the undergound walkway) was spotlessly clean, very spacious and warmly furnished and incl. a coffee machine. We had a couple of lights not working which were replaced within 5 minutes of our contacting reception. The breakfast is probably the best (choice) we've had anywhere. We ate in the hotel restaurant on our 2nd eve and although a little quiet the service was excellent and friendly and the meal perfect. Visit the bar, the barman was very friendly and helpful on things to do / see. This hotel is a `Must Stay`, perfectly located and just far enough away from the City centre (and Red Light District) for a peaceful, relaxing and luxurious stay.
