Tips: If you're going to visit Anne Franke's house (recommended), pre-book on-line. The queue can be very long at any time of day. Red LIght District, worth a visit but a little seedy and often sad. Many groups of lads, 18 - 25ish, `enjoying` their first experiences ... Visit Mulligans Irish Bar (100 Amstel), excellent trad. music, very friendly and just about the best Guinness outside of Dublin.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly best hotel we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: albumen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and really enjoyed it immensely. The service we received was brilliant, the staff were all superbly accommodating and met any request, from turning off the mini-bar for the added quiet to loaning us umbrellas when it rained was done with a smile and professionalism. We fully intend to return here a soon as is possible, and there's no need for us to consider any other hotel. it's well located, and once you get tuned in to the city layout this really shows. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and not once did we feel uncomfortable walking back late at night.... we also didn't need to go through the red light area to get anywhere..........

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: frjohnsen
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at one Radisson hotel, you'll immediately feel at home at any of the others in the chain, and that's a good thing. Radisson Blu (formerly SAS) in downtown Amsterdam has everything you need in a big city hotel. Extremely professional and courteous staff, good sized rooms, free wifi, a bar perfect for business meetings, close proximity to everything in Amsterdam, and a breakfast tailored to be a pickmeup after a night out...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nalced
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location- less than five minute walk to Dam Square. Rooms are very comfortable, hotel is spotless, and the staff are on the ball. The wireless broadband is included in your room price (not sure how long it will stay this way). Its really annoying that the bar does not open until 5pm - it means you have no where to sit and relax to enjoy a coffee or a beer during the day other than your bedroom. The breakfast needs to inclufe hot food as a choice - breakfast is expensive. Room service is expensive - nearly â‚¬20 for a club sandwich. Overall though- for business or for tourist who need a good base in a central location which is quiet - book here if you can get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure - staff lovely”
Reviews.Author: hannie29
Reviews.Content: WE booked two roooms here recently interconnecting with each other as there were five of us - 2 adults, 1 teenager and 2 five year olds - we were unsure as to how big the rooms would be - delighted to find the executive room was very spacious - and standard room joing it was comfortable also. Rooms fab and the kids had plenty of room to play in the evening. Staff were exceptional at all times - at check in the kids received a small colouring set. Food was lovely - lots of choice at breakfast buffet. We had room service on one occassion for dinner - food again was lovely. Location of hotel was ideal - a couple of minutes from dam square. Staff only too delighted to answer any queries. Amsterdam also a haven for shopping!! TunFun an adventure park built underground is must for kids of all ages (only a couple of minutes walk from hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dependable and friendly service, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebS_MN
Reviews.Content: We chose the Radisson name, and were not disappointed. Got an excellent long weekend rate. Larger rooms than most European hotels, only complaint was an older (and not so comfortable) mattress. Excellent service from all staff. The bar is particularly charming (the rest of decor is modern-vanilla) and is a great place to have everything from coffee in morning to supper to nightcap in evening. Only used restaurant for included-breakfast, which as very good with lots of choice and good quality food. Dinner menu looked good, but because the location was so good we went to other places for dinner. Quiet street, but in the middle of the city - we were in walking distance to everything we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as always”
Reviews.Author: Ruehl925
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson SAS Amsterdam a few times now, and it is as good as ever. Staff are friendly, rooms are superclean, modern, with everything you need. Very quiet area, but just minutes to walk from everything in Amsterdam. In my opinion its the best location there is. Walking distance to Centraal Station, red light district, the Dam, Rijksmuseum, Leideplein...you name it...I never use the tram or taxi at all....and you can rent a scooter if you want at the conciergedesk. The hotel offers free wireless wich is great. They have some computers in the reception are aswell, but they are not cheap, but lots of internetcafes in Amsterdam. Breakfast is one of the highlights of the stay...they have everything! Fresh orange juice, and omelets made in the restaurant is always good! This is my 5th or 6th time at this Hotel and I will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JaneKetlin
Reviews.Content: Interesting building, great location, very close of most attractions and also of the train station. Trie to get a rate with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful and central location”
Reviews.Author: created77
Reviews.Content: THe Radisson Blu Hotel in Amsterdam is an excellent hotel in central Amsterdam. A short cab ride from the train connection to AMS airport *or* a 41-Euro cab ride direct to Schipohl. Our room, #207, was very spacious and clean. Staff at desk was exceptional and ordered a taxi very early for us to the airport. I cannot comment on the restaurant or bars, but room service was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel for either business or leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happylady2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year for a weekend break, and thought the hotel was excellent. This year, we came back with friends who hadn't been to Amsterdam before, so on our recommendation, we stayed here again. We were not disappointed this time either. We arrived a few hours before the check-in time, but as I had previously emailed the hotel, telling them of our early arrival time, they had the rooms ready for us which was great. Check-in was quick and efficient and they gave us a map of Amsterdam which we used an awful lot. It really is in a fantastic location - close to the city centre, but far enough away down a side road, so it's quiet. Not only were both rooms ready, but we were both upgraded to Business Rooms. Ours was Room 630 - top floor, with robes/slippers/coffee machine/big bed and nice roof top view. We didn't have any drinks at the hotel as it was very expensive (hotel bars usually are.) It's a shame, because if they had reduced their prices we would have had a drink there each evening. A gin & tonic was about 11 euro - which was way too expensive. We went to Tara, an Irish pub close by, where the drinks were far more reasonable, although still pricier than the UK due to the euro being so poor. Check-out was also quick and easy, and they kept our luggage for us for the day, as our flight wasn't until the evening. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a city break in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “dreamy hotel in a dreamy city”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide_Frankfurt
Reviews.Content: Last may I spent 5 days in Amsterdam.Tripadvisor helped me to book this hotel.and I did n't regret it!Excellent hotel,a really five star one.The rooms perfect,the staff helpful and polite. The breakfast full of everything!It is a bit expensive but it worths it.The hotel is close to everything so helped us a lot for the sightseeing. The city is out of tales.I adored Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MinstrelBoy
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the internet and checked with Trip Advisor. In a word - PERFECT! Clean, good service, excellent breakfasy included, central location, helpful staff - what more could you want. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel within walking distance of all sights”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterMaria
Reviews.Content: If you're travelling into the city from Schiphol Airport get the train. Approx15-20 minutes and you're there! The station is in the same building as the airport and is so easy to use. Get your ticket at the machine using cash or your cards. (Don't join the queue at the luggage carousel, there are plenty to use as you leave the airport section and go into the station area.) Clean, efficient, two tiered trains run regularly and it only cost 8.10 euros for the two of us. Taxis or trams can take you from just outside the station into the town. We payed 10 euros in our taxi which seemed expensive, but it was easier. We stayed at this hotel for four nights and had a lovely stay. Staff are very efficient, helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel itself is lovely. We paid extra and got the Executive upgrade. Lovely room overlooking the canal and a little bridge. Nice size room. Excellent coffee machine for my husband, and a kettle delivered promptly for me as I hate coffee and need my daily cup of tea! Book the breakfast if you can. Help yourself. Lots of choices. Fresh fruit, yoghurts, cheese, cold meats, fish, full english breakfast and a selection of pastries, croissants, bread and crackers! Self service, with assistance if you need it. Room was comfortable with a view of the canal and a small bridge and clock tower. Buy an I Amsterdam card if you plan to do the museums and galleries. It also includes a boat ride with one of two tour companies. We used it lots and more than recuperated the initial outlay. You also get a tram card included, which lasts for the same length of time as the pass. (Time starts from the first time you use each pass, and lasts for 24, 48 or 72 hours, depending on which one you buy. e.g. The tram starts after you first swipe it, not when you start using the museum pass, and vise versa.) Lots of lovely walks. Beautiful city. Excellent choice of restaurants. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: bonnchronicles
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is in a small and quiet Street, very central. For sightseeing it is perfect: you can each almost everything just by walking. I was surprised, that the service was not so friendly as in Le Meridian I visited before. No smile at all, but very professional. I can say the reception was quiet clinical. Not a warm welcome I awaited. Radisson doesn't have its own parking garage, you have to pay the same as in all parkhouses, if you are coming with car. The room had an amazing king size bed, like in US, a wonderful Senseo coffee machine and some delicious tee. I also liked the lime collection in the bath. The Internet was fast enough, and stable. Breakfast is extra, but we didn't booked it - instead we wanted to visit a small coffee in the town. It has a perfect location for sightseeing, the room is very nice. For 150 euro / night I'd like to see some smile on the faces and a warm welcome and goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wimbledonblond
Reviews.Content: First time in this hotel but for sure not the last! Great rooms, great service and I LOVED the location! Since you are right in the centre, there is never need for a taxi or getting on the tram but we just walked to all the main attractions. The room was not huge for my standards but hey, thatÂ´s Europe! Very friendly and helpfull staff and breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_girl_Durham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location - everything is in walking distance. The lobby is open and airey. Our room was in a second building accessed by a tunnel under the road. The room was a good size, very clean and nicely appointed. The great thing about the location was that it was easy to get back to the hotel for a quick change for going out in the evening. Some nice restaurants in walking distance from the hotel - and I would recommend the Mappa which was Italian style. A nearby Irish Bar (The Tara) served a great breakfast as it wasnn't included in our package - check when you book as it's very expensive in the hotel at 25 euros per person. I would definitely stay here again - but check that breakfast was included in the package.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Epsomsalts
Reviews.Content: I stay in quite a few Radisson hotels when travelling on business but donâ€™t use them very often when on holiday. We wanted to go to Amsterdam for a long weekend, so thought that we would try the Radisson in the centre of Amsterdam, as it is a great location. We arranged for a club room with an adjoining standard room for our daughter, at a great weekend rate. Although the hotel is getting a little dated the quality of everything was excellent and all the staff very helpful and professional. The location was perfect, as you are only a short walk from everything but as you are not on a major road or square it was very quite at night, which was good as Amsterdam can be party town. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet hotel, with good quality and value for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: compassjohn
Reviews.Content: Free wireless and a large, very comfortable room in a building that is largely modern. The only negative is that there was no real local feel except for the bar and restaurant which were from older buildings that the hotel built around. Great staff. Very helpful. Close to several cafes and restaurants that were enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: finskiLohja
Reviews.Content: great ,big busines room ,good service , good location

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel but aircon was useless in late June, hate to think what it's be like during the height of summer”
Reviews.Author: Dapprman
Reviews.Content: If I'd stayed at this hotel during the autumn or winter, then I'd suspect I'd score it 4 or 5 stars, but there was a serious issue with the hotel during my 11 night stay there at the end of June, start of July 2009. First the good parts. * The hotel is in a superb location. Most things are easy walking distance and the * Nieumrkt metro station is under 5 minutes walk away. * Rooms are well appointed, cleaned well, and regularly checked (as I found out when I was back early one day). * There is free wireless internet. * There was space in the mini-fridge for personal stuff (it's the sort of fridge where you are auto-charged when an item is removed). * Sumptuous breakfast * In room electronic safes are large Now the downside * No automated alarm calls - reception call one was 10 minutes late * Mini-fridge was not that cold and the personal space was really small * Water saving shower was near useless And the killer for the summer * Aircon, even on full blast, is absolutely useless. Myself and my colleagues all complained about the same issue, so it was not just my room. So would I stay here again ? Outside of summer, definitely. During summer - unless they sort the aircon out, or I bring my own fan along, I will probably look on the company list for an alternate near by.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CPHworldtravellers
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent when you are in Amsterdam as a tourist. Everything is within walking distance. It is in a very quiet street but walking 10 minutes will take you to many areas for dining, night life, shopping or whatever you want to do in Amsterdam. Breakfast is as always for Radisson Blu (formerly Radisson SAS) hotels good. Service at the breakfast and throughout the hotel is good. The only thing not up to standard is the decor of the rooms. It is so 80's that a renovation would be welcome. Would however stay here again due to the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Gautamk
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Amsterdam, the Radisson Blu Hotel offers a unique opportunity to experience a modern metropolis that has not lost its historical ambience. I stayed there for one week for a training program and found it to be a wonderful place. The hotel is quite close to city's main attractions like the shopping district.I stayed in business class room which was surprisingly warm and nicely decorated.We've had a training program in the hotel itself which was flawlessly organised. I could not discover the pool and other amenities, but I would say it's a great place to stay in Amsterdam, ofcourse if you are going on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimRudd
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location. Friendly and helpful staff. Good sized comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: eggi
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient staff. The standard king room was definitely on the small side and the TV was a tiny crt... Decor is standard business hotel-like: no frills. The breakfast buffet was extremely well-assorted. Mmmmmm! Free Wi-Fi. Not the fastest out there, but it was there (and it was free!). Location is great for the average tourist. Everything is within walking distance. Would definitely consider staying there again. *Beware of the airport shuttle service the hotel offers. After the shuttle arrived almost 30 minutes to late (which is never a pleasant feeling when you are on your way to the airport), the driver delivered the most terrifying drive I have ever experienced. The fact that we did not kill anyone on the way is an absolute miracle. However, the company is not affiliated with the hotel as such, and so does not reflect my overall experience of the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location in the heart of where you want to be!”
Reviews.Author: rolandws
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a May 2009 business trip to Amsterdam. I took a train from the airport to the main train station in central Amsterdam. From there it was a 5 minute cab ride to the hotel. For those who haven't visited Amsterdam - it is a very walkable/bike-able city. If your visit will be mostly to the city center, don't even consider renting a car. The traffic and congestion are horrific. Anyway, the Radisson in downtown Amsterdam is in a very nice part of town, an easy walk to scores of restaurants, pubs, museums, the famed 'red light district', and loads of other tourist destinations. The hotel is in good shape with updated looks, nice furnishings, very helpful staff, and rooms with plenty of space. My room package included breakfast which offered an extensive menu. There is also free wifi throughout the hotel. I will happily stay at this hotel again the next time I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: 1stCityAngel
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, great room with a character, superb location. We (a gay couple) have enjoyed our stay and would like to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place for my short stay”
Reviews.Author: cazoohc
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night but it was a plesant stay. The staff were helpful and friendly, there was a wide variety of food available for breakfast and the room was immaculate! No faults really!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Best New Year!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaxM
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in this hotel for New Year 2008, arrived 30th and departed 5th Jan. This hotel is fantastic, cannot fault it one bit! We arrived and were upgraded to business class for free, lovely start to the holiday! Rooms are lovely, tea coffee making facilities, bathrobe and slippers, big bath and shower with complimentary soap, bath salts, moisturiser etc. Rooms cleaned every day. Amsterdam itself is the most amazing city i have ever been to. Beatiful buildings and scenery. We were at an event for New Year so didnt see the party going on in Dam Square but on TV it looked fantastic! The hotel is on a quiet side street, no outer noise heard at all when i was there and we were facing the road on the outside. A 5-10 min walk to the nearest shop, anywhere in Amsterdam you will walk a fair bit to get to where you want to go. Amstel about 15 min walk. PLEASE visit the Ice Bar in Amstel, you go in to the Hot room and order a drink and buy a ticket for the Ice Bar- while you enjoy ur drink u wait for your hostess to take you to the cold room- only allowed in for half an hour as it is -8 degrees! Amazing experience... well worth 10euro. All in all a fab time and hotel fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: james_carly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for a birthday weekend in Amsterdam. Like other Radisson's in Europe it's a quality hotel with all the 5 star trimmings - gym, room service etc. The room was slightly dark because it faced inward - but apart from that it was a lovely place to stay in a great location right near the red light district. Solid choice for anyone visiting Amsterdam. Watch out for the spa/sauna places in Amsterdam - lots of nudity! I bought a massage and spa afternoon for us and spent the afternoon trying to avoid naked men! But after the initial shock it was a great relaxing spa.

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: happytreks
Reviews.Content: just back from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Hotel is situated in quiet street less than 10 min walk from dam square. We stayed in room 155 with canal view, good room facilities and comfortable bed. The hotel is on both sides of the street but access to our room was only from the main building via an understreet walkway. May i suggest to radisson that a swipe card entry to the building would be easier. We didn't eat in the restaurant but did have bar food and breakfast, both of a high standard. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: blueiffy
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel in excellent location.. have been to few in town but this one seemed to be nicest of all. my partner and i were not disappointed. we only stayed there for few days, haven't used the hotel restaurant so cannot comment on quality of the food.. am sure next time am in town, i will give this hotel another go.

Reviews.Title: “Good but nothing to remember”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for work and had a presentation. The hotel is located on both sides of the street and my room was on the side that the entrance was. The hotel is a mix. The corridors, my room and the breakfast area were dated but clean and functional. The business rooms were new and nice. The location was good and very close to city centre. It is a kind of hotel that you stay and have nothing to complain but you won't remember anything about it when the time goes by. The breakfast was great though. A lot of fresh selection and healthy but delicious choices. I think the worst part was the dated corridors and rooms and how weird the rooms were located (around an internal court). The service was good. It has a good gym.

Reviews.Title: “Chain hotel - a very nice surprise for a city break weekend.”
Reviews.Author: sammyjo_77
Reviews.Content: We looked at all the canalside hotels before going to Amsterdam but they proved to be very expensive. Found this one on Trip Advisor. Very central but quiet, just around the corner from lots of bars and restaurants but in a quiet street. Canals just around the corner, just no view. Modern hotel built around an old 'vicarage' which is now the bar. Rooms big and clean and comfortable, excellent breakfast and very helpful staff. Very enjoyable stay in for a leisure break and didn't feel that we missed out by not being actually on a canal. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Do I look like overgenerous? Trust me, normally, I'm not!”
Reviews.Author: alexeikarp
Reviews.Content: I have been to Radisson SAS hotels on several occasions before. Some experiences have been better that others. This one, to my actual critical and skeptical surprise, turned out to be very very positive. The extremely central location of the hotel is pleasant. Furthermore, I got a free upgrade to a canal view room due to availabilty. The concierge and reception have been amazingly helpfull in my overly pompous requests. All in all, amazingly good value. And even if you're ready to pay as much as you can, this hotel can offer you a very pleasant stay in Amsterdam. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel, good rooms, will def be back”
Reviews.Author: DublinAnne14
Reviews.Content: Great location for a hotel, could walk everywhere and yet wasn't noisy . didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on food but room was clean, small but we still had more than enough space. If I was back in amsterdam would definately book this hotel again - good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: maggis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson SAS Hotel Amsterdam in February 2009. The hotel has a good location right in the city centre. The breakfast was very good with freshly squeezed orange juice and smoothies. The rooms are typical for Radisson SAS and are starting to get a bit worn, but the service and location more than makes up for it. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended but starting to need a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: djl1960
Reviews.Content: An ideal location for a stay in Amsterdam- centrally located yet on a quiet side street. I have stayed here a few times but now feel the hotel is starting to look slightly dated, For example, the TV was old and other hotels have more up to date in room entertainment with regard to internet access and on demand films. A refurbishment is probably required to keep the hotel up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good and very businesslike”
Reviews.Author: RiotPelaaja
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, with many spots a walking distance including the main railway station, good bars and of course, the Red Light district. The hotel looks old from the outside, but on the inside it's very modern with interesting architecture. Extremely pricey though, with 400 euros per night not even including breakfast. The latter was excellent though, with a much wider selection of sausages and bread than usual, so the breakfast was excellent as was the coffee. The hotel's bar is quite good for a hotel bar and the service was impeccable. As a nice touch, you can see Schipol airport's schedule on two monitors in the lobby. The rooms are quite spacious with excellent beds and some closet space, but the bathrooms while all amrble are very clinical and basic, though spacey. The wifi is free and the connection seemed to work quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: rail_traveller00
Reviews.Content: Very good location downtown. From there you can easily reach by puublic transport the RAI Congress and Exhibition Center without having to stay in the suburbs. Upon check-in, you are offered an upgrade to a business-class room for a light surcharge. Rooms are large, well-equipped with free boardband access, a Nespresso coffee machine, etc. etc. Nice breakfast buffet ( included in the business-class rooms) but service could be improved; you wait too much for a simple cp of coffee. For those looking for this type of attraction, very close also to the Red Light District and the pedestrian zone !!

Reviews.Title: “Great ;location”
Reviews.Author: ldcbl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the center of the city. We could walk everywhere. it is 5 minutes to Dam Square, ten minutes to the Rembrandtplein, and maybe 15 minutes- walking briskly to the Leidensplein. The breakfast buffet was great- everything from eggs to order, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereals, hardboiled eggs,cheese and meats, but pretty expensive at 25E per person. We were able to get an upgrade to the business rooms where breakfast is included but if we didn't have that I might have looked for a small cafe. Get a good map and you can walk everywhere. The rooms were nice but Radisson please get some new hair dryers in the rooms. They have the old style hairdryer mounted on the wall. It was awful. The tube kept falling out and it looked like it was from the 70's. Housekeeping was ok, but sometimes the glasses were not changed. The bathtub was very nice and deep though. I went to Lush and got some bath bombs. Taking a bath after walking all day is great. I also liked that the windows opened. You really want a room that looks out on the street not on the interior lobby. If you can go to Boom Chicago and take the Saint Nicholas Boat club tour. it is on a small boat and so much nicer than the large tour boats. very unique. You sign up inside Boom Chicago. On the walk to Leidensplein there are several Italian Restaurants .We had some great Pizza at Antonios. The rijsttafel at Indurpura in the Rembrandtplein was very good. We tried a Brazilian steak house near Indurpura but it was only ok. Definitely get tickets on line to go to the Anne Frank House. You get to go in a separate entrance, and go early by the afternoon the lines are around the block. The area around the museum is a nice walk, but if you go on Sunday morning, as we did, none of the shops are open in the Jordaan. We plan to come back. The city is beautiful and the hotel is almost perfect. We had everything we needed except a decent hairdryer- and that is a small complaint. We didn't eat at the Hotel except for breakfast because there were so many restaurants near the hotel. Watch out for the bikes though. We had to keep our eyes open. The Dutch hate it when you step out in front of them- and who can blame them!

Reviews.Title: “Good all round.”
Reviews.Author: jobagg
Reviews.Content: We had an eight day stay. No thing too much for them. Ask and it will be done. Used the restaurant three times, and the bar every night. Both excellent and would suggest you take advice from the bar staff where to go for entertainment and to eat. Rooms are very comfortable. There are cheaper places but if you want a bit of indulgence you will go far to find better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdmj1968
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Radisson SAS Amsterdam and this was my 5th time staying there. The room iwas adequate enough, we had 2 beds, the hotel is now 100% smoke free which I didn't like. I had an opening window and me and many others just smoked out the window. Beds comfortable and the beds have just comforters on them, no sheet other than the one covering the mattress we asked them 2 bring 2 sheets each which they did within minutes. good service. Dont touch the minibar otherwise you will be charged in 2 seconds. literally. Bathroom was small and the shower had no PRESSURE. It was the worst shower I have encountered in a hotel in a while. Location is excellent- short walk form virtually everyhting. Clean rooms Ok air-con. breakfast is expensive at 25 euros per person. thats almost $40.00 US. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very different rooms are on offer.”
Reviews.Author: Quality-men
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a weekend in this property, we normally stay in the Amrath Palace, but we decided on a change. The location is excellent 15mins walk from Central station, do not take a cab, as you will be told that there is a one way system & get charged 25 Euros! 5 mins Rembrandt, 5 mins red light ,10 mins from the shopping streets & 15 mins from the Rijks Musem. Overall the Hotel is very clean, pretty good staff, with excellent Concierge (Tobar) and a good Breakfast. Its the usual "Super Buffet" that Radisson advertises & although the breakfast area is slightly cramped all the great products are on offer, including a fresh orange juicer in the corner. My only word of warning is the very diverse nature of the bedrooms.The Hotel is made up of a covered Atrium between 2 streets, 3 of the original buildings have been kept & this 1980's steel glass structure has been added. That is the Reception area, Restaurants & Bars. Across the street is another block of bedrooms, which you access from an underground walkway. I did not get a chance to view these bedrooms but they did look spacious from the outside. You may get an internal bedroom looking into the Atrium, you will either love it or hate it. So, be mindful of your bedroom on checkin or phone the Hotel in advance. Altogether we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: russky72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night on a short weekend stay. Hotel is modern and clean, with the added benefit of being in a good location. It's around 10 minutes walk from the Train Station and within 5 minutes of any local place of interest. You are central without being in 'thick of it'. Would recommend it to anyone. Amsterdam surprised me, as my perception was completly changed when I visted this city. It seems to have shed the image of a place that only Stag parties visit. It has a very cosmopolitan feel with many cafe/bars with outside seating area's and a good choice of resturants, in fact I was amazed at the number of resturants there are in Amsterdam!! If you are thinking of staying here, I would book it direct on their website. I was quoted a variaty of different prices for the same night/room, with as much as Â£60 difference!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly excellent!”
Reviews.Author: offeringmyopinion
Reviews.Content: A great spot, away from the crowd but close enough to walk to / from. Staff friendly, room very clean, dinner in the restaurant was excellent, bar had a lovely ambience. Perhaps all reflective in the price that you pay to stay! Only gripe was our room was on the second floor facing into the atrium reception, after a night out in Amsterdam I didn`t appreciate being woken by a group sitting in this area chatting extremely loudly at a little after 5am!! The noise really does carry so perhaps would recommend you request a room NOT overlooking the atrium reception if you fancy a lie in!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice - great location”
Reviews.Author: ebonvan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days at the SAS Radisson in Holland in mid August of 2008 and it was very nice. Clean, well appointed and terrific location. Not in the typical hotel every 5 feet area. Close to restaurants, shopping, Red Light District, etc. Very easy to get lost there, so take a map. The staff were very helpful, check in was a breeze. We had a superior room, but don't expect it to be big - it's small by North American standards. I wonder what the standard room looked like. It had a small TV ( but seriously, folks, there was 1 channel with English with reruns of Law and Order). Everything was very clean but the decor was pretty standard. It did feature a cool module that held the TV (not flatscreen if you care), minibar, wine glasses, and an iron and ironing board. The bed was quite comfortable. We had an interior room, which meant that our window opened up into the lobby of the hotel. That meant no fresh air. Ewww. Also, if you want to "talk loudly", you might want to rethink that and close the window unless you want the staff to hear you. Did not eat at the restaurant, so I have no idea about that. Nor did we have room service. Would I stay there again? Not in that room, but across the street there were other rooms that I didn't even realize was part of the hotel. I would hesitate to spend tons of money just for a room that you don't spend much time in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Perihelion
Reviews.Content: Radisson SAS enjoys a great location, within easy walking distance of the Central Train Station and the famous Red Light District. It is also 5 minutes stroll from the nearest tram stop which is very convenient to see the main touristic attractions. The hotel, although spotlessly clean and pleasantly decorated, had a somewhat old-fashioned air, especially the bathrooms. The supposedly queen bed turned out to be two single beds attached. Apart from those, the rooms (we stayed in a de-luxe) were spacious enough and had all necessary amenities. As with most of the hotels on offer in Amsterdam, the breakfast was not included in the room rate and was a little expensive at 24.5E. Nevertheless it was of a high quality with a good variety of hot and cold choices on offer. One minor irritation occured when we returned to our table to find our half-eaten food and half-drunk coffee had been cleared away in the very short time we were away to fetch our second courses. A little absent-mindedness of the staff but that was recovered quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Suuzy_q
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel from the 27th August to the 31st. The Hotel is top class. The rooms were ample sized with high ceilings. The room had free wireless connection which would have been great had I taken my laptop. The bed was incredibly comfy and the linen was crisp and fresh. There was a mini bar in the room but we found the prices a litte pricey. Watch taking anything out of the mini bar as you won't get it back in and you will automatically be charged. Overall we had a fab time and would definately recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the unusual!”
Reviews.Author: KipperRhonddaWales27
Reviews.Content: My family of 2 adults and 2 children stayed here and we were very impressed! This hotel is unusual as the window of the room opens in to the glass atrium of the reception area instead of outside. This did make the room slightly dark and needed lights on all the time. It is of a high standard of cleanliness and the rooms are well equipped. We stayed in an executive room for 4 people. The main bed was very large and comfortable, the sofa was a pull out bed for children. If children stay and use this bed make it clear when arriving what extra charges there are for this - we were charged 50 euros extra per night that we didnt realise. The manager did waver this charge after we explained that it did not state this in the beginning. The breakfast is of a high standard of cooked foods, fruits, pastries, cold meats , cheeses, cereals, something for everyone and the staff were fantastic there especially with children. Its a beautiful hotel in a good location it is away from the crowds of Dam Square but it is in walking distance of everywhere. We took a taxi from Central Station when we arrived and it cost 24 euros but you can easily walk it!! For its uniqueness and its high standard in everything I would definately stay there again - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: We_L0ve_t0_Travel2
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out everything was just wonderful. We arrived around 10 am on Friday morning and were delighted to be able to check right in and go to our room, freshen up and head into town to see the sights. The front desk was very helpful answering all our questions and provided a great map of the city. You can't ask for a better location. Everything is within walking distance and still a quiet location once you retire in the evening. We had a business room which was quite large compared to other European standards. We will certainly stay there again on our next trip to Amsterdam. It may be a little pricey (conversion from Euro to USD) but well worth it in my opinion knowing you have a clean room, clean bathroom and a bar right downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location - Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BrickwallDad
Reviews.Content: We are actually still at the hotel as we write this review (we leave in the morning). We were totally surprised by the quality of the property considering its central location in the old section of amsterdam. We expected a very small room in a fair building. However, the building is very modern (to American standards), the lobby large & open (as per photos on this site), multiple reception staff (very helpful). We are a family of 5 and took 2 rooms (a double and triple). We were upgraded for our double to a business class room (quite large with nice add ons like cappucino maker, robes, slippers, etc.), the triple was even larger (an executive room) with the same add ons). The kids were so happy (a bigger room than mom & dad!). The location could not be better. Totally central to everything. We could walk to every location and site we wanted (and we did). The street is toally quiet (except for occasional cars and motor bikes, but the windows were sealed to minimze those sounds even on floor 2). The only complaint was the price of the breakfast - we took a pass on that and just hit the local pastry shops for coffee and pastry in the AM's. A must do is a bike tour of the city. We did the 10AM tour with orange bikes. Great time, great way to see the city and get some excercise as well. We selected places to eat based on location (quiet with nice views) as we traveled about the city. No dissapointments here. There are so many great little places, just stay away from the most crowded tourist trap areas if you can. Best sites: Ann Frank's house, Van Gough, canal boat tour (do first thing to get your bearings), walk the Jordan and "9 streets), of course a walk in the Red Light - don't be shy! The Portugese Jewish Synagouge. Finally the various squares and the big central park (lovely). This was our second trip here in 3 years, but first with the kids (18, 15, and 13), they loved it! It is part of a 3 city tour (London, Amsterdam, and Paris). See our review of London K+K George hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “TOP NOTCH”
Reviews.Author: A140
Reviews.Content: Stay here on average 3 times a year it's great. Perfect location, coffee shop across the road, shopping nearby, excellant standards and veryt helpful staff. Pricey for parking but that's Amsterdam! I have stayed here with my young child also and it's very child friendly, I was here for a week with her and had a great time. Very clean and helpfull as I had to call a doctor for my husband while there and he was treated in the room and the hotel sent out a taxi to collect his prescription for us so I didn't have to drag the baby around to the chemist ( I actually knew where it was but the average tourist wouldn't ) My partner is half Dutch so we are well travelled in Holland and this is one of the best value for ***** stars Hotel , with a great location and no sleeze around you....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: leehal
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Expedia and think the price was quite heavily discounted, 5 nights in a 5 star hotel for 500 GBP. Hotel is in a nice quiet street a few hundred yards from the red light district - everything is within easy access. We are staying on a room only basis, charge for breakfast in your room is a whopping 30 euro, not sure how much it is in the restaurant but it will be expensive. We have had room service, 2 x burger and chips and a bottle of wine for 60 euro - not a bad price, excellent quality. We are staying in the main block of the hotel, room is large and has everything you need - TV, safe, mini bar (mega expensive), tea/coffee making facilities, free wi-fi, trouser press, desk, arm chair etc Room and bathroom are really clean - read some negative comments relating to the toiletries provided but they seem fine to us. Bed is comfortable and the linen is really good quality. Hotel staff are very friendly and attentive, they have helped me obtain a rollator/wheeled walker and seem very knowledgeable about all things relating to Amsterdam. Taxis ordered by the hotel are great, so far we have had a nice big BMW and a Mercedes, nice to travel in luxury - fares are reasonable too. We even had a phone call from the manager asking our opinion on the hotel with regards to cleanliness, concierge, movies, food etc Really cannot fault the hotel in any way, we are used to staying in top end hotels in the USA such as Sofitel, Loews etc and this is on a par with them.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: jthejock
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for our wedding anniversary in May. After getting off the train in Central station it took a little while to get our bearings, but soon found our way around and found the hotel. Amsterdam hotels are expensive, but the Radisson is very nice. One comment would be that the room (superior) was a bit on the small side with about 5 steps up from the bathroom to the bed. All in all I would recommend as a very central base for touring this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Free Internet.”
Reviews.Author: RAWBaltimore_MD
Reviews.Content: Visited for a 2 day business meeting that flanked the April 30 Queens Day celebration. For those unaware, as I was, Queens Day is like Mardi Gras. An all-day all-night street party and flea-market. The location of the hotel is perfect for this period. It is near the large parties on the Dam and Rembrandt Plaza, but on a quiet street away from the noise. The hotel deserves fulsome praise for its architecture. It is a fully modern atrium lobby hotel built into the facade of some of the traditional Dutch Gothic houses. One of the houses is actually converted into the lounge area. For those who travel for business to Europe, free internet access is a big plus and it is offered here. The rooms are fully modern and comfortable for business travel. Make sure that breakfast is included in the daily rate because the charge is 20 Euro for the buffet if you want to eat in the restaurant. I would definitely return here.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Top Notch !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: Booked here as a suprize for my Fiances 21st Birthday. (I had told him id booked a 2*) We arrived 4 hours early and they offered to let us check in immeadiatley. They wished my Fiance congratulations on celebrating his birthday and made us feel very special. To top it all they up graded us to a Business class room!!! We were very impressed!!! We then went to our room which was situated in the old part of the Radisson accross the road, however there is no reason to have to cross the road you go under the road my a lift system, the concourse is beautifully presented, light and airy and made quite an impression on me!! On entering our room we were suprized how big the room was, also very delighted, it was furnished with Georgian furniture with a king size bed. There was a mini bar stuffed with goodies. Also a coffetiere. The bathroom was lovely and supplied all your toiletries. Also a hairdryer!!! Plenty of bag and wardrobe space. We ordered room service which was quick and delicious and at very reasonable prices. I would reccomend The Radisson Amsterdam to anyone who wants 5* luxury right in the heart of Amsterdam.5mins from all the wierd and wonderful attractions of AMSTERDAM!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson SAS, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: IrishPaddy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in January 2008. We were impressed with the standard of cleanliness throughout the premises and the general decor. The integration of old historical buildings into the property is also to be commended. However, in my opinion, it didn't have the "feel" of a 5-star hotel about it. To me, it felt more like your average, run-of-the-mill 4-star that you get in every European city. With this in mind, the cost of staying there seemed excessive, especially when breakfast would have cost â‚¬25 per person on top of that. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is close enough to the attractions to be within comfortable walking distance, yet far enough away to be peaceful and quiet. We checked in a few hours early, as our flight from Cork had arrived in the early morning. After a minor fuss from the receptionist, we got our room easily enough. A minor irritation was to be charged a city tax on top of our rate on departure, which may well have been the fault of the site where we booked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BayswaterBabe
Reviews.Content: We booked about 5 months earlier but it was worth it because we got a very good deal. I had been looking for hotels in Amsterdam for literally years but had been put off by the expense. The Radisson's prices seemed to be a little cheaper than other 4-5 star hotels in Amsterdam. We stayed over Easter this time. I am not sure but I think we may have been upgraded to a nicer room since the price quoted in our room for price per night was far more expensive than the rate we actually paid when we checked out/on our online booking form. We had also requested a room on a high floor with a good view and we got both. Staff gave us a very warm welcome. The room was lovely, really nicely furnished, big TV with plenty of channels, good storage, nice modern, marble bathroom with good hot powerful shower and lots of nice toiletries. The room was not huge but big enough for us. There were free little chocolate eggs in bowls scattered round the reception area which my boyfriend enjoyed helping himself too. The bar in the lobby area looked nice although we didn't have time to stop there and the lobby looked very impressive with a water feature and two computers offering free internet access. One computer was not working during our stay but there was not a big queue. There is also free wifi in all rooms. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant or have breakfast there (24 Euros seemed a little steep) but there are plenty of small cafes within a minute or two's walk from the hotel which do really nice breakfasts for a fraction of the price. The location is amazing. Right in the centre and just round the corner from the red light district although this is not obvious at all unless you walk from there. It is also far enough from it to not see it at all unless you want to go looking for it or get lost. The area surrounding the hotel is not at all sleazy. There are plenty of amazing pubs within walking distance of the hotel and it is bang in the centre of all the main sites. The hotel was busy but it never felt overrun with tourists and staff were always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was a problem!”
Reviews.Author: liverpool-london
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the snowy Easter weekend and found the hotel to be cosy, comfy and very nice. Only one mistake occured and it was quickly rectified - twin room and we're newly married. I called as we entered the room and the response was "no problem we'll have the room made up for double". I pointed out I wanted a double - not a twin made up as one (how uncomfortable are those...). And in 5 mins we had a new key and a new room. The view was not as good - but you know what - it suited us better than the initial room over looking the courtyard as it was out of the way and quiet on the corridor. So well done Radisson - we'd recommend and use you again. p.s. it's so close to everything too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: waynecom7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Radisson SAS Amsterdam. It's a great hotel, lovely staff and a great location. Located centrally, everything from museums to restaurants are within walking distance. It's away from the red light district so quieter. Drinks and breakfast are expensive (24.95 euros for breakfast) but there are pleny of nearby if you want to go out. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael from Vienna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson SAS Amsterdam for 3 nights over easter 2008. Booked the hotel online via Expedia.de. First of all, the location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of the city, at the edge of famous red light district and at a little canal. We knew the hotel from passing by at several other visits in amsterdam, so I knew it has a huge atrium lobby with rooms facing into the lobby. So I mailed to the hotel, that we would like a non-smoking room with two beds with a window to the street. I assume windows opening to the lobby make the room sticky since you dont get fresh air from the outside. Arriving at the hotel we learned, that they could fulfill all of our wishes and we got a very nice room on 4th floor - 406. Compared to the Marriott where we usually stay rooms are smaller, but still very nice. Bathrooms need some renovation, but still OK, nice amenities and good water pressure. Staff all over the hotel is really nice and helpful. We did not eat at the hotel since its very pricy, bar is very cosy but also exxpensive. Very positive: Hotel has free internet wifi access all over if you bring a laptop and offers free access to the internet in the business center including printing. On departure day we asked for late checkout and were allowed to check-out at 3 PM. Again, a very nice hotel, PERFECT location, rooms are OK, staff is very helpful and friendly, we would stay there again. One additional tipp: If you are looking for great, local food. For 9 years now we have dinner at our favourite restaurant in Amsterdam. Very close to the Radisson in a little street, Berenstraat 12- Family owned, very cosy atmosphere, great food. Also a lot of locals eat there, thats always a good sign for us. Make sure you reserve in advance, since its quite small, they get full every night. http://www.zwaantje.demon.nl/

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: HandP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson SAS hotel in the Centre of Amsterdam for quick weekend break at the end of Feb 2008. The hotel is of reasonable quality with an impressive reception area. The corridors where the rooms are remind me of 1960s school corridors. The room was very comfortable however and of a good size. The bed was also comfy. Everything was clean and the shower was good. The hotel is in a quiet area and only a 15 min walk from the main shopping/red light district and Centraal Station. i would def stay here rather than right in the thick of it. The hotel bar was quite nice but expensive (a glass of wine/fizz is tiny!) Overall it was a pleasant place to stay but was quite expensive. It was in a great location though and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drschrebling
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel with a fantastic location, but be aware that it is very corporate in terms of vibe and set-up. However, if you are looking for a reliable, clean, functional hotel that is a great launch pad for the main attractions in Amsterdam, then this is the one for you. It is only 5 mins from Dam Square, Main Shopping, Red-Light District, loads of restaurants and 10 mins walk from the main musuems (Anne Frank, Van Gogh) and main train station. We really enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam, spent very little time at the hotel, but were glad we'd booked a nice relaxing and professional hotel for our stay One tip - make sure you have a quick visit to the Rusland Coffee Shop opposite the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s0kutatsu
Reviews.Content: Located in the centre of Amsterdam, just three blocks from busy Dam Square. The Stopera Theatre and the flower market are within two blocks. It's one kilometre to Amsterdam Centraal train station... Clean, Cozy...and very friendly staff. Enjoy my stay!!

Reviews.Title: “no way 5*”
Reviews.Author: eacus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no way a 5*. I've stayed in a number of Radissons in the past and this was by far inferior. The commual areas are really dated and the rooms small. The first one we were shown to stank of smoke. They tried to say they would send someone to spray some air freshener but after a long conversation i managed to convince them to move us. Trying to get a later check out was equally as hard. On a positive not the location was good and we could walk everywhere we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: jihyun
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must say it was the worst SAS I have been so far. Why? Bad smell (like after someone used the bathroom) throughout the hotel and specially in the rooms drove me up the wall. Secondly, the mattresses in the standard room I stayed was so old that it was like sleeping in an hammock. Pillows had little lumps telling its long history. Thirdly, although location-wise, its centrally located, as women travelers the streets leading to the hotel were pretty dimly lit although quite. But on the good side was the free internet access I had in the rooms. Hope other travelers will be aware of these problems before they book as raving reviews of this hotel by others made me choose and regret.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: colinb3469
Reviews.Content: We arrived just after 11 in the morning and they found us a room straight away - they also remembered it was my wife's birthday on the day we arrived and reception and the concierge wished her congratulations as we arrived (as did Passport control as they checked her passport - can't imagine UK PC doing that!). The room was excellent, comfortable, firmish bed (good for the back after a hard day's walking). Plenty of space and a nice, if not luxurious ensuite bathroom. The hotel is located right in the centre of the city, within 5-10 minutes walk of most major sights. We also benefitted from the discount for staying 3 nights, so a 5-star hotel for a lower price. Would highly recommend this hotel for a business or leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does what is says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: dogtordolittle
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in central but quiet location. Service friendly and efficient. We were there on a quiet weekend and were upgraded to a better room. Have stayed twice now once on business but went back for a weekend break as it was such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean hotel in city center”
Reviews.Author: Bul
Reviews.Content: It happened to us quite rarely, that we could stay for a reasonable price in a nice hotel, in a metropol city of europe. We stayed here for 3 nights, and liked it very much. Very nicely decorated room, with a lot of space, friendly reception and right in the city center. The only surprise was the very expensive restaurant and the breakfast(24 Euro). After first day, we discovered cafes outside, which offered the same breakfast for halve of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Bars, Clubs, Times, were to go... etc..”
Reviews.Author: BallyLondon
Reviews.Content: Comparing prices and looking for the best deal can be frustrationg as we all know!!! We booked 3 nights stay through Hotels.com and they do a 25% offer if you stay for more then 3 days or more. Brilliant!!! Just a sneaky bit of advice if you are going for a special occasion then make sure you inform the hotel via email before travelling and then they upgrade for FREE!!!!! Excellent.... Hotel has Bar, restaurant, free internet service, very clean and of high standards. Staff are very friendly and warming. Rooms are very clean and would mark them the best! We went for our 1st Anniversary and decided to be adventureous.. Best to get Tram into Central station which costs about 3.80 euros one way and then walk from the Station to the hotel which is only a 10 min walk. The Hotel is situated by the canal on Rusland and when asking for directions the street is pronounced Rooshland!!! the Red light district area is 2min walk from the hotel along the canal and Rembrandtplein is a 10Min walk in the opposite direction, thats were you will find alot of bars, clubs, restaurants etc.... Be aware the bars are open until 12pm and clubbing does open from about 9pm but does not kick off until 12pm, and are open until 6am. Good restaurant to eat at is the Ghandi if you like Indian a meal for 2 is abt 60 euros, or just grab a pizza for 4 euros. Bars are good in Rembrandplein near the Schipol hotel. and there is a good club there called the VJ. Leidesplein however is futhur out and to get there is around 7.50euros and coming back home anything upto 20 euors. Leidesplein is were all the major clubs are and eating out etcc... Jimmy Woo is a good club, Zebra, Or even better the Paradiso!!! Cab back to the Aiport can be expensive upto 50Euros!!! Enjoy.......

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling!!”
Reviews.Author: twiggy-and-gin
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 of us stayed in the radisson for a weekend recently. The hotel had many different advantages and disadvantages. The hotel itself is beautiful with great, friendly staff who are always willing to help. Beautiful rooms and bathrooms and the lobby is great. The location of the hotel is quite good. It is about 3 minutes from the red light district but far enough to be out of the way if you don't want to go near it. It is also about a five minute walk from Rokin/Damrak. Overall the hotel was quite disappointing. It was simply too expensive for what you got. The rooms were nice, yes, but for half the price you could still get a lovely room in any adjacent hotel. We had a drink at the bar one night and a double southern comfort and lime cost me 15 euros! Unbelieve considering it comes from the same factory as the southern comfort I would pay Â£5 for at home....!! Proceed if you have a fortune to spend...!

Reviews.Title: “My most favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2727
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had just had a crazy 3 days in Paris and a serene couple days in Norwich...then we ended it with a big bang in Amsterdam....WOW! It is my new most favorite place ever! The hotel is in the best part of town...right on the side of the Red Light District and the coffee shops...I'll get to that later. We arrived at the Radisson and the room we had reserved wasn't ready, so they upgraded us to business class! NICE! By European standards, a large room with a large bathroom. But once again, we ran into the half shower door...something I'll never understand. The room was clean and comfortable. They had some normal tv during the downtime we all have to take when traveling abroad. We had a great view from our window. The street wasnâ€™t noisy or busy...which is why is it such a gem...the next block down was were all the action started! Excited, we droped off our bags and go outside to look for a coffee shop and bingo...right there, The Rusland. Wow....what a great place, off the beaten path for most people, but right in front of our hotel for us...lucky us. :) Again, mellow, quaint and nice. We traveled everywhere around Amsterdam but between the best coffee shop and the hotel being there...that was our favorite place to be. As for the food, breakfast was included for us, it was great...cold and hot foods. As for dinner, I had a wonderful tuna steak...the best food I had since I had been on my trip. This is a great hotel and the people who work in it are just as pleasant and kind. When I go back Amsterdam, I will be going to the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown SAS Radisson excellent and well located”
Reviews.Author: tripper-TA
Reviews.Content: All nicely in order : centrally located hotel, perfect room with lots of space, excellent breakfast, efficient and friendly reception staff.Ã¹Would go there again when next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pro's & Con's of Radisson SAS”
Reviews.Author: VacationDude
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short here because frankly, there is not much to say. My wife and I stayed here 3 nights. The hotel overall is okay (3 out of 5 STARs) but since this was my 1st trip to Amsterdam, I don't have a frame of reference to other hotels in the area. I have traveled a bit however so here are my findings. Pro's: nice looking and clean lobby, front desk was helpful with directions the one time we asked, there are 3 "coffee" shops within a stone's throw if that suits you, the room was clean, bed comfy, heated bathroom tile floors, we did not have any foul bathroom odors as others reported, great location on quiet street but very close to the action Con's: check-in guy was not too welcoming and I doubt he cracked a smile once (did he get a tip?), room was small, toiletries were skimpy, shower pressure not very good except handheld but it was mounted too low to shower with without using your hands (you'll see), small slippery shower/tub with no floor grip so be careful, t.v. reception was poor, lobby bar WAY overpriced! You probably won't spend much time in the room and neither did we. It was clean and had a comfy bed so it suited our needs just fine. However, for the equivalent of $290 USD per night this was not a good value and I expected a bit more. Oh well...Amsterdam is on the Euro and the U.S. dollar has taken a beating so be prepared if you are from the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great stay”
Reviews.Author: nancenet70
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay here. I arrived early and was checked in to a room that we weren't happy with, so they made every effort to make our stay perfect. We were moved to a better room (the best available during a very booked weekend), and front desk employee even went with us to view it to make sure we were happy. We were treated like VIP's even though we were paying regular rates. The concierge was helpful all weekend, with maps, directions, calling taxis etc. The hotel itself - our room was in main part, last year we stayed across the street in renovated part and room was MUCH bigger. Not to be petty, but the toiletries were not up to my expectations, I stay in many Radissons so I expected the same shower gel and shampoo you usually get so i didnt bring my own, but it has changed to a lesser more watery quality, unusable. And I missed the Qtips and the makeup remover cotton pads. Also the room service menu was very small, I guess they have limited the menu options? It was much better last year. The 24.50 charge for breakfast is also WAY overpriced. There should be a lower option for folks who would like to spend less. Overall, I will come back to this location yearly, but hopefully next time I will be able to get the room across the street.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprise”
Reviews.Author: gana
Reviews.Content: We have been my girlfriend and I many times to Amsterdam. It was our first experience at the Radisson First of all, the location. if you want to have a fast and nice overview of Amsterdam It cannot be better. The red light district is 5 min walk from the hotel but located in a quiet and lovely area, so you do not have to be afraid to be invaded by the tourists. We get to the Radisson by foot from the train station, it took 10/15mn. The Hotel lobby has a nice looking and seems to be newly renovated Next is the staff. Really professional. Exactly what you expect from such a business hotel. The receptionist gave me a room at the first floor with a view on the street. I asked if I could have another one at an upper floor. She replied that the hotel was fully booked but to please me she will do her best to find me another one for the day after. In fact I kept my room. I was scared to suffer from the street noise. The double glazing and the quiet street where the hotel is located let us fall in a deep sleep. The room is clean, spacious with modern furniture and free wi-fi internet connection. I usually have problems when I travel to get used with the bed. This time I slept like a baby thanks to the firm but comfortable mattress. The icing on the cake is the "rusland", just in front of the hotel (the amateurs will understand). The only criticism I could give is the food quality at the bar, we tried many different snacks, and believe me itâ€™s not worthwhile. By the way let drop the hotel breakfast and run to â€œDE Bakkerswinkelâ€�. It is 5/10mn walking. you will start your day with a smile hooked on your face. Have fun Amsterdam is magic!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: a little South East England village
Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: holmes-on-tour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Arrived on Sunday night by cab from the central station. took about 15mins and 15 euros. Check in and checkout was no problem. Room was excellent (heated floor in the bathroom) and free wi-fi. Cabs ususally took about 10mins to arrive. Location, 5 mins walk from the red light distict, 10mins walk to Dam Square, and shops. Would recommend the steakhouse restaurant Gauchos, it was always busy, so if there is more than 4 of you at 8'oclock, you're best to make a reservation. Apart from breakfast, didn't eat in the hotel. No real reason other than we thought it'd be nice to eat out. I'd use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKDavidS
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in the heart of everything but yet in a quite corner of the city. Very good service on reception, rooms well appointed with beds more than comfortable. If you don't know exactly where you are going I would recommend a taxi for your arrival e.g. from Central Station as it would be otherwise easy to get lost. Once there you will realise you are near to everything Amsterdam has to offer. This is now my first choice of where to stay in Amsterdam. I would recommened you go out for meals however, including breakfast as at the hotel food is a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly As Expected”
Reviews.Author: virginian9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson SAS in September 2007. We arrived at the hotel about 8:00 AM after a flight from Africa. Our room was not yet ready, so the check in person gave us the key to the work-out area so we could freshen up and promised our room would be ready within a couple of hours. Amazing, since check in wasn't supposed to be until 4:00. The hotel graciously stored our luggage (no charge) and with directions from the concierge we headed to the Anne Frank House (and discovered a wonderful pastry shop along the way, just minutes from the hotel (Rene's Croissanterie, Damstraat 20). Got back to the hotel around 1:00. Our room was ready and our bags were already taken there. The room, in the main hotel building (416) was exactly what we had requested (king size bed, non-smoking, as far from the elevator as possible and away from the street). After 11 days on an African safari, this room was like nirvana to us....great bathroom (heated floor, plenty of linens and apple and orange bath gel), good closet space. Nice desk and side-chair. Very good and thorough maid service. Seemed like the ideal business travelers hotel with all the appropriate amenities. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants, but they always seemed full. The concierge helped us with directions to attractions both days we were there and gladly loaned us umbrellas as we were headed out to explore in the rain. No problems in hailing a cab for us or responding to any inquiry. (Cab from the airport was about $50 Euros, so not cheap, but almost impossible to navigate to the hotel otherwise. Train is possible, but a long way from the hotel and the hotel is on a quiet side street (well hidden). I recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. It is centrally located to check out the attractions of Amsterdam and they care about their guests...it comes across in everything the staff says and does, as well as the quality of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to Red Light but not in Red Light District”
Reviews.Author: GT_Marketing
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and Wireless Internet Access is included in the price of the room! Short walk to the Red Light District and the main town center, but on a quiet and upscale street. The only criticism that I have is that they allow smoking in the lobby â€“ there is no way for a non-smoker to by pass the smoke in order to get to your room! They will hold your bags after you check out for free which is a nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, you really can walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: SeattleGoneTravelin
Reviews.Content: The Radisson SAS on Rusland is a wonderful central location from which to walk to all the sights. It is also close to many restaurants. We stayed there for 4 nights. The gift shop, although a bit more pricey than the tourist shops, carries the same or better quality items and will save you from having to carrying gifts around during the day. The hotel was nice to send postcards for us as no charge. However the wireless service is extra. Our room was in the building across the street. The under road walkway lobby is quite nice and our room though smallish, was nicely decorated in an Asian theme and had large windows. It was also very quiet. The room had a pants press, which I loved, as well as an iron and ironing board. The bathroom was marble with heated floors. The bathroom floor is about 2" above the bedroom floor, so watch that you don't stub your toes. On occasion the bathroom had a smelly smell, coming from a floor drain. We reported it, not sure if anything was done, but we bought our own spray and it fixed the problem. Breakfast was a bit high. But the variety was nice and it was a convenient way to start the day. The chef will cook your eggs just as you like. Front desk service was fine. Upon arrival they kept our luggage secure until we could check in (we arrived around 7:30am, and had a room by noon). We were able to pass the time in the comfortable 2nd floor lobby, restaurant and by walking around the city. Although close to the red light district we always felt safe. The exercise facility is quite nice and has a tanning bed (need tokens) and sauna. Good tips - purchase your museum tickets (Van Gogh and Rijks) on line that way you avoid waiting in queue. Also The Rembrant House is a must see. Just a wonderful experience. Also don't miss the Old Church (Oude Kerk) in the Red Light district, it has the most fabulous, decorative pipe organ I've ever seen. You can also walk to a real, thatched windmill.that is 1-2 miles form the old sailing ship the Amsterdam, near the Scheepvart Museum (which is closed for renovation).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Philip6974
Reviews.Content: It's in a quiet street in the centre of Amsterdam, which is good news if you're a light sleeper like myself. The room was a little bit small, but not overly-so. I had a fantastic view of the city, being on the 6th floor, which is the top floor. The restaurant was suprisingly fantastic, I didn't expect that standard from a hotel restaurant - try the lychee caviar! The staff are all very nice and courteous, as are all the Dutch people in general. I recommend this hotel whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Red Light District”
Reviews.Author: 15may06
Reviews.Content: Was here on business. This hotel is located in the middle of the red light district but it was one turn away hence it was quite quiet. It is easy to get around the city centre due to its location. Check-in was straightforward. We were given a room in the current block but as we got into the room, it stank of smoke. Returned to reception and was given another room straight away without any fuss. The room was now located across the road but easily approached via the underpass as part of the hotel. The room itself had furniture that was looked dated but it was clean. The all marble bathroom had a terrible drain smell. That was easily rectified by putting the wastepaper bin over the little drain. The restaurants served good quality food and service was good. Meeting rooms were adequate and well catered for. Overall, comfortable and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: RossyFan
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel, the location is excellent, within easy walking distance of most major attractions. The room was nice, spacious and modern and the service excellent. Our airport shuttle bus, booked via the hotel, failed to show on our last day but once we'd mentioned it to the front office staff a private taxi arrived within minutes and took us directly to the airport. Breakfast was OK although I have to say that despite a sign offering to cook omlettes, there never seem to be anyone around to do it. I also expected freshly cooked pancakes rather than help yourself mini ones which looked as though they'd been hanging around for a while. There is a nice relaxing bar on the ground floor which is a good place for a nightcap. All that apart, here are some recommendations in the area:- Kapitein Zeppos in a little alley off Grimburgwal-great international food. Spanish tapas, Belgium mussels, lamb tagine and terrific fish mousse. The place itself has a lovely old fashioned feel. The waiter service was impeccable and the food faultless. Museum Amstelkring, 40 Oudezijds Voorburgwal. There's a hidden church here in the loft conversion. Fascinating place. Dutch Resistance Museum on Plantage Kerklaan (near the zoo). A gem of a museum which deserves more than the 150 or so customers I was told they receive in an average day. The Brouwhuis, 6-8 Klovenierburgwal-excellent white and blonde beers brewed on the premises. The food looked OK as well although we didn't get round to trying it. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 3 days last week (7th/8th/9th August) and found it really good. The room we had was lovely, wooden floorboards, nice big bed and well laid out. The staff were good and nothing was too much. One tiny point was there didn't seem to be a lot of drawer space if you were staying for more than a few days. I personally thought the lobby was very nice, atruim style with hugh glass windows - lovely and bright. I would definately come back to Amsterdam and stay at this Radisson hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fenlander1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Amsterdam to celebrate Wedding Anniversary. Hotel in a great location to tour the sights, many within walking distance although transport alternatives makes the city more enjoyable to explore. Red Light district just around the corner with associated retaurants and hundreds of coffee shops to choose from, all safe to walk round in daytime, night time just keep to main streets and soak up the atmosphere. Hotel brilliant in all aspects. We had a delux double in the non smoking section facing the street above the entrance, the room was beamed and had plenty of character with good facilities. Beware the well stocked "auto accounting" fridge we used it to store a small bottle of champagne and nearly got charged for having a beer & bottle of wine (soon removed from bill on checkout!) The staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble. The Pastorie bar was good and sevice here from the bar staff was particularly good on each visit we made. The restaurant in the evenings did not seem very busy perhaps the choices elsewhere outside the hotel was to their disatvantage. We did try it one evening and although pricey the food and service was excellent. Breakfast at euro 35 for two seemed a little expensive but the choice and quality made up for cost and really set us up for the day. Would definitely go back to this one again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lou78
Reviews.Content: Got back a few days ago from an excellent stay at the Rad SAS Amsterdam. It does everything is says on the tin, true it does not have the boutique hotel appeal (something we often prefer) but after a few disappointments on recent trips to boutique style hotels we opted for the Radisson.
