We got an amazing rate Â£326.00 twin, deluxe, with breakfast all taxes included. It took a while to find such a good rate but it was well worth the search. Location, location, location in an upmarket street right near the Niewmarket (5 min walk). Canal boat hop on hop off (starts from the Central Station) great value and really good fun. Buy tickets for all the museums in advance on the net (they allow you to queue jump), it is really hard to get tickets that let you jump all the queues when you are there and trust me with so much to see you do not want to waste your time in long queues. Evenings cool at the moment so pack warm. The Bird Thai restaurant was the best we eat in, loads of food, really yummy and fast (everywhere else was very slow) & service with a smile The room was more spacious than we expected with plenty of hanging space. We had an arm chair & coffee table in a bay window, twin beds pushed together (so it felt like a big superking) plenty of lighting options, huge desk & mirror and the standard Radisson grey marble bathroom with shower over bath. We had a great street view directly opposite the lovely Coffee Shop Rusland (one of the best in the area). Air con was effective and very, very quiet. Beds were super comfy and lots of big squashy pillows. Breakfast was amazing, loads of fresh fruit, breads, cereals, juices and loads of cooked items. Coffee was fresh and plentiful. All the staff we so helpful and friendly something I think is hard to find these days. The bar looked nice but we never tried it and the lobby was ok not as grand as some hotels we have stayed in this class but you donâ€™t spend much time in the lobby do you?! I also felt it was a real shame that they had not worked with the old buildings they had a little better rather than making it look like a (60's/70's) new build in parts. Hated the smoke everywhere thing but it was no smoking at breakfast and we had a non smoking room so it did not cause us much of a problem. All in all a great choice and would definitely recommend to others :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dazcrouch
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent and well maintained hotel. What I would expect from such a large chain. There was in house parking, which was convenient, the staff were very helpful and made the stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “noisy room”
Reviews.Author: 6DIVE
Reviews.Content: nice roome, but we ask for a quiet one, and all day long, even the morning of our departure at 8, there was a terrible noise from drilling. the floor was being renovated and though the hotel was not fully booked, we had a room in the same place where the floor was renovated. very hard to be waked up by a drill at 8am. We won't return to this hotel despite a wonderfull breakfast. during checking out, the intern just appologize and did nothing for us. A note in the room from the Gm says guests are invited if they are not satisfied... the front office manager could apply the chain policy...not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moen
Reviews.Content: We were going to Amsterdam for a weekend. This hotel was chosen due to its location and recommendations by Tripadvisor. We checked various booking websites recommended by Tripadvisor and found the best price at the Radisson website. The hotel was nearly fully booked and we had to accept a suite for 300 Euro a night! We arrived at Schipol and decided to travel by the shuttle service Connexion, as we were warned by rip off prices by taxies. This transport was ok, but we would consider a taxi or the train next time. On the return the hotel arranged a taxi for 38 Euro (ask the receptionist). The hotel location and service is great. We were given an early check in and the suite was fantastic. Bed was comfy. Bath room were nice. There was a safe, mini bar, espresso machine (hard to figure out how it worked though) and a LCD TV with enough channels. The breakfast (included in the price) was the best we have ever had in a hotel. We did not eat dinner at the hotel as there were many restaurants near the hotel. Walk out the door, turn left against the canal and left again. Within 100-300 meters there were lots of eating possibilities. Behind the hotel is the Red Light District, packed with tourists and safe. The fantastic Zoo is within walking distance. Would stay here again, but will try to get a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson SAS Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJSally
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a really pretty tree lined street and close enough to walk to Central Station and Dam Square. The lobby is pleasant, and comfortable with a comp coffee/tea machine. The breakfast buffet is around 21 Euro, but worth treating yourself to...absolutely wonderful! The room was clean and comfortable. The staff were very accommodating. Would definitely consider this hotel when I return to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KK78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson SAS in Amsterdam from 2-4 June. We arrived very early on 2 June, but were able to get early check in. The room was clean and big. We had a view of inside the hotel atrium, which was cool. The room had a minibar (although I would recommend purchasing beer/soda/water outside the hotel as the prices were a little above average), kettle with coffee/tea, iron and ironing board, safe, and the bathroom has shampoos/soap/body wash and a blowdryer. The employees were also very helpful with local information. We ate breakfast one morning at the hotel for â‚¬35 for two people, but there was a big buffet selection of omelets, eggs, breads, pastries, cheeses, meats and sides, etc. We also ordered room service one night (again, the prices a little above average), but the food was good and the service was pretty quick. The hotel location was very convenient and in a good, safe area. It was close enough to walk everywhere, we didn't use the tram once, but then again we had excellent weather. It's a few blocks from the Red Light District and Dam Square, but far enough that it wasn't a touristy area. There's also a "coffeehouse" right across the street. We found an excellent traditional Dutch restaurant, Claes Claesz, near the Anne Frank House. Much better than the highly recommended D'Vijff Vlieghen and half the price for better food, plus on the weekend they have an excellent piano player. Also, make a visit to the Pancake Bakery! Overall I would recommend this hotel even though it is a little pricey, but for me the location, cleanliness and friendliness of the hotel staff were far more important than the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Radisson SAS”
Reviews.Author: jillybeansan
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Radisson. The hotel staff were friendly and quite helpful. The rooms were of adequate size. The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from Dam Square and one block from the Red Light District -- just to give you a point of reference! The breakfast buffet was quite good as compared to your average breakfast buffet. We would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: PrivyChamber
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute trip, so I had no time to delve into Amsterdamâ€™s boutique hotels and decided to go with an American style chain. We were not disappointed. The Radisson is a nice hotel with a courteous staff. They made arrangements for cabs, placed reservations, and handed out maps with a smile. Even though the service was impersonal, it was excellent. The room was large, clean, comfortable and in good repair. The closet was larger than most with adequate space. The bathroom was marble and the gently heated floor was great. The shower was a wall mounted American style. A hand held is also available. The bed was a true king and very comfortable with a down comforter. The only gripe I had was the lack of a top sheet. At first we thought it was an oversight by housekeeping. By night three there still was no top sheet. You may have to ask for one. The in-room coffee is no charge although itâ€™s instant. The mini-bar is pressure sensitive meaning if an item is picked up, itâ€™s automatically charged to the room. Wifi unlimited internet access is included with the room rate and itâ€™s easy to sign on. The location of the hotel is walking distance to most sites in Amsterdam. Numerous restaurants and shops are close by and there is one coffee shop right across the street. I recommend this hotel. Tips: Taxi cabs are reasonably priced (for a major city) The bicycles are everywhere, kind of like China. They donâ€™t like to slow down for pedestrians. Watch for bikes first, then cars and busses, then the tram. Money changing at the train station offers reasonable rates without excessive commissions and fees. Some shops and restaurants require customers to ring the bell for entry. If the door is locked, check for a doorbell. The people are friendly and for the most part speak excellent English. Holland is a permissive society. If you have problems with cigarette smoke, prostitution, or marijuana, go elsewhere. Smoking is allowed in most restaurants and public places. There are no designated sections.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Sharkattacks
Reviews.Content: Came back form this hotel last Sunday. I would not rate this hotel as a 5 star. It is a nice hotel and in a quiet location close to plenty of action. We got a deluxe room which was tiny. Excellent hot and cold buffet style breakfast. We paid â‚¬350 for a room for 2 nights which wasn't too bad so no problem with value for money but just don't expect a seruisly luxury 5 star hotel. Excellent Coffee shop across the road!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: tg13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in excellent location not on top of everything . It is located between red light and flower market so easy to see all the sights by walking just make sure you take flat shoes!! The hotel staff were very helpful and went out of their way to help us. The rooms were clean and tidy and the beds were lovely and soft. Got to say that this hotel was great value for the money and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maytraveller24
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Reception staff were exceptional especially jeffrey, as were the breakfast staff. Perfect Location.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Hawk9031
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. After spending nearly an hour and a half trying to find it (the directions the hotel offers are ridiculously nondescript,) I ended up pleasantly surprised with the location. On Rusland, right across the street from a fairly famous coffeeshop sharing the same name, the Radisson is right in the middle of central Amsterdam but somehow just tucked away conveniently enough to make you feel as though you are in a much quieter and distant area of the city. The Red Light District is less than a 5 minute walk, Dam Square and the Damrak 10 minutes ... of course, everything is much quicker on bicycle (and there is a perfect place to lock-up right across the street.) As mentioned by another reviewer I had no problems with an extremely early check-in (around 9AM), and although my room was somewhat less than what I've come to expect from the SAS brand, it was still bigger than most in Amsterdam. The beds were extremely comfortable and clean, mini-bar well stocked, and hotel relatively absorbent of noise. There was a great deal of late night traffic throughout the hotel, though. My only complaint would have to be the staff... oozing with faux cordiality to the point where it made you uncomfortable to walk through the lobby. The concierge was a joke and more interested in a tip than actually providing any information of substance. All in all I would definitely consider staying here again, although if you are willing to spend a little more the Hilton Amsterdam is the far superior of the two.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sombochris
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Radisson. As Ususal service was very courteous and efficient. The reception area appears to be situated in an enclosed Amsterdam street, a massive glass covering encloses the central portion. This gives the central focus of the hotel a very spacious feel and affords the visitor a pleasant break from the almost persistant rain. The hotel feels like a safe minuture town, quite a contrast to much of Amsterdam. The bar has a crows nest, remember you have to come down again!!!!! Bedrooms:- we got a Business suite and an adjoining room, for the 3 Kids. Electric roller blinds are more fun than any gameboy advance. No breakfast was included, we paid the hotel direct. Good location with pleanty of excellent restaurants a short walk away. Though it was in the University area the behaviour of the students was exemplary. From Previous experience, it's always best to upgrade as you won't be disappointed. All hotels in Amsterdam are pricey anyway, you get what you pay for. Will use it again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterDaisy
Reviews.Content: Spent Saturday night at the hotel. It was one of the few hotels in Amsterdam that offered a third bed in the hotelroom for our daughter. Good quiet location. Easy check in. Very comfortable room (business class offered free movies, dressing gowns, coffee machine, one free drink at the bar etc). Hotel very clean and tidy. Excellent breakfast - lots of hot and cold selections (not all room rates include breakfast so watch out). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and the most comfortable mattress!”
Reviews.Author: Waterbabie
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my partner and I and another couple went to Amsterdam for the weekend. As the accommodation had been taken care of by the guys I was a bit weary! However, I was very happy to find that we were staying at the Radisson. This was the first time I've ever stayed at this chain and it was a great experience. Service was good, the hotel bar was a cool venue (although lacking a bit of atmosphere), and the rooms were fantastic! I think my partner and I had the best sleep we've had in years! We were in the deluxe room and the bed was huge but amazingly comfortable! I would go back again just to sleep on that mattress! The hotel was in a very central location only about a 5-10 minute walk to the Dam and about 15 mintues to Anne Frank's House. I highly recommend a stay here at this hotel! It was also very good value for money - the price was 106 GBP but through a friend we were able to get a corporate discount.

Reviews.Title: “A very happy stay!”
Reviews.Author: pwoconnor
Reviews.Content: We had a truly wonderful stay at the Radisson. My wife and I can be can be tough critics but were quite pleased. The value was also great. The room was nicely appointed and extremely functional. My wife made many commnets throughout our 4 night stay about how "cute" and "smart" the room was. Because we were on the top floor, the bathroom was located at the bottom of a small flight of stairs (as was the entry way) and the room was set above both, with a nice city view. As I mentioned, the room was very functional with many nice features such as reading lights, a master on/off light switch by the bed, trouser press, tea pot etc. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. There was also plenty of room for clothes. Room service was good as was the breakfast in the restaurant. The staff were friendly and helpful as is almost everyone in the city. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Marko76
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed over a year ago, I can still remember this hotel very well. Firstly, it was not the cheapest place to stay in Amsterdam, but since we had such a great stay, we shouldn't complain The location of the hotel is superb and within walking distance to many major attractions. Whether you want to visit the Museums, wander along a canal, visit the Palace or smoke a large joint then this hotel is in the perfect position. The Reception / Restaurant / Housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good (Although very busy). The housekeeping is to a very high standard. I would stay at the Radisson SAS Amsterdam on another visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: DesG
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this hotel. Cannot fault it. Close to all the best attractions. Did not eat in the hotel so I cannot comment on the restaurant. Nice and friendly staff. Had to ask for our room to be cleaned on the second day but this was done as soon as we asked. Its about time the rest of Europe copped on to themselves and banned smoking in restaurants and hotel lobbies for a start. Apart from this Amsterdam is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: EilyV
Reviews.Content: Arrived earlier than check-in allows but they had a lovely room ready for us. It was on the 6th floor and perfect for our needs. Clean, comfortable and well equipped with TV, mini bar etc. No much character but we didn't plan on being there too much. The hotel is in a great location. A quiet street just minutes from all the action. We never used a taxi in all the time that we were there which is a first for me! There is a lovely Thai restaurant called Song Wae on just around the corner from the hotel. It's very cheap and the food is amazing. Big portions and fast service. Great for people on the go! We didn't eat in the hotel at all as there are too many restaurants to choose from in the city. The candlelight cruise "[--]) is excellent. Unlimited wine and cheese in a lovely romantic setting. it is a must to see the city by night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: SPsquared
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest place to stay in Amsterdam but almost impossible to fault and worth every penny. Location in the centre, walking distance to everything but in a quiet street so it also feels relaxing. Stunning public areas (modern plus refurbished old buildings), without being overpowering. Rooms maybe a little on the small side but wonderfully furnished. Staff universally friendly and helpful; breakfast fantastic (vast choice) and bar (in the oldest bit of the building) really atmospheric, esp. by hotel bar standards. Only downside is maybe the restaurant - lacks atmosphere (and customers) in the evenings; there are many better and cheaper places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: littlemiss_h
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. I stayed their for my hen wkend. The rooms are of superb standard and the breakfasts fantastic. At the weekend they extend the time to 11.30am, which is great if you have a late night and regardless of whether you have breakfast at 8am or 11am the selection is extensive and very tasty! Would definitely return. We felt that the location was brillant. In easy walking distance of the main attractions, but tucked away enough so you weren't woken up by the busy streets in the morning. We asked the reception about getting about and good places to eat, drink and party! and they were spot on every time. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but well-located”
Reviews.Author: Jerri_Blank
Reviews.Content: The room was small, and had a terrible view of other people's windows - adjacent apartment windows. The hotel is in a convenient location, walkable to many interesting things. So for convenience, it is great. The room has older decor, old furniture. I wouldn't stay there again, but it is not terrible. I do not see why so many people give it a 5-rating, it's nothing special. Mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Get an Expedia deal and it's well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: PurpleGirl1
Reviews.Content: Went with another couple in August - their room overlooked the inner courtyard / zen garden and apparently was very pleasant. Ours was on the 3rd floor with old original beams - it was lovely! Ask for room 326! Simple, practical and very very clean. Staff were friendly enough at check-in / out but we didn't really have anything to do with staff apart from that. I would say - put your 'Do Not Disturb' sign on unless you are up and about early... they will keep knocking!! FABULOUS location - so central but still peaceful. Takes about 10-15 mins gentle walk to / from Centraal Station.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: two_viajeros
Reviews.Content: The rooms were alright and as mentioned in prior reviews a bit simple but practical. What really bothered us were the worn out beds, if you like really firm beds this is not the place to stay. After having stayed in many top hotels and also cheaper hotels we must say we were disapointed. (back pain in the morning) The check in went really well and the staff was friendly although not really enthusiastic. The main issue was the concierge, if you can really call him so. He did not know any restaurants that were not around the hotel. After asking him about some good ones (like the Altman) he just said "Yea, but we have some really good ones around the hotel, you do not need to go so far". The question was not really location but rather a nice restaurant were we could enjoy dinner. On other occasions when we called from the room he just told us to get down to the lobby so he could explain since it was easier than explaining on the phone. I am sorry but that is no 5 star service. On two occasions we asked for more coffee for the coffee mashine in the room and it took over 20 minutes and two calls to get them to our room. They even came twice after we called again. All in all it was alright but we expected more from a 5 star hotel. If you do not care so much about personal service and care about location this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: sandra_flitwick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just (reluctantly) returned from Amsterdam. We had a fabulous time, mainly because the Radisson was excellent. It really is worth going for a bit of luxury in Amsterdam, as some of the lower starred hotels are a bit grim. Location: The hotel is a short walk from Central Station and Dam Square. The area itself is fairly quiet, but very convenient for all the major attractions. There is also a shuttle bus from the airport which costs 12 euros. We walked everywhere, as it was so convenient. There is a bus-boat service which stops at the main museums and sights. Tickets are valid for 24 hours and cost 17 euros. The last trip is at 21.00, which, if its dark by then, is a lovely trip. Check -in. This was the most efficient service I've ever experienced. No waiting in long queues, even though the hotel was very busy. We were upgraded to business class and given a free bottle of red wine, which was a lovely surprise. The staff are really friendly, efficient and attentive. The Room: We were given an upgrade to a Business room. My first impression was that the room was a little basic, but everything is hidden away very cleverly. The decor is modern wood, and each room has a subtle theme; ours was maritime. The rooms have an iron, ironing board, safe, dressing gowns, slippers, icebucket, mini-bar, wi-fi, broadband, and an excellent tea and coffee maker and hairdryer. The air conditioning was quiet and worked well. The rooms were spotlessly clean and well maintained. Dining: Breakfast in the main restaurant was excellent. There is a full selection of cooked breakfasts and chef can prepare an omlette. There is also a good selection of healthy options such as cererals, pastries. yoghurts etc. Freshly squeezed orange juice was always available. I highly recommend the restaurant for an evening meal. The service and food were exceptional and it was a real fine dining experience. They have a salad menu, healthy options and a la carte. Bread rolls are served with a selection of sun-dried tomato, olive oil, balsamic vinegar and lightly salted butter. The wine list was also excellent. Because of this, the restaurant is very popular, so it may be worth booking ahead. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel, we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - recommended”
Reviews.Author: widgey77
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lovely weekend break in Amsterdam, and would definitely use the Radisson SAS Amsterdam again. We had a non smoking room (no.515) which was classed as a 'deluxe' non-smoking room which had a window overlooking the lobby area. The room was a good size with kingsized bed (very comfy), and a well appointed bathroom - very pleased. We were on room only basis but there are tea & coffee making facilities in the room, and air-con which was a must for the very hot weather we are all enjoying this year. Other facilities in the room included: hairdryer, iron, trouser press, satellite tv, mini bar, free broadband (wifi) and room service 24 hours. The Pastorie Bar, which opens at 5pm, is located in the old vicarage just off the lobby and this is a very elegant place to enjoy a drink and snack. The cocktails are expensive though at 12Euros each. We dined in the De Palmboom restaurant on our last evening, very nicely decorated in neutral colours and offers a very pleasing menu with specials avaialble which were a selection of summer salads. This was probably our best meal so would recommend to those who enjoy an evening of fine dining. Location of the hotel is perfect - within 5mins walk of the red light district and about 10mins to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Mkeyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights to celebrate our son and daughters university graduations, we were well pleased with our choice. The Radisson is in a great location easily accessible by a short walk over some delightful canals and side streets for the Dam Square and Rembrandtplein areas. Okay, you know you are staying in a hotel which is part of a large world wide chain but with it you get reliablility and consistant high standards. Our deluxe rooms on the fifth floor were spacious, furnished with quality fixtures and enormous beds. The leisure centre is tucked away and somewhat un-inviting, reception and check out were efficient and friendly, the breakfast buffet has tremendous variety and the staff are friendly and helpful. It was a pleasure to return each night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M_ALondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and very much enjoyed this hotel. It has many great facilities and is in a good (and quiet) location. Rooms are nice and the lobby is very attractive. Breakfast was exceptional however a bit expensive at â‚¬22 each. I would probably stay here again if returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Radisson - Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: redspelly
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 nights in Amsterdam, staying at the fantastic SAS Radisson. The hotel is beautiful, mixing modern and historic architecture. There is a 16th century vicarage within the "lobby" of the hotel, and it is now used as a bar, it is luxurious but they have managed to keep the character of the old vicarage - well done for that. We were on the 2nd floor and had a fantastic room - every room has a theme and ours was "Old Dutch", it was sumptuous and extremely comfortable. the service from the staff at the hotel was exceptional, nothing too much effort. Special mention goes to Marc Horsmans, Director of Sales, he was exceptional, treated us magnificently. The Dutch are extremely polite, curteous people and Marc was a great example of this. He couldn't do enough to make our stay there the wonderful experience it was.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: IanrJones10
Reviews.Content: I quite liked this hotel. I completely agree with one reviewer's comments about the hotel restaurant being busy at breakfast though, and at 22 Euros each for brekkie, it is not cheap. I stayed in a room facing the street, and there were no problems at all. The staff are friendly and helpful. Minor irritations are 1) Take anything out of the minibar, even to read the wrapper, and you will be charged automatically 2) Smoking is allowed in the foyer area. Plus points are 1) great location 2) great bar, with plenty of olde worlde atmosphere 3) friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “would definately return”
Reviews.Author: annekr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Radisson. Very central hotel. Stayed in a 'deluxe' room on 6th floor with views of the roof tops. These rooms are apparently smaller than the executive ones but were fine - spotless, comfortable, bathrobes etc. Rate did not include breakfast but at check in we were offered a deal to include it which we did. Tried to book a recommended restaurant one night but couldn't get in so concierge recommended and booked another which was within walking distance and great. Only complaint was the tobacco smoke in reception - but we found that to be a problem wherever we went in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: V0yager
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Radisson for 5 nights which incorporated a 3 night stay for business and a 2 night stay as a tourist. The hotels greatest asset is its great location in a nice quiet street close to the city centre. Everything you'd want to see as a tourist (museums, cafes, parks, churches etc) is within a 15 minute walk (maximum). As such you donâ€™t need to worry about using trams or busses to get around. Unfortunately the rest of the hotel is pretty average. It's really a business hotel and as such has no real atmosphere and when you are in your room it feels like you could be anywhere. The rooms are of good size and they're clean and tidy. The staff were also polite and helpful. The only real complaint I would have is that the restaurant for this hotel is quite small in comparison for its size and as such it does get a bit hectic at breakfast time. The quality of the breakfast once you had found a table was good though. All in all, an average business type hotel saved by a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice nough”
Reviews.Author: rhodeweary
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in February. Rooms were available at 9am when we arrived, which was terrific. Free wireless internet, coffeemaker in the room, nicely appointed bath. Bed was decent, comfortable. Breakfast buffet was definitely a cut above. Location terrific. Good place - definitely has a 'business hotel' feel.

Reviews.Title: “5* Hotel without a doubt!!”
Reviews.Author: bella82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raddison with my boyfriend for 3 nights and we had a fantastic time. I work as a Conference Co-ordinator in a hotel in the UK and therefore I am really used to hotel life and I really couldnâ€™t pick fault with the Raddison at all. Reception area, was very welcoming and friendly, very organised, the bar area off reception had lots of character - two nights after being out for the evening we ended up having are last drink of the evening there!! Our room was really large and spacious; the bathroom was gorgeous and so clean!!!! - housekeeping standards were excellent, they really did clean the room very well everyday, even to the extent where I did feel slightly sorry for the housekeeper, who had to keep moving all of my makeup to wipe the bathroom sink area and then replace it all very neatly!! The Restaurant was un-believably good, during our stay in Amsterdam we also visited Jamie Oliverâ€™s Restaurant 15, but I do have to say that the hotels restaurant met the same quality, we had a delicious meal!! The location of the Radisson is also excellent, situated right by Dam Square - all of Amsterdam main attractions were only a stone's throw away!! I will definably be using Raddison Again - Very impressed - The Hotel staff there should be very proud

Reviews.Title: “Worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: sean-tKerryIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for a two night midweek break. The reception area and lobby is unique and beautiful. Staff are efficent,friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Housekeeping could have been a little more thorough on things like restocking up with shampoos,towels and teas and coffees etc. All in all a fine hotel in a great location. reasonably good value for money. If you can get a deal I would definately say go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Dank U!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam. Radisson was lovely. Rooms weren't massive but they were very functional and comfortable, and little extras like a heated bathroom floor, and bathrobe and slippers made all the difference. The staff were great (as was everyone in Amsterdam)- pleasant and helpful, but not in-your-face. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson SAS in Amsterdam on our honeymoon. We didn't really know how much our room rate was since it was paid for by someone else as a wedding present. But our room was decent. We requested a king or at least a double bed. and we were surprised to find 2 twins pushed together. We travelled to italy after visiting Amsterdam and it was the same thing, so I guess it is a European thing. The room was small. But we hardly stayed in the room except at night to sleep. So we didn't really mind. The shower and bathroom were very modern and well cleaned. The hotel is centrally located. We never took a cab or subway and was able to walk to all the major attractions. It is on a quiet street so noise level at night is not a problem. The one thing i noticed was a lack of concierge service. It seems like the people working the front desk were also doubling as concierge. nevertheless, they were very polite when we asked for maps, directions, and dining recommendations. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Amsterdam the SAS Radisson”
Reviews.Author: jennymaggie
Reviews.Content: Great location away from the crowds but central to everything. Clean, friendly great service. We up graded as we were there for a special occasion and the room was lovely not large but one of the best we have stayed in at a capital city. The food was outstanding they have fantasic stews! Pleanty to eat for breakfast with fresh orange juice from actual oranges. We will definatly go back. We loved Amserdam as well.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights--nice hotel--wonderful location--facility is clean and up to date--lovely bar and lounge area constructed from a previously built 400 year old home--the food was above average for a hotel--one could argue that by US standards it is a four star not five star hotel but does it really matter--reasonable rates--not grand or showy but a nice comfortable place that I feel certain will please.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise...”
Reviews.Author: mistopheles
Reviews.Content: I stay in Amsterdam a lot with work and tend to stay at the Jolly Carlton, NH Doelen, NH City Centre and others; I've seen the SAS from the outside many times and always assumed it would be a dull corporate hotel full of sheltered elderly tourists. How wrong I was. I get a good rate through my company so throught I'd try it for a change, mostly because it's only a 3 min walk to my favourite area of the Niewmarkt (Newmarket) with its excellent Thai restaurants, chilled bars and coffee shops...and only 4 mins walk to Dam Square, 10 mins to Central Station and, if it's your cup of tea (it's not mine, but fun to see if you're a first time tourist I guess), one bridge away from the Red Light district. Anyway, as soon as you walk into the hotel you can tell it's something special. A huge (in European standards) 7 or 8 story atrium, a funky check-in area made up of 4 standalone reception 'lecturns' a great looking raised, dark and almost New York style bar and an overall feeling of Phillip Starke design (it isn't one of his though). I got room 51 which was cool too...you open your room door and immediately go down some curved steps down into your sunken room with exposed wooden beams, a big skylight above the bed for star gazing, a funky bathroom, plenty of space and a window overlooking the quiet street below (no canal views here I don't think). Oh and FREE wireless broadband connection in the room for guests too. You can also get rooms looking over the atrium with an inside view. I didn't eat there, but what I saw looked good. And the coffee shop over the road is one of the best I've found in the 'Dam (if that's you thing too) - good selection of special cakes and very friendly too. If you're looking for somewhere different in Amsterdam and can find a good rate (below 140 Euro) then you won't be disappointed with its style and location. A new fave of mine.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location for a weekend in Amsterdam. Great breakfasts. Good reception staff - we arrived at 9am and they found us a room that was available for immediate check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: G&JV
Reviews.Content: The usual Radisson good quality. great service, delicious food and very comfortable rooms. Ideal location for central Amsterdam sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromBelsizePark
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam hotels are not up to scratch compared to Paris or London or NYC. They lack grandeur, cleanliness, facilities and are poor value. But the Radisson is one of the best. I paid 199 euros a night off their website. Largish rooms. Bathrooms though are just acceptable for the price - not huge. The hotel is split in 2 parts so you have to walk across the indoor underpass if you are not in the main block. The bedroom was in neutral colours, had a decent sized TV, and good airconditioning - other hotels in Amsterdam can be unbearably hot. The bar and restaurant are excellent - for Amsterdam. Room service is very good indeed - a great burger and pizza and reasonably priced. No pool, but there is a sauna and small gymn. I lived in Amsterdam about 20 years ago and the city has become a haven for backpackers and 'cheap' tourists only really interested in the 'coffee shops'. And standards and clientele in many hotels and bars and restaurants reflect this now. But the Radisson is a haven from all that with largely business and up market tourists. Therefore, no slamming doors or noise at night. Location is very good, except it can feel a bit dodgy late at night walking back as it is off a side street near the red light district, so you do bump into a few unsavoury sorts. Overall, for Amsterdam, this is a modern, smart, calm and peaceful hotel. And represents good value for this city. Staff were great - friendly but unobtrusive. I will stay again. But I do think that the Crowne Plaza is that bit better because it has a pool, but is not as centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location - canals all around - walking distance to all the tourist sites - museums, restaurants, red light district, train station, etc etc. Nice mix of old and new architecture. Good service, tasty breakfast. Nice all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location between two canals”
Reviews.Author: CAGRAY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson for 4 nights before leaving on a cruise. When we pulled up to the hotel, I was sure we were in the wrong place, as the outside is not imposing like some hotels. But the lobby was very nice, with 3 check-in desks, a concierge desk and a small boutique. The staff in the lobby were extremely nice and helpful and even came up to the room to show us how to access the internet. There is also a bar and restaurant. We did not use the bar because of the heavy smell of smoke. We ate every morning in the restaurant(free because of the rooms we were in) and I would say it was the best breakfast buffet I have ever had the opportunity to eat in--the fresh orange juicer was fabulous! We ate dinner once at the restaurant at night. The food was outstanding and the service impeccable. Our rooms were in the building across from the building housing the lobby. To access them, one takes the elevator to the -1 floor, walk across a carpeted room, and take the elevator up. We were on the 4th floor. We had business rooms decorated in an Asian style. The rooms were smallish and the window sills were so high you couldn't see the street. Perhaps that was only true on the 4th floor. We only had one glitch and that was when a wedding party on our first night became too noisy on the floor above us. We were so exhausted from our trip that I fell asleep waiting for them to stop. The management agreed to move us, but it was quiet after that night. We would definitely stay at the Radisson again. It was within walking distance of the Dam Square and the Canal boats. We had Gassan Diamonds pick us up for a tour of their business which was free. We took cabs to the Rijks and Van Gogh museums and also to three restaurants in different parts of the city. One day we took a half-day tour of the working windmills outside of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 18th September for our second wedding anniversary I upgraded to an executive room which was out of this world everything you could think of you opened the door to a little landing with a small spiral stairs down to the enormous room with a sofa and two comfortable chairs and the biggest king size bed I've ever seen. Bath robes and slippers were there with an excellent mini bar even the T.V was on saying welcome Mr ***** . They even sent a complimentery bottle of wine up to us. A great Hotel not too far from the train station very friendly staff will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great - we are going back in 3 days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great great great. We are going back in 3 days (2nd time this year).

Reviews.Title: “Good location without the noise”
Reviews.Author: MiaG
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Radisson for 2 nights 12-14 August 2005. We had a "deluxe" room on the 3rd floor (no.328) at the back of the hotel. The room was in character with the older parts of the building and had a beamed ceiling with four windows (2 low down and 2 up high into the ceiling). We had a queen size bed, two armchairs, a table, TV, bedside units, a desk and chair, fridge, safe, tea/coffee making facilities, smallish wardrobe and a disappointingly small marbled bathroom (although it was clean and fully functioning). The public rooms and restaurants in the hotel were lovely. The structure of the building and view down into the lobby from our floor was impressive. The central areas around reception were particularly good. These facilities I would rate 4 star however the room, although nice, was not deluxe or 4 star quality.. maybe a 3+ The location of the hotel was good. Central (about 15 mins walk from the Centraal station) yet far enough away from the noise. We walked up to the Nieuwmarket area and all around the City with ease. We were also located quite close to the main shopping areas and within walking distance from the notorious red light district (one to avoid near to midnight if you don't like crowds of over enthusiastic men on stag nights!) The hotel restaurant was simply decorated. It was bright and slightly lacking in intimacy or atmosphere during the evening. Dinner in the hotel was excellent even bearing in mind the lack of atmostphere. My choice of sole with scallops and prawns on a bed of brown rice was delicious. The liquer coffee at the end rounded off a perfect gourmet treat. The same dining area was used for breakfast and at that time of day it didn't matter about the lack of ambience. Breakfast itself was good. Plenty of fresh fruit, pastries and cakes, bread/rolls, meat, cheeses, eggs, mushrooms, tomatoes, pancakes, potatoes etc. There was a fresh juice maker which made surreally zesty, refreshing orange juice right before your eyes. Although it took about 3 oranges to make a small glass it was excellent! The hotel bar was dark and atmospheric but extremely expensive. At check in I had one drink there and was charged over 24 Euro for it! It was even more expensive than the mini-bar in the room. Far too over priced for the hotel bar. Not the right way to encourage their guests to use it. Staff at the hotel were generally friendly and welcoming. There was a slight problem when we checked in but that was resolved instantly by the manager. If you wish to take advantage of the hotel transport to the airport you will need to book it 2 hours in advance. However, I'd recommend you get the train. For only 3.40 Euros each it's a bargain and the easiest way to ensure you don't miss check in. As it was only a short trip we didn't get time to try out the other hotel facilities (beauty salon, sauna etc).

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than 6 times over the last 4 years and I have always been treated very well. One time my mother and 2 brothers met me in Amsterdam and I had a hard time finding them a room, it was August, anyway the SAS Manager upgraded my standard room to a JUNIOR SUITE for the same price as the cheapest room. They also provided us with extra bed for free so my brothers wouldn't have to sleep on the floor. That is beyond any expectation that I had, although I cannot remember the managers name, he wore glasses and was in his late 30's. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Satisfied Bob

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant - everything”
Reviews.Author: Emmos
Reviews.Content: Had a long weekend over 04/05 New Years with some girlfriends and we got a huge Executive Suite, which could sleep four. An absolutely huge bed, all the amenties you could want - minibar, iron, tea & coffee, cable TV, bathrobes, free newspaper, room service (which was v v yummy). Lovely fresh soft towels delivered everday. The staff were v friendly. The location is great - we were able to walk to the red light district and shopping district, also to the nightclub Escape where we spent NYE. The sauna was v relaxing too. The free breakfast was great - all you could eat, wide variety and perfect for a hungover stomach. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer service and RUDE!”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatWhiteWay
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I was not expecting anything approaching 5 star quality and I did not get it. The room was clean and more like a 3-4 star quality. The services at the hotel were not exceptional but all this would have been fine as my expectations had been set low. However our last night in the hotel, we were informed there would be no water the following morning. The note simply said sorry and if guests wanted, they could go down to the front desk and ask for bottled water. (Am I alone in thinking that a hotel of any class, let alone five star, would automatically bring these to each room and place them in the bathroom?) Obviously I was not impressed with a hotel without running water and upon checkout I said I expected some form of compensation for my inconvenience as I had paid for a room with basic services which includes running water. At no point did I specify what compensation, just simply that I expected something. At this point, all they need have done is something token but, alas, that was not to be. I was told I would need to speak to the manager. I had to queue again to speak to a manager who basic attitude was, tough. He further said I should have told them the night before and they would have arranged alternative accomodation. Notwithstanding the inconvenience, this was not offered by the hotel. I persisted in asking for some type of compensation and reminded the manager of the hotel policy emblazoned on cards in the room of "100% satisfaction" He scoffed at this and said it was too bad. Frustrated I said I would take up the issue later with Radisson. I then gave him my credit card to pay. He snarled at me and told me he didn't have a register there (3 feet from a register) and I would have to queue yet again. You would think he would have enough sense not to further exacerbate the situation. And for the record I was on crutches with impaired mobility. Shockingly rude and poor customer service combined with a mediocre property. Why stay there?

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff Ruins Radisson Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in the Radisson on April 15th 2005. I made the booking on the Radisson website and the rate we received was charged in advance, it was deducted from my credit card before we actually stayed. On checking into the hotel they confirmed the bill had been prepaid. The hotel is in a great location, however the decor is very dated and doesn't compare well to other Radissons I have stayed in. On check out we gave our room number to the desk and he began to charge for the room, I explained it had already been paid in advance and as we had no extra's there was no charge. An exchange ensued and the clerk insisted unless I produce my credit card bill showing the debit he would charge my card. To cut a long story short the guy had looked up the wrong room number, and when he looked up the correct number he realised his error. Not that he was going to admit that or apologise. When I asked him was he going to apologise he refused, saying myself and my boyfriend had given him the wrong room number! I asked to speak to the manager he just pointed in the distance and I had to find him myself. If you want rude service then I'd recommend the Radisson in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nat89
Reviews.Content: The location is great- you can walk to anywhere it's surprising how close you are to the center, even the red light district, without knowing it at all. The environment of the hotel was quite sophicicated but welcoming staff were really helpful and friendly. We never usually eat in the hotel we're staying in but after walking most of the city in the day we were tempted by the menu and succumed to eat at the hotel- it was really good! We got an upgrade to a business class room, this seemed quite common if they have the space and the room was comfortable, just didn't have quite enough lights for the evening so the room was a bit darker than I'd like it- big windows for the day time though. We came to the hotel partly as they were doing an offer, again this seems quite common for the weekends. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night, and this hotel provided everything I could ask for. I arrived very early and check in was no problem. The location is central to everything you would want to do in Amsterdam, but remains on a very quiet street. The staff was extremely curtious and knowledgeable. My room was very large, with high ceilings and huge bathroom (for Europe). Extremly pleasant stay, would recommed for all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blazegeorgia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson SAS in Amsterdam for one night on Saturday 4th June 2005 with my brother. Check-in went smoothly - very fast and efficient service. Only downside was people smoking in reception of the hotel but this seems to be the norm in the Netherlands. Hotel is ideally located, within a 5-10 minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station (which is around 10-15 minutes by rail from Schipol airport). Nearby attractions include Dam Square and several Canal Tours. Plenty of Bars, restaurants and shops nearby but location is far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be relaxing. Our twin deluxe room was ideal - non-smoking located on the fourth floor, very clean and modern. Room was a decent size and bed very comfortable and clean. Bathroom was excellent with a powerful, hot shower. A lack of English speaking tv channels in the room but didn't go on holiday to watch tv! Would definately stay again - the ideal getaway for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the SAS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SAS Amsterdam April 21st for 3 nights. The Hotel is clean and modern (not charming). Check in was easy and the staff was pleasant. Our room was very clean and our beds were VERY comfortable. We had an obstructed view of a canal and were directly across from an office window, but that was not a big deal since we spent little time in the room during the day. My favorite thing about our room was the heated marble floor in the bathroom and the king size bath sheets. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as it was a little pricey for us, instead we went to many of the nearby cafe's. The location was nice because it was in a quiet area, but I wouldn't brag about an "excellent" location as it isn't so central. A cab ride from Centraal Station was $10 Euros (10 minutes), so I wouldn't try to walk to the hotel if you have heavy luggage as other reviewers suggest. Overall a nice stay. I would stay here again, but would probably not pay more than $175 EU per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: georgianativeZ4
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Our room had a teriffic view of a canal, however, smelled of cigarettes (not unusual for Amsterdam). The room decor was dated but comfortable. The staff was polite and very helpful. The breakfast was pricey but the food was very good. Overall, we were pleased and would stay there again because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: StephenpIreland
Reviews.Content: Tend to agree with other reviewers. Would rate this hotel as a 4 star rather than 5 star. However, for the price we paid through their own web site, shouldn't really complain. Good location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but not 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albionfan
Reviews.Content: Been to Amsterdam before, but not this hotel..pretty much agree with previous revue though. Me and my g/f went to Amsterdam 1 to 3rd April,and the hotel was just like a modern rep type of hotel found in England....NEVERTHELESS...at approx Â£100 per night per room the prices was not expensive(for Amsterdam) either Its a very good location...and the room was a Maritime style,but the bathroom was a bit "pongy"...(nothing to do with the "cake " i ate!!!! Overall,we would stay there again at the price...just dont expect 5 star .....think 3 star and you will not be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star or value for money”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidays2006
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdam and I have to say this hotel was the worst part of the trip. The location was good (but eveywhere is within walking distance in Amsterdam) and the staff helpful, however this is nopthing like a 5* hotel. The room decor was like something from the 80's or possibly a cheap travel hotel that you find next to a motorway, and the bathroom was very worn and old looking. The complimentary toiletries were cheap and nasty, blending well with the room. We stayed in a superior double room overlooking the road which cost Â£106 and did not even include breakfast, all I felt was we were completley ripped off with this hotel, and I have to say I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in Amsterdam for 3 days in August 2004. This hotel was very much worth the value. Since, walking was our main mode of transportation, we were very pleased with the location. We were able to walk from the train station to the hotel. And everything was so close to our hotel, we had not one complaint. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathroom were big enough for 2 to get ready in. And the indoor garden was a nice touch and good picture spot.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Radisson SAS is in an excellent location, close to shopping centres, the Anne Frank Haus and most of the other main sightseeing places. The rooms are all individually themed, ours was orientally themed, and the hotel was very modern and clean. The breakfast buffet was also excellent. It's just a shame about some other parts of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: WicklowIreland
Reviews.Content: Having seen all the glowing reviews on this site we decided to stay at the Radisson. The rate (from the Radisson website) for the room was very reasonable - in fact we couldn't believe we were getting such a good rate for a 5 star! The reason became obvious when we saw the room as it was definitely not 5 star quality. (If you want to see real 5 star quality stay in the Grand Marina in Barcelona) Our first room (yes, we had to move) was an average size but it overlooked the central atrium of the hotel. When you opened the window you were looking out over the foyer and all the smoke from the restaurant and bar drifted in. We had to keep the window shut and air conditioning on for the first night and woke up feeling very congested. The bed wasn't particularly comfortable and the bathroom had mould around the sealant on the bath. The toilet looked dirty and limescaley. As for the toiletries, I would agree with others that they were weird. The shower gels, soaps etc were all colourful liquids contained in little glass containers with peel away lids on them so they looked like little jars of jam or something. We asked to move room the next day to a room overlooking the street so that we could have fresh air. In fairness to the staff, they are really helpful and obliging and arranged this immediately. The next room was similar (ie mouldy bath sealant etc) but slightly smaller. There was a single duvet on the double bed. A very helpful maid sorted out that issue. The room was fairly noisy at night as there was a "coffee shop" across the road and also a bit of traffic. Having said that, at least we could breathe! The restaurant had beautiful food in the evenings and was very reasonable. Again the service was excellent. Breakfasts were a bit hit and miss - fresh orange juice but powdered scrambled egg? Location-wise the hotel is about 5 minutes walk away from Dam square. Most of Amsterdam is accessible on foot anyway so the location wasn't that important. To sum up this hotel: Aspects that were 5 star- -friendliness and service of all of the staff -location pretty good -restaurant food was excellent -good bar service -good value Aspects that were not 5 star- -Room size and comfort -Bathroom was run down and sealant was mouldy -Weird toiletries -no turn down service of the bed covers or changing of towels in the evening -health club was down in the basement and you could pass between the gents and ladies changing rooms internally as they were both linked to the unisex sauna. This makes it unsafe for a female to be in there on her own as someone could walk from the gents changing room into the ladies without having to walk out into the main exercise room first. Finally, I would just say that you get what you pay for, and I felt that the price was so good that we probably only really paid the level for a 3/4 star hotel, but that was in fact the standard that we got. If I had paid 5 star prices I would have been very disappointed, but as it turns out it was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: screennamesaresilly
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how nice this hotel was, given the horrible experience I had at another hotel in Amsterdam that had the same star rating. It was really nice. Rooms were large by European standards, and the bathrooms had heated floors. Service was great, the hotel was clean--I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location. Very safe neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ignore the reviews about this hotel being in a "seedy" area. It is totally safe and a perfect central location (the only long walk you'll have is to the museum district and that's only like 20 mins). I was surprised by how cheap it was ($129 a night!) Service is amazing and amenities are quite good. I did not eat at the restaurant but the menu looked interesting. This is the only hotel I will be staying at for future Amsterdam trips. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: takethe5th
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel, good location in a quiet side street within easy walking distance of all the tourist spots and resturants. Canal cruise about 4 min walk. We stayed in the part of the hotel oposite the main hotel...lift and covered walkway to bar and resturant...Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, reasonable price, spotless room, very helpful and friendly staff. The location is convenient to everything and *not* a sketchy neighborhood (contrary to some other posts about this hotel). The breakfast buffet was terrific, although slightly overpriced. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam's best kept hotel secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with a great price!!! The rooms are spacious, clean and furnished will all the extras that one would find in a US hotel. The staff is very professional and helpful. It is in a great location, within walking distance to everything, including the red light district. If it is your first time to Amsterdam, and you are used to the comforts of hotels in the US, stay here, you will not be let down!

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Rusland 17, Amsterdam 1012 CK, The Netherlands
